instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The invincible and selfpossessed Rama entered the great forest of Dandaka and saw there a multitude of hermitages of the ascetics.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: They (the hermitages) were strewn all over with kusa grass and robes by bark with auspicious sacrificial materials around and hence dazzling like the orb of the sun in the sky difficult to gaze.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The courtyards (of the hermitages) were cleanswept, sprinkled with water and decorated. They provided shelter to all kinds of creatures and were filled all over with  flocks of birds and antelopes.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The hermitages looked glorified with dances by celestial damsels. They were  adorned with vast fire sanctuaries, ladles for sacrificial ceremonies, deerskins and kusa grass faggots for pots of water, roots and fruits. They looked delightful with huge sacred trees of the forest laden with sweet fruits.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The hermitages looked glorified with dances by celestial damsels. They were  adorned with vast fire sanctuaries, ladles for sacrificial ceremonies, deerskins and kusa grass faggots for pots of water, roots and fruits. They looked delightful with huge sacred trees of the forest laden with sweet fruits.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The hermitages where various sacrificial offerings were made reverberated with Vedic chantings. Flowers were scattered all over. There was a lotuspond with lotuses. There were aged, selfrestrained sages glowing like the Sun or the fire, living on fruits and roots, clothed in bark and dark  deerskin.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The hermitages where various sacrificial offerings were made reverberated with Vedic chantings. Flowers were scattered all over. There was a lotuspond with lotuses. There were aged, selfrestrained sages glowing like the Sun or the fire, living on fruits and roots, clothed in bark and dark  deerskin.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The hermitages echoing with  the sounds of Vedic recitations and resembling the very abode of Brahma were adorned with great, holy sages living on regulated diet.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The illustrious, effulgent Rama saw groups of hermitages adorned with venerable brahmins, with knowledge of the Supreme Spirit. On seeing them he loosened the string of his great bow and went forward.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing Rama with illustrious Sita, the great sages, richly endowed with divine knowledge, went forward to greet him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The sages, steadfast in their vows, saw Rama who was shining like the rising Moon, Lakshmana and the famed Sita went forward and received them with words of benediction.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The sages, steadfast in their vows, saw Rama who was shining like the rising Moon, Lakshmana and the famed Sita went forward and received them with words of benediction.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Those sages living  in the forest were wonderstruck to see the handsome, graceful, delicate and welldressed Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: All the foresters looked at the wonderful figures of Rama, Sita and Lakshmana with unblinking eyes.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ever engaged in the welfare of all beings, the sages made Rama, their guest, sit in their leafy hut.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The great sages comparable to the firegod and followers of righteousness honoured Rama  according to tradition by offering water.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The sages who were knowers of dharma saluted the noble Rama, offered fruits, roots and flowers available  at the hermitage and with folded palms said thus:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O king of great reputation, you are the refuge of the people, a protector of dharma, a chastiser of wrongdoers, a worshipful and respectable preceptor.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, in this world a king is considered the fourth part of Indra as he protects the people. Therefore, he is respected and he enjoys the choicest pleasures of life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Since we are the residents of your territory we deserve to be protected by you. Whether you live in the city or in the forest, you are the lord of the people and our king.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O king, we have conquered our anger and have controlled our senses. We ascetics have cast aside all our authority. We are like your children and need to be protected by you forever
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having said so, the ascetics offered with reverence fruits, roots, flowers and other forest  products to Rama and Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: After receiving hospitality from the sages, Rama took of all of them at sunrise and entered deep into the forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With Lakshmana following, Rama went through the forest, filled with herds of animals and inhabited by bears and tigers. It was a place where trees, creepers and bushes were crushed (by frequent visits of demons). It was difficult to locate a water source.  And it resounded with the chirping of various birds and insects (crickets).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With Lakshmana following, Rama went through the forest, filled with herds of animals and inhabited by bears and tigers. It was a place where trees, creepers and bushes were crushed (by frequent visits of demons). It was difficult to locate a water source.  And it resounded with the chirping of various birds and insects (crickets).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Rama along with Sita was wandering in the forest infested with  dreadful animals, he saw a roaring cannibal resembling the peak of a mountain.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He was of dreadful appearance with deep eyes, a huge face and a big belly. He looked tall, ugly and frightening.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Wearing a tigerskin, he resembled the god of death. With a wide, open mouth, wet with marrow and drenched with blood, he struck terror into  all beings.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Roaring loudly, he carried an iron spit in which were pierced three lions, four tigers, two wolves, ten deer  and the huge head of an elephant with its tusks smeared with the fat of flesh.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Looking extremely furious, he ran towards Rama, Lakshmana and Sita like the god of death rushes towards the (dying) people.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Making a dreadful sound, as if shaking the earth, he took Sita on his lap, stepped aside and said:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You both clad in bark and wearing matted hair, holding bows, arrows and swords have entered into the Dandaka forest with your wife. Your life has been cut short indeed৷৷
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: How is it that you both, dressed in the robes of ascetics, live  with a woman? Leading an unrighteous and sinful life, who are you who have brought disgrace to the ascetic discipline ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am a demon named Viradha. I move in this dense forest with my weapons eating the flesh of the sages.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This  woman of fine hips shall be my wife. You sinners I shall drink  the blood of both of you in the fight.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita, daughter of Janaka was bewildered out of fear when she heard the cruel  and boastful words of that wicked Viradha.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing the auspicious Sita in the lap of Viradha shaken out of anxiety, like a plantain tree in a strong wind, Rama with his throat parched said to Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing the auspicious Sita in the lap of Viradha shaken out of anxiety, like a plantain tree in a strong wind, Rama with his throat parched said to Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Gentle Lakshmana, see the illustrious daughter ofJanaka, a lady of good conduct,  brought up in utmost comfort caught in the lap of Viradha
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana whatever Kaikeyi desired through her boons has now come true so soon.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Kaikeyi, my middle mother is farsighted indeed  Not content with the kingdom alone see sent me, beloved of all  beings, away to the forest. Let her cherished desire be fulfilled.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Kaikeyi, my middle mother is farsighted indeed  Not content with the kingdom alone see sent me, beloved of all  beings, away to the forest. Let her cherished desire be fulfilled.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana nothing is more sorrowful to me than the touch of Vaidehi by another. It is more painful to me than the death of my father or loss of my kingdom.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As Rama was thus full of tears of sorrow, Lakshmana sighed heavily in anger like a hissing serpant in confinement. And said:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, you are, like Indra, lord of all beings. What makes you feel sad like an orphan when I am at your service like a servant?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The earth will drink the blood of Viradha with his life gone, slain by my angry arrow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Like Indra who hits the mountain with his thunderbolt, I shall release on Viradha the anger I felt against Bharata for his passion for the kingdom.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Spurred by the speed of my strong arms, my arrow will fall on his broad chest and separate his life from his body. Then his body reeling round and round will fall on the ground. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्वितीयस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the second sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Graceful Lakshmana asked  Viradha  with a smile, Who are you wandering in the forest at will ?.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Viradha with his voice filling the forest said, Instead of asking about me you both should speak out who  you are and where you are going
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Questioned by the demon, who bore a burning countenance, the highly effulgent Rama introduced his Ikshvaku family:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Know us to be both kshatriyas, endowed with a good lineage and yet moving in the forest. We both wish to know, who you are and why you are going about in Dandaka forest?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Viradha said to Rama whose truth was his strength, I will tell you who I am. O, listen:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am indeed son to Jaya. My mother is Satahrada. Verily all the demons on this earth call me Viradha.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: By the grace of Lord Brahma I was bestowed with this prowess through my penance. In this world none can kill me with a weapon nor split nor cut me to pieces.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Therefore, leave this lady and run away to the place you came from. I will not take away your life .
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With eyes reddened with anger Rama replied to the sinful, deformed Viradha:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O vile, mean creature  surely you are seeking death. Wait, you will meet it in the fight.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Rama strung his bow immediately, shot the sharp arrows at Viradha and hit him verily.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: From his bow  strung tight,  Rama shot seven swift, goldenfeathered arrows comparable to Garuda  and the Windgod in speed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The arrows tied with peacockfeathers, looking like fire, pierced the body of Viradha which, drenched in blood, fell on the ground.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hit  by Rama and Lakshmana, the enraged  demon left Vaidehi, lifted a sharp spear   and ran towards them.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demon who produced a great noise with his wide open mouth resembled the god of death. He lifted a sharp spike that looked like Indra's banner.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: And then both the brothers showered bright arrows on the demon Viradha who looked like Yama, the god of death.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demon who was extremely frightening stood there, laughing and yawning.  As he yawned, all the swiftlyflying arrows fell out of his body.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: By virtue of a boon Viradha, the demon, controlled the vital breath of his body by a mere touch and, raising the spike, ran towards the two Raghava princes.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With two arrows, Rama, the best among wielders of weapons, broke down the spike in the sky burning like fire, and resembling the  thunderbolt of Indra.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The spike, broken down by Rama's arrow, fell like a slab of mount Meru splintered by Indra's thunder.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then both Rama and Lakshmana quickly raised their swords which looked like black serpents and at once fell upon the demon who was going to strike with great force.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Struck down, the angry demon tightly caught hold of both of them under his arms and wanted to set out, carrying Rama and Lakshmana, the two unshakeable tigers among men.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama understood the intention of the demon and said to Lakshmana, Let him go his way, no need to stop him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, let the nightstalker go the way he wishes. That is, in fact, our path.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Puffed up with his own great strength, Viradha lifted them and placed them on his shoulders as though they were two children.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the nightstalker proceeded towards the forest, carrying both the scions of the Raghu race on his shouldersroaring.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing those two mightyarmed Rama and Lakshmana being carried away by Viradha, Sita started crying loudly:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The wild bears, tigers and panthers will eat me up here. O best among demons, pray take me and leave both the Kakutsthas.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing those words of  Sita, both the heroes, Rama and Lakshmana hastened to kill the wicked Viradha.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana quickly broke the left and Rama the right shoulder of that dreadful demon.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With both shoulders broken, the demon, looking like a cloud (huge and dark) fell at once on the ground like a mountain split by a thunderbolt.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Striking the demon with fists, knees and feet, both of them smit him  on the bare ground and pulverized him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Although pierced by arrows, and wounded by the two swords, and pulverized on the ground, the demon did not die.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing the mountainlike Viradha not dying though seriously wounded, illustrious Rama, guaranter of safety from fear said to Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, best among men, this demon by virtue of his penance cannot be killed with any weapon in war. Therefore, let us bury him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Dig a deep pit to bury this demon, dreadful like an elephant and emitting a fearful glow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Courageous Rama standing there put his foot firmly on the neck of Viradha and said to Lakshmana,' Dig up a crevice'.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When the demon Viradha heard Rama saying so, he said these humble words to the scion of the Kakutsthas and the best of men :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You have killed me, O Rama, a tiger among men. You are equal to Indra in prowess. O best of men, out of delusion I could not recognise you earlier.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O dear Rama, I know now you are the blessed son of Kausalya, Sita is a noble lady and a glorious soul.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am Tumburu by name,  a celestial singer of the gandharva clan. Cursed by Kubera, I got this dreadful body of a demon.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When I appealed to him, that lord of great fame (Kubera) said that I would get back my original form and ascend to heaven when Rama, son of Dasaratha, would kill me in a duel.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When king Kubera saw me absent (from duty) as I was infatuated with Rambha, he got angry and cursed me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O scorcher of enemies by your grace I am rid of the curse. Delivered from my dreadful form, I will now go to my world. May both of you fare well.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O dear, there lives Sarabhanga, a righteous sage, comparable to the Sun, at a distance of one and a half yojanas from here. Go to him at once. He will bless you with your wellbeing.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O dear, there lives Sarabhanga, a righteous sage, comparable to the Sun, at a distance of one and a half yojanas from here. Go to him at once. He will bless you with your wellbeing.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Bury me in the pit, O Rama, and proceed happily. This is a great tradition for the dead demons. Those who are buried in the pit attain heaven.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having said so to Rama, the mighty  Viradha, hit by the arrows left his body and attained heaven.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Rama heard those words, he said, O Lakshmana dig for this elephantlike demon of dreadful acts, a big pit. Having said so the mighty Rama stood firmly stamping the neck of Viradha with his foot.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Rama heard those words, he said, O Lakshmana dig for this elephantlike demon of dreadful acts, a big pit. Having said so the mighty Rama stood firmly stamping the neck of Viradha with his foot.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Lakshmana fetched a spade and dug a sufficiently big pit by the side of the great soul Viradha.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama took his foot off Viradha's neck and dropped his body with pointed ears into the pit while Viradha was groaning fearfully৷৷
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama and Lakshmana, stable and firm, brave and quick, together lifted the body of Viradha who was fierce in battle and roaring and forcibly threw it into the pit with joy.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The two princes, bulls among men, who were adept in archery saw that the great demon could not be killed by any other means. They reflected over the issue  and undertook the task of killing him with sharp weapons and buried him in a pit.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama deliberately wanted to kill Viradha with weapons. Viradha the forestranger himself revealed that it was not possible to kill him with weapons and asked Rama to bury him in a pit.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Rama, who had made up his mind after hearing him, was putting the mighty demon in the pit, the forest rang with his roar.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama and Lakshmana were happy to consign Viradha's body to the pit after killing him. They filled the pit with rocks in the great forest without fear.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On killing Viradha, the demon of terrific strength, heroic Rama embraced Sita, consoled her and said to his brother Lakshmana, glowing like fire:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This wild forest with which we have not been acquainted earlier is difficult  to pass. (Hence) let us proceed quickly to sage Sarabhanga.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama went to the hermitage of Sarabhanga, a sage with divine grace who had realised the supreme (by his penance). Thus by the side of the sage he witnessed a huge wonder.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama went to the hermitage of Sarabhanga, a sage with divine grace who had realised the supreme (by his penance). Thus by the side of the sage he witnessed a huge wonder.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama saw the lord of the gods (Indra) in the sky getting off the chariot, with his body shining brightly like the sun or the fire, followed by the gods, his feet untouched by the earth. Clad in spotless attire and adorned with shining ornaments, he was being worshipped by many greatsouls like him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama saw the lord of the gods (Indra) in the sky getting off the chariot, with his body shining brightly like the sun or the fire, followed by the gods, his feet untouched by the earth. Clad in spotless attire and adorned with shining ornaments, he was being worshipped by many greatsouls like him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Not far from that place, Rama saw a chariot, yoked with tawnycoloured horses, shining like the morning  Sun. It looked like a palewhite cloud, resembling the lunar orb.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Not far from that place, Rama saw a chariot, yoked with tawnycoloured horses, shining like the morning  Sun. It looked like a palewhite cloud, resembling the lunar orb.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama saw a pure white umbrella with a highly expensive golden staff, decorated with variegated flower garlands.While near his (Indra's) head stood a pair of exquisite ladies with fans made of yak's tail.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Many celestial singers of heaven, gods, great sages and siddhas sang with the choicest words the glory of this god stationed in the sky.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Indra was conversing with Sarabhanga, Rama saw him and said to Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Pointing at the chariot, Rama said, Lakshmana, see this wonderful, effulgent chariot endowed with grace is shining like the Sun in the sky.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Pointing at the chariot, Rama said, Lakshmana, see this wonderful, effulgent chariot endowed with grace is shining like the Sun in the sky.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The horses of Indra, who is often invoked (during sacrificial rituals) and about whom  we have heard earlier, are now stationed in the sky.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana  around the chariot stand hundreds of finest young men of about twentyfive years. Clad in red robes, they are wearing earrings, and holding swords in their hands. They have broad chests and stout arms like iron beams. Like tigers, they are difficult to overpower. They have necklaces hanging on their chests blazing like fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana  around the chariot stand hundreds of finest young men of about twentyfive years. Clad in red robes, they are wearing earrings, and holding swords in their hands. They have broad chests and stout arms like iron beams. Like tigers, they are difficult to overpower. They have necklaces hanging on their chests blazing like fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana  around the chariot stand hundreds of finest young men of about twentyfive years. Clad in red robes, they are wearing earrings, and holding swords in their hands. They have broad chests and stout arms like iron beams. Like tigers, they are difficult to overpower. They have necklaces hanging on their chests blazing like fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: These tigers among men have cheerful countenacess from which it can be deduced that the age of the gods always remains constant.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana, stay here with Sita awhile, until I ascertain who this dazzling being on the chariot is.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Instructing Lakshmana to wait , Rama  went towards Sarabhanga's hermitage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Indra (husband of Sachi) having seen Rama coming towards him, approached Sarabhanga and said this to him privately:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Here comes Rama. Before he talks to me, take me to some other place from where he may not be able to see me. He has to do a great task which is difficult for others. I can see him when he accomplishes the taste and emerges victorious.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Here comes Rama. Before he talks to me, take me to some other place from where he may not be able to see me. He has to do a great task which is difficult for others. I can see him when he accomplishes the taste and emerges victorious.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This way honouring the sage Indra, wielder of the thunderbolt, took leave of him and went to heaven in his chariot harressed with horses.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Indra departed like that, Rama with his retinue (Sita and Lakshmana) went to Sarabhanga who was sitting by the side of the firealtar (for Agnihotra).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, Sita and Lakshmana prostrated at Sarabhanga's feet. After being permitted to sit, they were invited to stay there.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter on Rama's query Sarabhanga told him all about Indra's visit:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, Indra, the bestower of boons, wants to take me to the world of Brahma,  earned by me through severe penance which is most difficult to be attained by those devoid of selfrealisation.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, the best among men you are a very dear guest to me and knowing that you are near, I will not go to the world of Brahman without seeing you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, the best of men  (only) after seeing a great, virtuous soul like you shall I go to heaven, the abode of the gods.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O tiger among men, I have conquered heavenly abodes as well as the imperishable, auspicious worlds of Brahma. Accept them all that are mine (obtained through my penance)
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To these words of sage Sarabhanga Rama, the best of men, the knower of all sastras, the scion of the Raghus replied:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O great sage, I will earn all the worlds myself if you direct me. But I need a proper dwellingplace in this forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To this request of Rama who was equal to Indra in strength, sagacious Sarabhanga said these words:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Here dwells in this forest a brilliant saint, righteous and selfcontrolled, Sutikshna by name who will look to your welfare, O Rama
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You may approach sage, Sutikshna residing in a sacred spot. He will provide you a delightful place for your stay in the forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Proceed, O Rama  in the reverse direction of the river Mandakini carrying flowers and floats. And you will reach the place.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, the best among men, this is the way. Look at me for a while, my dear, until I shed my limbs just as a snake sheds its withered slough.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the effulgent Sarabhanga, knower of mantras (magical spells) kindled the fire with faggots and after offering oblations of ghee plunged in.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then were consumed that highsouled Sarabhanga's hair on the body and on the head, the wornout skin, the bones and flesh along with blood.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sarabhanga then emerged youthful from that heap of fire, shining like a flame and looking very elegant৷৷
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sarabhanga then went beyond the worlds of the gods, of the great sages who constantly kindle sacrificial fire, and ascended to the world of Brahman.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sarabhanga, performer of sacred deeds, saw Brahma with his followers৷৷ Brahma also seeing Sarabhanga, the best among the brahmins,  welcomed him gladly. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चमः सर्गः।। Thus ends the fifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Sarabhanga attained the heaven, all the sages collected together and came to Rama whose radiance was like fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Vaikhanasas, Valakhilyas, sages who continuously wash their bodies, Marichakas Asmakuttas sages who live on leaves only, those who have teeth like mortar, Unmajjakas, those who use limbs as their bed, those who practise penance without using a bed, those who do penance in the open, unmindful of rain or Sun or wind, those who live on water only, those who penance under the open sky, those who carry on penance on high places like the mountaintop, those who recline on bare ground only, those who observe fast as a part of religious tradition, those selfrestrained men, those who mutter sacred mantras, those who constantly perform penance and those who stand under the blazing Sun in summer placing fire on four sides while performing penanceall these types of sages met Rama in the hermitage of Sarabhanga.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Vaikhanasas, Valakhilyas, sages who continuously wash their bodies, Marichakas Asmakuttas sages who live on leaves only, those who have teeth like mortar, Unmajjakas, those who use limbs as their bed, those who practise penance without using a bed, those who do penance in the open, unmindful of rain or Sun or wind, those who live on water only, those who penance under the open sky, those who carry on penance on high places like the mountaintop, those who recline on bare ground only, those who observe fast as a part of religious tradition, those selfrestrained men, those who mutter sacred mantras, those who constantly perform penance and those who stand under the blazing Sun in summer placing fire on four sides while performing penanceall these types of sages met Rama in the hermitage of Sarabhanga.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

input: Vaikhanasas, Valakhilyas, sages who continuously wash their bodies, Marichakas Asmakuttas sages who live on leaves only, those who have teeth like mortar, Unmajjakas, those who use limbs as their bed, those who practise penance without using a bed, those who do penance in the open, unmindful of rain or Sun or wind, those who live on water only, those who penance under the open sky, those who carry on penance on high places like the mountaintop, those who recline on bare ground only, those who observe fast as a part of religious tradition, those selfrestrained men, those who mutter sacred mantras, those who constantly perform penance and those who stand under the blazing Sun in summer placing fire on four sides while performing penanceall these types of sages met Rama in the hermitage of Sarabhanga.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Vaikhanasas, Valakhilyas, sages who continuously wash their bodies, Marichakas Asmakuttas sages who live on leaves only, those who have teeth like mortar, Unmajjakas, those who use limbs as their bed, those who practise penance without using a bed, those who do penance in the open, unmindful of rain or Sun or wind, those who live on water only, those who penance under the open sky, those who carry on penance on high places like the mountaintop, those who recline on bare ground only, those who observe fast as a part of religious tradition, those selfrestrained men, those who mutter sacred mantras, those who constantly perform penance and those who stand under the blazing Sun in summer placing fire on four sides while performing penanceall these types of sages met Rama in the hermitage of Sarabhanga.
