instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: All groups of sages, who knew dharma, and were upholders of righteousness reached Rama, the supreme knower of dharma, and said:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O great charioteer you are the lord of the Ikshvaku race and of the world just like Indra, chief among the gods.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are renowned in the three worlds for your valour, for your devotion to father, and in you lies enough evidence of your adherence to truth and righteousness.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lord, do excuse us. We sought your help to fulfil our needs since you are at hand. You are a great soul, knower and lover of dharma.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lord, a king who collect one sixth of the produce as tax and yet does not protect his subjects like his children commits an act of grave injustice.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, whoever protects the inhabitants of his kingdom at all times like his own son who he loves more than his own life will attain the world of Brahma and remain there for long years and will achieve prosperity thereafter.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, whoever protects the inhabitants of his kingdom at all times like his own son who he loves more than his own life will attain the world of Brahma and remain there for long years and will achieve prosperity thereafter.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: One fourth of the supreme merit a sage earns by living on fruits and roots, accrues to the king through which the people are protected righteously.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama  we are a group of great sages, mostly brahmins, leading a vanaprastha  life. Yet with a protector like you, we are slaughtered in large numbers like orphans.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Come and see  the bodies of ascetics, who had perceived the Supreme Spirit, killed in large numbers in the forest by the fierce demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A great slaughter is taking place amongst those residing on the bank of the Pampa lake, near the river Mandakini, and on mount Chitrakuta.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: We ascetics are not able to tolerate the fearful deeds perpetrated by the dreadful demons in the forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, you are worthy of refuge. Hence we have come to you seeking your protection. We are being killed by the nightstalkers. Save us.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O great warrior here on this earth there is no protector as mighty as you. So, O prince  save us all from these demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having heard this, righteous Rama of the Kakutstha dynasty said to all the ascetics engaged in penance:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You should not speak to me this way. I deserve to be commanded by the ascetics. I have not entered this forest only on a personal mission.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I came into this forest in obedience to my father's orders to repel the aggression of demons against you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I came here to acomplish your task incidentally, Therefore, my stay in the forest will yield great results.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I wish to kill in the fight the demons who are your enemies. O great ascetics, you may  witness my prowess supported by my brother.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Brave Rama, steadfast in righteousness, worthy of honour, gave assurance to protect the ascetics endowed with the wealth of penance, and proceeded towards sage Sutikshna. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षष्ठस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, the scorcher of enemies, along with his brother Lakshmana and Sita and the sages went to Sutikshna's hermitage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: After covering a long distance and crossing the river (Ganga) with plenty of water, Rama saw a huge mountain looking like a lofty cloud.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama and Lakshmana, the best of the Ikshvaku family, accompanied by Sita entered the dense forest  filled with trees all over.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Entering that dreadful forest, they saw trees full of flowers and fruits, and a hermitage in a lonely place with lines of bark robes hanging.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There at the hermitage was Sutikshna, an ascetic grown old with (long) penance, wearing soiled, matted locks and seated. Rama (first) addressed him as per custom.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O venerable one, I am Rama.You are a great sage, armed with truth as your prowess and a knower of dharma. I have come to see you. Could you speak to me?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter the composed Sutikshna, looked at Rama, the best among righteous men, and embracing him with both his arms said:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, the best among the Raghavas and among the upholders of truth, you are welcome. With your presence this hermitage will have a protector now.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O renowned hero, I had heard that you have come to Chitrakuta, renouncing your kingdom. I have been waiting so long to see you here. Unable to give up this body, I did not even leave the earth for heaven, the world of the gods.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O scion of the Kakutstha family, Indra, king of the gods came to me and said that by my meritorious deeds I have won all the worlds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O scion of the Kakutstha family, Indra, king of the gods came to me and said that by my meritorious deeds I have won all the worlds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Along with your wife and Lakshmana you may roam by my grace the worlds won by me and served by divine sages like devarsi Narada.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Selfpossessed Rama replied to the truthful ascetic who had performed intense penance. Just as Kasyapa would address Lord Brahma:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O great sage I will win all the worlds myself. I (only) want to live in this forest. Allow me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are ever engaged in the welfare of all beings. I have heard this from the great sage Sarabhanga of Gautama's clan.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus addressed by  Rama, Sutikshna, the great sage, wellknown to the world was highly delighted. He (then) said these sweet words:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama this is a salubrious hermitage where hosts of sages live and which is full of roots and fruits, you may enjoy yourself here.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O illustrious Rama, herds of animals visit this place fearlessly, enticing the inmates and (then) go back without harming any one.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When heroic Rama heard that there was no other problem from the wild animals except their frequent incursions, he lifted his bow with an arrow and said these words:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O reverend one, I will kill with a sharpedged arrow, glowing like a thunderbolt, all those herds of animals who keep coming here.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: What can be more agonizing for you (than my killing animals). I (therefore) do not foresee our long stay in this hermitage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama stopped with this. And then the evening drew to a close. Offering his evening oblation, he arranged for his stay along with Sita and Lakshmana in the delightful hermitage of Sutikshna.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama stopped with this. And then the evening drew to a close. Offering his evening oblation, he arranged for his stay along with Sita and Lakshmana in the delightful hermitage of Sutikshna.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing that the evening had passed and night had set in, the great sage Sutikshna with due hospitality, served those best of men, food fit for ascetics. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the seventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, worshipped by Sutikshna and accompanied by Lakshmana, spent the night at the hermitage, and got up early in the morning.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In the morning Rama and Sita got up in time and took bath in cool, lilyfragrant water.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: And as per routine, sinless Sita, Rama and Lakshmana offered prayers to the fire and other gods of the forest which was the refuge of the ascetics. Seeing the rising Sun, they worshipped him, and approaching Sutikshna,  said these soothing words:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: And as per routine, sinless Sita, Rama and Lakshmana offered prayers to the fire and other gods of the forest which was the refuge of the ascetics. Seeing the rising Sun, they worshipped him, and approaching Sutikshna,  said these soothing words:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O revered Sutikshna received by one so worshipworthy like you, we spent the night well. We (now)take leave of you. The sages  are hastening us.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: We wish to see the entire circle of hermitages of the sages, residing in Dandaka forest. So we are in a hurry.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: We seek your permission to go with the great sages, who are ever engaged in righteousness, selfcontrolled by virtue of their penance, and are like flameless fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: We wish to depart before the Sun grows unbearably hot like the man devoid of good lineage who acquires wealth through unlawful means (becomes arrogant). Thereafter Rama along with Sita and Lakshmana offered worship at the feet of the venerable sage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: We wish to depart before the Sun grows unbearably hot like the man devoid of good lineage who acquires wealth through unlawful means (becomes arrogant). Thereafter Rama along with Sita and Lakshmana offered worship at the feet of the venerable sage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When both Rama and Lakshmana touched the feet of Sutikshna, the best of the sages, he lifted them up, hugged them tightly, and said affectionately:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You may safely tread, O Rama, this path along with Lakshmana and Sita who is following you like a shadow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O valient Rama the sages, living in  the Dandaka forest, are self realised souls. See how delightful is the location of their hermitages.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You will see the beautiful forestareas with abundant fruits and roots, flowers in full bloom, herds of animals, flocks of quiet birds tanks and lakes filled  with clean waters and shining with fully blossomed lotuses, resounding with waterducks and peacocks  and waterfalls coming down the hills. Thus you will enjoy a delightful sylvan sight.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You will see the beautiful forestareas with abundant fruits and roots, flowers in full bloom, herds of animals, flocks of quiet birds tanks and lakes filled  with clean waters and shining with fully blossomed lotuses, resounding with waterducks and peacocks  and waterfalls coming down the hills. Thus you will enjoy a delightful sylvan sight.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You will see the beautiful forestareas with abundant fruits and roots, flowers in full bloom, herds of animals, flocks of quiet birds tanks and lakes filled  with clean waters and shining with fully blossomed lotuses, resounding with waterducks and peacocks  and waterfalls coming down the hills. Thus you will enjoy a delightful sylvan sight.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O dear Rama, O Lakshmana you may leave (now), you may have to come back to this hermitage after seeing those places.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus addressed, Rama, scion of the Kakutsthas along with Lakshmana circumambulated the sage (in reverence) and set forth.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter largeeyed Sita handed the brothers two quivers, two bows as well as two excellent swords.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Both Rama and Lakshmana  tied their auspicious quivers, took the two twanging bows and departed from the hermitage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Handsome Rama and Lakshmana, glowing in their radiance held the bows and exited  with Sita. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the eighth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Rama was leaving with the permission of Sutikshna, Sita spoke these warm, affectionate words to her husband:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This great path of dharma you are following now can be attained only through subtle means by one free from addiction born of passion.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There are three kinds of vices born out of lust. First, speaking untruth, second, having sexual relation with others' wives and third, resorting to violence with no enmity. The later two vices are of serious nature.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama you never spoke untruth in the past nor will you speak in future. How can there be any desire in you to destroy the virtue of others' wives ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, lord among men, you hadn't it (lust for other women) in the past. You havn't it now. Never does it exist even in your mind.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O prince, you are always faithful to your wife. You are righteous, truthful and obedient to your father's orders.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, you are truthful, honourable, powerful. O elder brother of Lakshmana, in you is established truth and righteousness.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O longarmed one, to contain all this is only possible for those who have conquered the senses. O handsome one, I know your ability to control the senses.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: (But) you are a victim to the third (vice born of lust) i.e. showing violence without cause for enmity
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O valiant one, you have promised to kill the demons in the battle, in order to protect the sages residing in the Dandaka forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: It is only on account of this that you entered the wellknown Dandaka forest with your brother wielding bow and arrows.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am, therefore, worried in my mind when I see you here and think of your wellbeing. I wish your ultimate good. [The next two lines appear, more or less, a repetition. So omitted : Editor]
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O brave Rama, I do not like your going to Dandaka forest. I shall tell you the reason. Do listen.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O brave Rama, I do not like your going to Dandaka forest. I shall tell you the reason. Do listen.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Of course, you will go to the forest with your brother, holding the bow and arrows. Release the arrows when you see the forestrangers.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A bow in the hand of a kshatriya is like fuel to fire. It surely swells his strength and his brilliance.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O mightyarmed one, there dwelt in the past an ascetic, noble and truthful in a sacred forest where animals and birds lived merrily together.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Once Indra, husband of Sachi, came to his hermitage in the guise of an attendant, sword in hand, in order to hinder his penance.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then while the sage was practising penance at the hermitage, he gave him that excellent sword to be kept in trust.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having received the weapon as a trust, the sage went wandering in the forest, always attentive in safeguarding the weapon.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Vigilant about protecting the sword deposited with him, the sage never moved without it even when he went gathering roots and fruits.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While the sage moved about holding the weapon, he gave up the practice of penance gradually and developed a violent mindset.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: By association with the sword, he developed a violent attitude. And in that habitual state of excitement he was dragged into unrighteous ways which (ultimately) took him to hell.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Contact with the weapon has led to this in the past. Like contact with fire, it leads man to destruction. I say this out of my love and reverence for you as a reminder and not as an instruction.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Contact with the weapon has led to this in the past. Like contact with fire, it leads man to destruction. I say this out of my love and reverence for you as a reminder and not as an instruction.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While holding a bow, you should not have the intention to kill demons residing in Dandaka with no animosity against you. O valiant one  I do not desire that any one should be killed without incurring any offence.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: It is the duty of a kshatriya, a warrior to protect with his bow those who practise selfcontrol (penance) in the forest in a state of panic.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Where is the question of wielding a weapon and living in the forest, where is the life of a kshatriya and the life of penance? For us, this is an encroachment. Let the law of the land be honoured.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lord, when we handle the weapon, the mind gets vitiated. (Only) after returning to Ayodhya can you perform the duty of a kshatriya.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You would have been on unlimited source of joy to my fatherinlaw and motherinlaw had you permanently renounced the kingdom for the life of an ascetic.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Righteousness brings wealth. Wealth brings happiness. Righteousness brings everything. In fact, the essence of the world is righteousness.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The wise earn dharma through getting their bodies emaciated by carefully adopting different means of discipline (selftorture). Happiness does not beget happiness.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O gentle one you may move in this forest of ascetics with a pure mind. The true meaning behind everything in these three worlds is known to you, indeed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having heard these words spoken by Sita who was devoted to her husband, replied Rama who was firm in righteousness.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O daughter of Janaka, you are conversant with dharma. Whatever you have admonished out of affection for me is befitting your race.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: But permit me, Devi, you have already stated, when a kshatriya holds a bow there will be no cry of distress. (it means you approve of my holding a bow)
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Sita, the sages who perform rigorous penance in Dandaka forest came to me personally, seeking shelter although they can be their own protection.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The sages living in the forest, eating roots and fruits and ever engaged in righteous activities are afraid of the depredations of the demons, with their happiness gone.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The sages engrossed in various austerities in the forest have been victims to the dreadful demons living on human flesh.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The ascetics, the best of brahmins living in Dandaka forest being eaten up like that besought me to come to their rescue.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing the words that came from their mouth, I bowed at their feet and said:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Be pleased  That brahmins like you have approached me while I should have come to you has put me to shame immeasurable .
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I enquired about what I could do for them. And all the brahmins in one voice said:.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama, the demons who can assume any form at their will are mercilessly tormenting us in Dandaka forest. Do protect us from them'.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O sinless one, these cannibals are invincible. They arrive at the time of our sacrificial rituals, on the days of festivities or at the time of lunar conjunctions like no moon or full moon days and attack us.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are the supreme refuge for us ascetics, tormented by demons, helpless men in search of shelter.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama it is difficult to perform penance which is ever full of obstacles. Therefore, we do not pronounce curses even if eaten up by demons'.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The demons, dwelling in the Dandaka forest are tormenting us. You alone are our lord in the forest. Do protect us with your brother.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O daughter of Janaka, on hearing the words of the sages I promised to undertake the entire protection of sages of the Dandaka forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having promised the sages, I cannot do otherwise as long as I have life in me. To me truth is always dear.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Sita I may forfeit my life forsake, even Lakshmana and you but will not break the promise made specially to the brahmins৷৷
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Even before the sages requested me I should have protected them. What to speak of the promise I have already made ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O sinless one all that has been said by you is out of your love and affection for me. I am pleased. What is harmful is never advised.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Your auspicious words are quite befitting your lineage. You are the follower of my dharma and so dearer to me than my life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having said this to Sita, the princess of Mithila, Rama along with Lakshmana, bow in hand, moved about the delightful penancegrove. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे दशमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the tenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by the sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama walked in front, Sita with a beautiful waist, in the middle and Lakshmana holding the bow, behind them৷৷
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Both Rama and Lakshmana walked on, accompanied by Sita, watching several beautiful mountain ranges, forests  and rivers.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: (Watching) the swans and ruddy geese on river banks and lakes full of lotuses, and birds on water and in the sky.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: (Watching) herds of deer, intoxicated horned buffaloes, wild boars and elephants who are enemies of trees (elephants uproof trees).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As the Sun was setting, they had covered a long distance, watching a yojanalong tank adorned with lotuses, and crowded with herds of elephants and flocks of cranes, swans and aquatic animals.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As the Sun was setting, they had covered a long distance, watching a yojanalong tank adorned with lotuses, and crowded with herds of elephants and flocks of cranes, swans and aquatic animals.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In that lake of clear waters they heard the sounds of songs and musical instruments, while there were none around.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Out of curiosity, mighty Rama, and Lakshmana started enquiring about the matter from sage Dharmabrata by name:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O great sage, this very wonderful sound, has whetted our great curiosity. If there is no top secret about this, do disclose it.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Great sage Mandakarni standing in water and living on air performed  rigorous penance for ten thousand years.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter very much perturbed, all the gods led by Agni gathered together at one place and started deliberating among themselves.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The gods of heaven became agitated in their minds thinking the sage might usurp one of their places.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: All the gods then engaged five of the important nymphs, glittering like lightning, to disturb the penance of the sage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The sage, a knower of the inner self and the world of plurality, was gripped by passion for the apsaras, who had come to achieve the target of the gods.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The five apsaras, got the status of wives to the sage who built them an invisible home inside the lake.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The apsaras lived happily with the sage who remained youthful by virtue of his penance.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While the apsaras played their musical instruments, their melodious songs mingled with the sounds of ornaments are heard.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Glorious Rama and his brother heard the wonderful words of the selfrealised sage and exclaimed, 'How strange '
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When the sage Dharmabrata was telling the story, Rama saw a hermitage strewn all over with kusa grass and bark garments, and endowed with pure brahminic grace.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Illustrious Rama accompanied by Vaidehi and Lakshmana entered the hermitage and, honoured by all the sages, stayed there.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, the scion of the Kakutstha race, wielder of great weapons, stayed in that beautiful hermitage, accepting the hospitality of the sages extended with due honour, He visited in turn their penancegroves where he repeated his stay.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, the scion of the Kakutstha race, wielder of great weapons, stayed in that beautiful hermitage, accepting the hospitality of the sages extended with due honour, He visited in turn their penancegroves where he repeated his stay.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama lived happily here for about ten months, there one year, here four or five or six months and there over one or half a month or three or eight months in another.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama lived happily here for about ten months, there one year, here four or five or six months and there over one or half a month or three or eight months in another.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus enjoying their stay in the hermitages, Rama, Sita and Lakshmana spent ten favourable years.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Once while sitting beside sage Sutikshna at the hermitage Rama humbly addressed him:

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hearing the words of Rama, the righteous son of Dasaratha, sage Sutikshna was pleased to reply:

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Luckily you have asked me on your own. I will tell you where the great sage Agastya lives.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, there are lotusponds filled with clear, sacred waters, with different kinds of swans, ducks and ruddy geese. Spend one night there and proceed early in the morning.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, there are lotusponds filled with clear, sacred waters, with different kinds of swans, ducks and ruddy geese. Spend one night there and proceed early in the morning.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Enjoying the sight of delightful forests, cloudlike mountains, lakes and rivers on the  way, and following the directions given by  Sutikshna, Rama was happy. He said  to Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Surely this is the hermitage of great Agastya's brother, a man of holy deeds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Assuming the form of a brahmin and using Sanskrit language, Ilvala would invite brahmins for offering shraddha to the dead
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ilvala would keep his brother sanctified, so that he is fit for offering, Then he would feed the brahmins with mutton according to the rituals.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then when the brahmins finished eating, Ilvala would call aloud, 'O Vatapi come out'.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Wise Agastya,  the best among the ascetics, laughing aloud, said to Ilvala, the destroyer of brahmins:

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This hermitage surrounded by beautiful lakes and forests belongs to his brother (Sudarsana). Out of sympathy for Agastya, he has accomplished this difficult task.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Rama was thus narrating to Lakshmana (the story of Agastya), the Sun set and evening closed in.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This is the hermitage of the longlived Agastya who is renowned for his deeds and is served by humble people. The great mountain Vindhya that was growing incessantly and obstructing the path of the Sun stopped growing any more in obedience to Agastya's words.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: We are going to join this sage honoured by the people of the world and ever engaged in the welfare of the virtuous. This augurs well for us.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O noble, handsome Lakshmana, I will spend the rest of the exile in this forest in the worship of the great sage Agastya.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The gods along with gandharvas, siddhas and great sages always serve Agastya, observing discipine in their food habits.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This sage is such type that he (his spiritual power) will not allow a liar or a cruel man or a deceitful or lustful  or wicked person to thrive here.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Here gods, yakshas, nagas and birds live, following the righteous path and observing discipline in food habits.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Here great souls like sages and siddhas gave up the ghost and with renewed bodies left for heaven on aerochariot resembling the Sun (in brightness).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Worshipped by benevolent beings, the gods here bestow on them the status of demigods or of the immortals or several kinds of kingdoms.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana, the younger brother of Rama,  entered the hermitage of Agastya and met one of his disciples and said to him these words :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The valiant eldest son of  king Dasaratha has come along with his wife Sita to see the sage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am his younger brother Lakshmana, his wellwisher and faithful devotee if you have at all heard about me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: By the command of our father, we have entered this dense forest and desire to see the   divine sire. Please report.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The ascetic heard Lakshmana, and saying, 'let it be so', entered the firesanctuary to report.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having promptly entered, Agastya's favourite disciple with folded hands reported as he was told by Lakshmana about Rama's arrival to the great sage who was armed with the inviolable powers of penance :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama and Lakshmana, the two sons of Dasaratha along with Sita, wife of Rama, have arrived at the hermitage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Both the subduers of enemies  have come here now to see and serve your Holiness. You may order what is to be done next.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having heard from the disciple about the arrival of Rama, Lakshmana and great daughter of the king of Videha the sage said :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: It is good fortune that Rama has come here after a long time to see me. I was longing for his arrival.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Go quickly and with due hospitality conduct Rama, his wife Sita and brother Lakshmana into my presence. Why was he not ushered in so long?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'So be it ' said the disciple respectfully with folded palms in response to what the great sage, knower of dharma, commanded.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the disciple in a state of excitement came out of the hermitage and said to Lakshmana, 'Where is Rama? Let him come himself to see the sage'.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Lakshmana reached the entrance of the hermitage with the disciple  and showed  Rama of the Kakutstha race and Sita, daughter of Janaka .
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The disciple humbly reported Agastya's words and ushered him in with befitting hospitality.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Rama, Sita and Lakshmana entered the hermitage, watching herds of quietly moving deer (undisturbed by their entry).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama saw at the hermitage, the places (altars) of Brahma, Visnu, Agni (firegod), Indra, Sun, Moon, Bhaga, Kubera, Dhata (supreme spirit), Vidhata (creator Brahman), Vayu (Windgod), Ananta (great serpentking),  Gayatri, Vasu Pasahasta, Varuna, Kartikeya and Dharma .
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama saw at the hermitage, the places (altars) of Brahma, Visnu, Agni (firegod), Indra, Sun, Moon, Bhaga, Kubera, Dhata (supreme spirit), Vidhata (creator Brahman), Vayu (Windgod), Ananta (great serpentking), Gayatri, Vasu Pasahasta, Varuna, Kartikeya and Dharma .
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama saw at the hermitage, the places (altars) of Brahma, Visnu, Agni (firegod), Indra, Sun, Moon, Bhaga, Kubera, Dhata (supreme spirit), Vidhata (creator Brahman), Vayu (Windgod), Ananta (great serpentking),  Gayatri, Vasu Pasahasta, Varuna, Kartikeya and Dharma .
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama saw at the hermitage, the places (altars) of Brahma, Visnu, Agni (firegod), Indra, Sun, Moon, Bhaga, Kubera, Dhata (supreme spirit), Vidhata (creator Brahman), Vayu (Windgod), Ananta (great serpentking),  Gayatri, Vasu Pasahasta, Varuna, Kartikeya and Dharma .
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter surrounded by the disciples the sage came out. Rama saw him coming in front of the effulgent sages.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The valiant Rama said to Lakshmana, the enhancer of prosperity, O Lakshmana, sage Agastya is coming out. By virtue of his noble appearance, I know this sage to be a great treasuretrove of penances.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The valiant Rama said to Lakshmana, the enhancer of prosperity, O Lakshmana, sage Agastya is coming out. By virtue of his noble appearance, I know this sage to be a great treasuretrove of penances.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having said so, the mightyarmed Rama, the scorcher of enemies, grasped the feet of Agastya who was shining like the Sun.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then righteous Rama with Sita, the princess of Videha, and Lakshmana offered respects with folded palmsstanding.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Agastya received Rama by offering him seat and water, enquired about his wellbeing  and said: Please be seated,
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: After giving oblations to the fire, and  providing respectful offerings, the sage worshipped the guests according to the tradition of hermits and served them food.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: And then the great sage Agastya, knower of dharma  first took his seat and addressed Rama, an export in the knowledge of dharma, seated with folded palms.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, only  after offering oblations to the Firegod, a guest should be worshipped with water etc. Otherwise the host will have to eat his own flesh in the other world like a false witness.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are king of all the worlds, a follower of dharma, a great warrior worthy of worship and an esteemed self. O Rama you are such a dear guest come to me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having said this to Rama, (the sage) honoured him by offering fruits, roots, flowers and other things as desired. He then said to Rama once again:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best among men  this divine bow studded with gold and gems  belongs to Visnu and designed by Visvakarma. This excellent, unfailing arrow, bright like the Sun, was given to me by Brahma.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best among men  this divine bow studded with gold and gems  belongs to Visnu and designed by Visvakarma. This excellent, unfailing arrow, bright like the Sun, was given to me by Brahma.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: These two quivers filled fully with sharp inexhaustible arrows, shining like flames of fire and this sword adorned with gold and this big silver sheath were given to me by Indra.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In ancient times Visnu killed the demons in a battle with this bow and brought back the glittering prosperity for the gods.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O bestower of honour, receive this bow, the two quivers, the sword and the arrow for your victory just like Indra accepts the thunderbolt.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The luminous lord Agastya, having said this, gave all the excellent weapons to Rama. And continued : इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्वादशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the twelfth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama ,I am pleased. I wish you well. I am glad that both of you have come here with Sita to pay respect to me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Both of you are tired due to the journey. It is evident that Sita, daughter of Janaka, is anxious (to rest).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Even though delicate, Sita never feels discouraged by difficulties. She has come to the forest full of obstacles, since she is motivated by her love for her husband.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, help Sita enjoy herself in whatever manner she likes. By following you into the forest, she has accomplished the most difficult task৷৷
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, the delight of the Raghu dynasty from the beginning of the creation women, by nature,  keep the husband company when all goes well and give them up when hard times come.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Women are fickle like lightning, sharp like weapons and fast like Garuda or the windgod.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Your wife is free from such blemishes. She is praiseworthy and worthy of mention as an example just like the revered Arundhati.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, subduer of enemies the place where you reside along with Lakshmana and Vaidehi will look adorned, indeed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus addressed, Rama held his palms together and said politely to the sage shining like fire:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I consider myself blessed and favoured by a great sage like you, bestower of boons as you have been pleased with me, my brother and my life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Direct me to a place with water and dense forest where we can build an ashram and live happily.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing the words of Rama, Agastya, the best among the sages, coolheaded and righteous, thought a while and uttered these words coolly :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O dear two yojanas away is a place wellknown as Panchavati, a beautiful resort with many roots, fruits, plenty of water and many animals.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Reaching there, you wikk build a hermitage with Lakshmana and enjoy your life given to the fulfilment of the pledge to the father.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, scion of the Kakutsthas  much of the period of exile king Dasaratha had assigned has passed. You will fulfil your promise and live happily in the kingdom.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, joy of the Raghu family with the eldest son like you, your father is blessed and liberated like king Yayati.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O sinless one, I have kown all these facts about you by the power of penance and love for Dasaratha.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I know your heart by virtue of my penance. I, therefore, ask you to proceed to Panchavati, after ensuring your stay here with me in this penancegrove for the time being.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I know your heart by virtue of my penance. I, therefore, ask you to proceed to Panchavati, after ensuring your stay here with me in this penancegrove for the time being.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Raghava, that forest tract is delightful and beautiful. It is not far away(from here). Maithili (Sita) will enjoy her stay there.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O longarmed Rama,that place has plenty of roots and fruits. It is a solitary, holy and beautiful place teeming with various kinds of birds. Sita will enjoy her stay in the vicinity of river Godavari.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, while staying with your wife, you will look after the ascetics living there since you are capable of giving protection.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O valiant Rama look at the great forest of madhuka trees. Walk north to the forest till you see a great banyan tree.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then climb the elevated ground not very far from the mountain. There is the wellknown Panchavati with forests, ever in full bloom.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus addressed by Agastya,  Rama with Lakshmana paid respects to the sage wedded to truth and took leave of him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Both of them worshipped the feet of sage Agastya, and proceeded to Panchavati with his permission.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Both the princes, unafraid of battles, held their bows, tied the quivers and carefully proceeded towards Panchavati along the path suggested by the sage. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रयोदशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the thirteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On the way to Panchavati, Rama, the delight of the Raghu race, met a vulture with a huge body and fearful strength.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing the bird on the banyan tree, venerable Rama and Lakshmana mistook him for a demon and enquired who he was.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With a sweet, pleasing, and gentle voice he said to both of them, O dear know me to be a friend of your father.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama knew he was a friend of his father. So he enquired in a cool, composed voice his name and his lineage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing Rama's words, the bird started narrating the origin of all beings including his own family:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O mightyarmed Rama hear from me while I am telling you about the lords of creation from the very beginning.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama among the lords of all beings the first was Kardama, the next was Vikritha, followed by Sesha, Samsrya Bahuputra, Sthanu, Mareechi, Atri and mighty Kratu, Pulastya, Angirasa, Pracheta, similarly Pulaha and Daksha.Following them were Vivasvan, Arishtanemi and the very glorious Kasyapa who was the last ruler.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama among the lords of all beings the first was Kardama, the next was Vikritha, followed by Sesha, Samsrya Bahuputra, Sthanu, Mareechi, Atri and mighty Kratu, Pulastya, Angirasa, Pracheta, similarly Pulaha and Daksha.Following them were Vivasvan, Arishtanemi and the very glorious Kasyapa who was the last ruler.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama among the lords of all beings the first was Kardama, the next was Vikritha, followed by Sesha, Samsrya Bahuputra, Sthanu, Mareechi, Atri and mighty Kratu, Pulastya, Angirasa, Pracheta, similarly Pulaha and Daksha.Following them were Vivasvan, Arishtanemi and the very glorious Kasyapa who was the last ruler.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O glorious Rama it is wellknown that Daksha, the creator had sixty daughters of great fame.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Out of them(daughters of Daksha) Kasyapa married eight women of beautiful waist called Aditi, Diti, Danu also Kalika,Tamra, Krodhavasa, Anala and Manu.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Kasyapa, pleased with them said to his young wives, Beget sons of my stature who can rule over the three worlds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best of men, O longarmed Rama while Aditi, Diti and Kalika seriously considered his advice, the rest of the wives did not.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, subduer and scorcher of enemies to Aditi were born twelve Adityas, eight Vasus, eleven Rudras, and two Asvins, thirtythree deities in all.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O dear Rama, Diti bore glorious sons called Daityas and this earth with all the forests and seas belonged to them.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O subduer of enemies, to Danu was born Hayagriva and to Kalika, Naraka and Kalaka.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To Tamra were born, Krounchi, Bhasi, Syeni, Dhrutharashtri and Suki. Altogether they were five beautiful young maids famous in the world.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Krounchi gave birth to owls, Bhasi to Bhasa birds, Synei to bright hawks and vultures, Dhrutharashtri to swans and chakravakas with sweet notes.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Krounchi gave birth to owls, Bhasi to Bhasa birds, Synei to bright hawks and vultures, Dhrutharashtri to swans and chakravakas with sweet notes.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Dhrutharashtri, a female bird of great lustre gave birth to chakravakas too. Suki gave birth to Nata and from Nata, Vinata was born. Be blessed, O Rama
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Ramato Krodhavasa were born Mrugi, Mrugamanda, Hari, Bhadramada, Mathangi, Sardooli, Sweta, Surabhi and Surasa, Kadruva and endowed with all virtues.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Ramato Krodhavasa were born Mrugi, Mrugamanda, Hari, Bhadramada, Mathangi, Sardooli, Sweta, Surabhi and Surasa, Kadruva and endowed with all virtues.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
