input: O best of men, all kinds of animals were born of Mrugi.To Mrugamanda were born bears and chamara (a different kind of deer).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To Hari were born lions, and swiftmoving monkeys and to Bhadramada, a daughter by name Iravati.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O bull among men Matangi gave birth to elephants.The mighty elephant Airavata who became the lord of the world was born to Iravati.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, Sarduli gave birth to tigers and playful, roundbodied monkeys called Golangula and Sweta delivered elephants as sons for guarding the eight quarters.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Surabhi gave birth to Rohini and Gandharvi,the two famous daughters. May you be happy, Rama
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama Rohini procreated cows, and Gandharvi, horses as offsprings. Surasa delivered cobras and Kadru, ordinary serpents.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, bull among men Manu procreated brahmins, kshatriyas, vaisyas and sudras all famed human beings.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Anala (wife of Kasyapa) procreated trees with sacred fruits. Vinata was the granddaughter of Suki, and Kahdruva and Surasa were her sisters.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Kadhru produced a thousandhooded serpent(Adisesha) who held the whole earth on his head and Vinata, two sons, Garuda and Aruna.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am born to Aruna and my elder brother is Sampati. O subduer of enemies, know me as Jatayu, son of Syeni.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If you so desire I will be helpful to you in guarding your hut. O dear, it is a difficult forest full of wild animals and demons. When you and Lakshmana are away I will protect Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama worshipped  Jatayu and bending down, embraced him. He heard from him again and again several events relating to Jatayu's  friendship with his father.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Entresting the protection of Sita, the princess of Mithila, to that strong vulture,  Jatayu, and accompanied by Lakshmana Rama went to Panchavati wishing to destroy the enemies like fire burning the moths. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामयणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुर्दशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fourteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On reaching Panchavati, which was full of various vicious animals, Rama said to Lakshmana, his brother who was glowing like  fire:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O handsome one, following the directions of the great sage, we have arrived at Panchavati, a place full of blossoming trees.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana cast your eyes all around the forest for a suitable place (for building a hermitage).  Indeed, you are good at judging things.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Look, O Lakshmana  for a place to the liking of Sita, a place where there is water source nearby  where both of us can enjoy. Find a beautiful location where the surrounding forest is beautiful and where faggots, flowers, water and kusa grass are available at hand.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Look, O Lakshmana  for a place to the liking of Sita, a place where there is water source nearby  where both of us can enjoy. Find a beautiful location where the surrounding forest is beautiful and where faggots, flowers, water and kusa grass are available at hand.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having been thus instructed by Rama, Lakshmana said with folded palms in the presence of Sita:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, I shall be dependent on you, even if I live for a hundred years. You only need to indicate a beautiful place of your choice.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama was pleased with the words of great Lakshmana. Deliberating over it, he agreed upon a site suitable in all respects.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having come to a beautiful spot suitable for the asram, Rama took both the hands of  Lakshmana in his own and said:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This place is level, surrounded by beautiful trees in full bloom. O handsome one, you may build the hermitage here.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There, not very far, is a beautiful lotustank shining like the Sun, fragrant with lotuses.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As said by the selfrealised soul, sage Agastya, this Godavari is beautiful, surrounded by trees with flowers in bloom, filled with flocks of swans, ducks and ruddy geese.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O handsome one, neither far nor near are seen tall mountains and flowering trees and herds of deer. Their numerous caves echo with sounds of peacocks.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O handsome one, neither far nor near are seen tall mountains and flowering trees and herds of deer. Their numerous caves echo with sounds of peacocks.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: These mountains, with streaks of minerals like gold, silver and copper forming decorative designs, look beautiful like colourful windows, and appear like huge elephants.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The place is covered with  sal and palmyrah trees including mango, jackfruit, dates, kadamba, punnaga, ashoka, champak, tilaka, ketaka, sandalwood, spandan, dhava, asvakarna parnasha, khadira, sami, kimsuka and patala trees. It is full of wild paddy, flowering bushes and creepers that run on the ground.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The place is covered with  sal and palmyrah trees including mango, jackfruit, dates, kadamba, punnaga, ashoka, champak, tilaka, ketaka, sandalwood, spandan, dhava, asvakarna parnasha, khadira, sami, kimsuka and patala trees. It is full of wild paddy, flowering bushes and creepers that run on the ground.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The place is covered with  sal and palmyrah trees including mango, jackfruit, dates, kadamba, punnaga, ashoka, champak, tilaka, ketaka, sandalwood, spandan, dhava, asvakarna parnasha, khadira, sami, kimsuka and patala trees. It is full of wild paddy, flowering bushes and creepers that run on the ground.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This is a holy place fit for sacrifice. There are many animals and birds here.Hence we will reside here with Jatayu.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus directed by Rama, the mighty Lakshmana, destroyer  of enemy warriors, soon built a hermitage for his brother.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana who was quick to act dug the clay with nippers, planted long bamboo poles, put branches of sami trees across and tied them with strong ropes. He spread kusa and kasa grass and leaves on the levelled ground. He built a beautiful, spacious and nice residence for Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana who was quick to act dug the clay with nippers, planted long bamboo poles, put branches of sami trees across and tied them with strong ropes. He spread kusa and kasa grass and leaves on the levelled ground. He built a beautiful, spacious and nice residence for Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana who was quick to act dug the clay with nippers, planted long bamboo poles, put branches of sami trees across and tied them with strong ropes. He spread kusa and kasa grass and leaves on the levelled ground. He built a beautiful, spacious and nice residence for Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana then went to river Godavari, had his bath, and returned with some lotuses.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana offered oblation of flowers, invoked peace as per tradition (before occupying a newly made home) and showed Rama the cottage he had built.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama and Sita saw the beautiful hermitage built by Lakshmana, and expressed much happiness over the leafthatched cottage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Deeply pleased with Lakshmana, he hugged him tightly and said those loving words :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O my master, you have done a great task for which I have given you what I could give at the moment a hug.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana with a son like you who can understand others' feelings, who has a sense of gratitude and a sense of duty my father is not dead yet.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama who was an enhancer of fortunes and who had his senses under control said thus to Lakshmana and lived happily there in that place filled with fruits.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Righteous Rama, served by Lakshmana, and Sita lived there for some time like a god in heaven. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चदशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fifteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While the great self Rama  lived happily there, autumn passed and dear winter set in.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Once Rama, delight of the Raghu race, went to the beautiful river Godavari for ablution in the early hours of the morning.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While valiant Lakshmana, walking behind Sita who was carrying a pitcher in her hand bent down a little and told Rama thus:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O sweetspeaking brother, the season which is dear to you has arrived. It appears the auspicious year is going to be embellished with this season.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: People feel frozen with fog, and water is no more enjoyable. The earth is full of crops and fire is so agreeable.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Pious men offer their libations of the first crop at Agnistoma sacrifice and thereby please their manes and get rid of their sins.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: People in the countryside with their desires satisfied obtain abundant cow's milk at this time. Rulers of the earth are out on their expedition with a desire for victory.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As the Sun has resorted to the direction (south) that serves the god of death, the north devoid of (the Sun) shines like a woman without the vermilion mark on the forehead.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Presently with the Sun far away, the Himalayas abounding in snow has naturally justified its name.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The days are enjoyable at noon as it is pleasant to move about during this time since the sun is not scorching. But the shade and water seem to be unfortunate (as they are not liked by any one.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The days will be frostsmitten. The Sun will also be mild. Due to heavy dewfall the weather will be cold with the blowing of the wind. Forests will be empty (as no animals would be seen moving around.)
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: At this time people do not sleep under the open sky. With the month of Pushya approaching, nights feel cool and look red due to frost. They prolong into three yamas.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With the radiance of the Sun dimmed, with its orb reddened by frost, the moon does not shine clear like a mirror blurred with breath.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On a fullmoon night the beams of the moon faded by forest look pale, dull like Sita scorched by the heat of the Sun.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The west wind which by nature feels cold at this time blows doubly cold, hit by snow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The snowcold forest terrains are fertile with barley and wheat crops. As the Sun rises the swans and kraunchas produce pleasing notes.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The tops of rice crops shining like gold resemble the flowers of datepalm.The fields full of ripe paddy bending a little (under the weight of grains) look delightful.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The Sun risen at the distant horizon looks like the Moon, his lengthening rays covered with snow and dew.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The heat of the Sun which we do not feel in the forenoon is comfortable during midday when the Sun shines slightly reddish white on earth.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As the miadows are wet with dewdrops, the land looks delightful with mild Sunlight  shining on the surface.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The wild tusker, extremely thirsty, touches the clean, cold water joyfully, but immediately withdraws its trunk unable to bear the cold.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Just as inefficient warriors do not enter the warfield, aquatic birds sitting near water do not venture to take a plunge into it.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The flowerless forest ranges appear as if they are asleep, enveloped in the darkness of frost and  snow .
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Now the rivers are not visible as the waters are covered with vapour. They are only inferred through the cackling of swans and the sands of the bank moistened with dewdrops.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Due to snowfall, mildness of the Sun, and coldness (of weather) even the water flowing from the mountain top is not generally tasty.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The lotuses in the tank  no more shine (bright) as they are decayed by age, their filaments and pericarps withered with only stalks remaining.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: At this time, righteous Bharata, the best among men, with his devotion to you must be sadly performing penance at his residence.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Giving up his kingdom, honour and pleasures of many kinds, Bharata will be living like an ascetic, sleeping on the ground in cold weather, his food under restriction.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: At this time, Bharata,  accompanied by his subjects, must be daily going to river Sarayu for ablution.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: How can Bharata who was brought up in luxury, who is delicate, and deserves all comfort, take a dip in river Sarayu (in cold morning) ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He has a blue complexion, a pair of eyes like lotus petals, a thin waist and long arms. He is selfrestrained, softspoken, sweettempered and truthful. He knows his duty and maintains a low profile. A subduer  of enemies, he is heroic and great. Such Bharata has given up the diverse pleasures of life and has surrendered himself to you with all his soul.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He has a blue complexion, a pair of eyes like lotus petals, a thin waist and long arms. He is selfrestrained, softspoken, sweettempered and truthful. He knows his duty and maintains a low profile. A subduer  of enemies, he is heroic and great. Such Bharata has given up the diverse pleasures of life and has surrendered himself to you with all his soul.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Although you dwell in the forest, your great brother Bharata has won the kingdom of heaven by faithfully adopting your asceticism.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The saying that men follow mother's path but not the path of the father, has been disproved by Bharata.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: How could mother Kaikeyi, who has a husband like Dasaratha and a noble son like Bharata, be so wicked by nature ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When pious Lakshmana said thus to Rama out of his love for him, Rama replied, unable to tolerate the words of censure against mother (Kaikeyi) :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O dear, Kaikeyi, our second mother, is never to be criticised like that. You may, however, speak more of Bharata, the lord of the Iksvakus.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Even though I have made up my mind to dwell in the forest and keep my vow, my love for Bharata makes me waver like a child (Rama does not want Bharata to suffer on his account).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I remember his dear, sweet, ambrosial  words, soothing to the heart and pleasing to the mind.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O enhancer of joy of the Raghus  when shall I meet great Bharata, brave Satrughna and you all together?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Expressing his grief in such manner, Rama reached Godavari where he took his bath with his brother and Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: And then poised, they offered libations of water to their forefathers and gods and prayer to the rising Sun.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Accompanied by Sita and Lakshmana,Rama finished his bath in the river.He looked splendid like Lord Rudra followed by Nandi and the daughter of the king of  the mountains (Parvati). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षोडशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ablution over, Rama, accompanied by Sita and Lakshmana, went back from the bank of the river Godabari to their hermitage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On reaching the hermitage, Rama and Lakshmana performed the forenoon rituals and entered the leafthatched cottage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Honoured by the ascetics , Rama  stayed there peacefully with brother Lakshmana, discussing diverse matters (from time to time).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Longarmed Rama seated with Sita in the cottage, appeared like the Moon in conjunction with constellation Chitra.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Rama was thus seated, engrossed in conversation, there incidentally appeared a demoness.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Surpanakha, sister of the tenheaded demon (Ravana) approached Rama shining like a god.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demoness was infatuated with Rama,  whose chest was like that of a lion, who was strongarmed, who had a glowing face, pleasing to the eyes, who walked with the gait of an elephant, whose hair was matted,  who was gentle and strong who was, endowed with royal traits, who had a blue lotuslike complexion, who was handsome as the god of love, and who resembled Indra.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demoness was infatuated with Rama,  whose chest was like that of a lion, who was strongarmed, who had a glowing face, pleasing to the eyes, who walked with the gait of an elephant, whose hair was matted,  who was gentle and strong who was, endowed with royal traits, who had a blue lotuslike complexion, who was handsome as the god of love, and who resembled Indra.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demoness was infatuated with Rama,  whose chest was like that of a lion, who was strongarmed, who had a glowing face, pleasing to the eyes, who walked with the gait of an elephant, whose hair was matted,  who was gentle and strong who was, endowed with royal traits, who had a blue lotuslike complexion, who was handsome as the god of love, and who resembled Indra.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama's face was lovely, Surpanakha's was hideous. Rama had a slender waist, she had a huge belly. His eyes were large,  hers were deformed. His hair was black and beautiful, hers was coppercoloured. He was lovely in appearance, she was ugly. His voice was sweet, hers was shrill. He was young, she was dreadfully old. He was positive, she was perverted. Rama was wellbehaved, she was wicked. Rama was just and loving while she was overcome by lust.  (This) demoness said to Rama :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama's face was lovely, Surpanakha's was hideous. Rama had a slender waist, she had a huge belly. His eyes were large,  hers were deformed. His hair was black and beautiful, hers was coppercoloured. He was lovely in appearance, she was ugly. His voice was sweet, hers was shrill. He was young, she was dreadfully old. He was positive, she was perverted. Rama was wellbehaved, she was wicked. Rama was just and loving while she was overcome by lust.  (This) demoness said to Rama :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama's face was lovely, Surpanakha's was hideous. Rama had a slender waist, she had a huge belly. His eyes were large,  hers were deformed. His hair was black and beautiful, hers was coppercoloured. He was lovely in appearance, she was ugly. His voice was sweet, hers was shrill. He was young, she was dreadfully old. He was positive, she was perverted. Rama was wellbehaved, she was wicked. Rama was just and loving while she was overcome by lust.  (This) demoness said to Rama :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama you are wearing matted hair like an ascetic, but living with your wife and holding bow and arrows. What brings you to this place haunted by demons ? You should tell me the truth ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus asked by the demoness Surpanakha,  Rama, scorcher of foes began telling her everything due to his simplemindedness.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To Rama untruth is never acceptable at the hermitage and especially in the presence of a woman.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: (Rama replied) There was a king named Dasaratha who was mighty like the gods. I am his eldest son known among the people as Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Here is Lakshmana , my younger brother, who always follows me . And this  is the daughter of the king of Videha and my wife, wellknown as Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I have come here, commanded by the king, my father and mother.Intending to obey the orders of my father, and impelled by duty to  establish righteousness I have come  to reside here.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I wish to know who you are. Tell me who your kins are. With lovely limbs you do not appear to be a demoness.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Tell me truly what you have come here for. Having heard the words of Rama and overtaken by passion, the demoness said:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My name is Surpanakha. I am a demoness who can assume any form at will, I move in this forest alone, unleashing a reign of terror.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My name is Surpanakha. I am a demoness who can assume any form at will, I move in this forest alone, unleashing a reign of terror.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My brother is Ravana, son of Visrava, and lord of all demons. You have heard his name I suppose.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Kumbhakarna is another brother of mine. He is very strong. He is always in deep sleep. Vibhisna another brother. He is righteous free from  any demoniac trait. My other two brothers are Khara and Dusana who are wellknown heroes of war.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Setting them aside, I came here, as soon as I saw you. You are the finest among men and I am here wishing you to be my husband.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I have influence over others, I have capacity to move wherever I want. Be my husband forever. What will you do with Sita?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: She is ugly, deformed, unsuitable for you. I  am alone  fit for you. Look upon me as your wife.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I will devour your brother along with this disfigured, unchaste and fearful lady with a flat belly.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O darling, thereafter you can keep wandering with me in this Dandaka forest, enjoying the beauty of the mountain tops and forests.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus addressed, Rama, skilled in speech, laughed and started speaking to that woman of bewitching eyes. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तदशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the seventeenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To  Surpanakha bound by the noose of passion Rama with a smile replied in a clear, lucid manner:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lady I am married and here is my wife who is dear to me. To be a cowife to some one is indeed painful for people like you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Here is my younger brother Lakshmana. He is a man of good conduct, good look, valiant and virtuous. (Besides) he is not with his wife.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He is not with his wife, and is in need of one. He is young, handsome and worthy. He will be an appropriate husband to you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O  woman of large eyes and fine hips, my brother is fit for you. You will (with him) shine like the radiant Sun on mount Meru. You will enjoy yourself without a cowife. You may approach him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus  told by Rama, the demoness, deluded with lust, left him suddenly, and said to Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With my fine complexion, I will be a suitable wife for you. You can happily wander about in Dandaka forest with me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus addressed by the demoness Lakshmana, son of Sumitra, wellversed in the use of words gave her a befitting reply :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lotuscomplexioned woman , how can you act as a maid to a slave ? Why do you intend to be so? I am already dependent on my revered brother.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O largeeyed one, you have a clear complexion. You may become the younger wife of my master who is lord of great wealth. And live a happy, fulfilled life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He will abandon this uglylooking, unchaste, frightening old woman of drooping belly and accept you alone as his wife.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lady of fair complexion and beautiful hips, which wise man will fall in love with any other female giving up a fine figure like you ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Lakshmana was thus making fun of the dreadful, droopingbellied Surpanakha, she presumed his words to be true.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Deluded with passion, Surpanakha said to formidable Rama, the scorcher of foes,  seated in the leafthatched hut along with Sita:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are holding on to this lady who is ugly, unchaste, fiercelooking, flatbellied and  aged and not caring for me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I shall eat up this woman now before your very eyes and I can move about happily with you without a cowife.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While speaking this, Surpanakha, with eyes like flaming amber ran to the fawneyed Sita in great anger like a giant meteor hurtling towards the constellation of Rohini :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Mighty Rama in a rage restrained her who was falling upon Sita like the noose of death, and said to Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O handsome Lakshmana it is not proper to cut jokes with wicked, uncivilized persons. Now see Sita who has somehow survived.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O tiger among men, this uncouth, bigbellied, unchaste and highly passionate demoness deserves to be formed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus instructed (by Rama), powerful Lakshmana took position by the side of Rama, angrily lifted the sword and cut off her nose and ears.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Dreadful Surpanakha with her ears and nose cut off, roared in a hoarse voice and ran away into the forest in the same direction as she came.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The dreadful demoness who thus was disfigured. Drenched in blood, she  thundered like a cloud in rainy season.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Dripping blood profusely, the frightful demoness lifted her arms and entered the great forestroaring.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A disfigured demoness, she fell down like the thunderbolt from the sky on the ground while her fiercelooking brother Khara sat surrounded by demons at Janasthana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter the sister of Khara, wild with fear and delusion and drenched in blood, narrated all about the arrival of Rama, Sita and Lakshmana in the forest and her disfigurement. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टादशस्सर्ग।। Thus ends the eighteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Burning with anger to see his sister fallen down disfigured and drenched in blood, Khara enquired:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Get up, give up your confusion and stupefaction. Tell me clearly by whom you have been disfigured like this ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Who will hurt  an innocent, venomous black serpent and stay away quietly close by for fun with his finger tip?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Who is he who has tied has tied his throat with the noose of death out of ignorance and yet does not know the implications ? Who is he who has caused this injury to you, but does not understand that he has drunk deadly poison.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You have sufficient strength and courage. You are capable of  moving as you like and taking any form at your will. By whom have you been brought to this state and drawn close to death?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Which valiant person among gods, gandharvas, sages and other great people, has disfigured you like this ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I can see none in this world who can offend me, nor even the thousandeyed Indra among the gods.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Just as the swan drinks only milk from water (mixed with milk), my arrows will (unerringly) drain the life from the enemy's body right now.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Whose foamy, red blood will the earth drink while I strike his vital organs with my arrows in the fight ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Whose flesh will be eaten by cheerful flocks of (vultures), biting and tearing his body when he is killed by me in the battle ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Neither gods nor devils nor gandharvas nor even demons will have the power to rescue that hapless creature dragged by me ruthlessly in the battle.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You should tell me as you slowly regain your consciousness which bragart has overpowered you in the forest with his strength.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing her angry brother, Surpanakha replied with words choked with tears:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Here are two young sons of Dasaratha, Rama and Lakshmana, who are gentle, handsome,  strong, with eyes like white lotus, wearing deerskin and bark robes, living on fruits and roots, selfrestrained like ascetics and following the righteous path.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Here are two young sons of Dasaratha, Rama and Lakshmana, who are gentle, handsome,  strong, with eyes like white lotus, wearing deerskin and bark robes, living on fruits and roots, selfrestrained like ascetics and following the righteous path.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: They are kings of the gandharvas with all royal insignia. I was not able to discern whether they are gods or humans.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I saw between them a young, beautiful woman of slender waist, adorned with all kinds of jewels.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I have been subjected to this state of an orphan unfaithful woman by both of them for the sake of that lady.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I wish to drink the foamy blood of that crooked woman and of both the brothers slain on the battle front.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O dear  this is my first wish and you must fulfil it. I will drink her blood and  of the two brothers, in the battle.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As she was speaking, the inflamed Khara ordered fourteen very strong demons, comparable to Yama, the god of death, to proceed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Two human beings equipped with weapons, clad in bark robes and deerskin have entered the dreadful Dandaka forest along with a woman of bewitching beauty.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I want you to get  both of them along with that notorious woman killed. This sister of mine will drink their blood.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O demons quickly go and crush them with your power and fulfil my sister's sincere wish.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus commanded, the fourteen demons along with Surpanakha rushed there like windblown clouds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The nightrangers were unable to crush him(Rama) despite their sharp, glowing weapons  just as wild elephants cannot face all at once the rising flame of the forest fire. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनविंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the nineteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 19 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The frightful Surpanakha came to the hermitage of Rama and showed both the brothers and Sita to the demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: They saw mighty Rama together with Vaidehi and Lakshmana sitting in the leafthatched cottage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing the demons along with Surpanakha arrive, said the handsome Rama, scion of the Raghu dynasty to his brother Lakshmana, who was blazing like fire :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana  stand by Sita for a while. I shall kill these demons who have come here.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana heard him and in turn honoured the word of Rama, knower of the self.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Righteous Rama too, lifted up his great bow decked with gold and fastened the string and then said to the demons:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: We, Rama and Lakshmana, sons of Dasaratha, are brothers, who have entered the inaccessible Dandaka forest along with Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Feeding on fruits and roots and following the righteous path, we are living in Dandaka forest like ascetics. Why are you torturing us?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I came here equipped with bows, arrows and weapons, asked by ascetics to kill in the battle sinners like you who are offending them.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If you care for your life, you may return, or else, if you please you may remain (die) here, O demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: At these words, the destroyers of brahmins, the fourteen demons were inflamed. They lifted their spears and spoke:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You have incited the wrath of Khara, our great master for which you will now pay with your life in the fight.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: How can you face us alone? We outnumber you? Leave alone fighting, you cannot even stand in front of us.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Come on with daggers and sharpedged spears hurled, you will give up your life,your prowess as well as the bow held in your hand.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Saying these words, the fourteen infuriated demons hurled their spears at invincible Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: All the fourteen spears hurled turned into splinters by the same number of golden arrows released by Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the effulgent Rama, mighty angry, took fourteen arrows sharpened by stones and glowing like the  Sun.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama took the bow, stretched it and aimed at his target, the demons  and sent the arrows as Indra would release the thunderbolt.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Goldfeathered blazing arrows decorated with gold, released by Rama flew fast and pierced the chests of the demons. Drenched in blood they (the arrows) thundered (out of their chests) and  plunged into the earth.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With their hearts split, their bodies drenched in blood, disfigured and lifeless, the demons fell down on earth like trees cut  at the roots.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing the demons fallen on the ground, the demoness wild with anger and fear roared.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Her blood slightly dried up, she came back afflicted to Khara and fell down like a sallaki tree, its sap oozing.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Missing
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then desperately screaming and shedding tears with a sad face beside her brother, she roared again and again.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Surpanakha saw the demons fall dead on the battleground, she ran to Khara,her brother and told in detail about the death of the demons. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे विंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the twentieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 20 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing Surpanakha collapse, Khara said in clear terms about the unfortunate situation she had created:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The valiant demons who feed on blood have been commissioned for your pleasure. Why are you crying again?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: They are loyal and faithful to me. They are always my wellwishers. Even when attacked, they cannot be killed. They never fail to carry out my orders.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I wish to know what makes you lament and roll on the ground like a serpent and hissing?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When I am here like a lord to protect you, why do you weep like an orphan? Get up. Give up your anxiety. Be not afraid.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus consoled by Khara, invincible Surpanakha wiped her tearful eyes and said to her brother:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My ears and nose sliced off, drenched with blood, I came to you and you pacified me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O warrior  you had sent, out of anger, fourteen demons to put an end to Rama along with Lakshmana in order to please me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demons who went with spears in their hands were killed, their hearts pierced by  Rama's arrows.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing the powerful demons collapse on the ground in a moment's time through Rama's action, I was frightened.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O demon  I am scared and sad. To me everything looks frightening. I, therefore, seek refuge in you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am drowned in a vast sea of sorrow where crocodiles in the form of distress reside. It is full of rows of waves of fright. Why do you not save me?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demons who live on flesh, who came following me fell down on earth and lay dead,  shot by the sharp arrows of Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O demon  if you have compassion for me or for the demons, if you have the power and energy to face Rama, kill the enemy of the demons living in Dandaka forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If now you do not kill that Rama, my enemy, O shameless one, I will give up my life in your very presence.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Instinctively I can foresee that you and your army do not have the capability to encounter that great Rama in a fight.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You call yourself a hero, yet are not able to kill two humans like Rama and Lakshmana. Your claim to heroism is false. You are not a hero at all.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O demon  you are a disgrace to the family. If you have power or energy, kill that Rama dwelling in Dandaka forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You have little strength and less heroism. You with your relations should immediately leave Janasthana. What kind of position do you have here?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Let down by the brilliance of Rama, son of Dasaratha, you will be soon destroyed. He is mighty and his brother who has disfigured me is very valiant.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Let down by the brilliance of Rama, son of Dasaratha, you will be soon destroyed. He is mighty and his brother who has disfigured me is very valiant.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Overcome by sorrow, the bigbellied demoness cried  in several ways and being very sad started beating her chest with both hands. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकविंशस्सर्गः। Thus ends the twentyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 21 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ashamed and accused thus in the presence of the demons, the valiant Khara spoke to Surpanakha in harsh words:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Like the overslowing salt sea water, I am unable to contain this my excessive anger arising out of your insult.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama is a shortlived human. I do not care for his valour. His life span will be shortened (he will be killed) now for his own misdeeds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Restrain your tears and your anxieties I will send Rama along with his brother to the abode of Yama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With his life ebbing out, killed by my axe in the fight, you will drink today, O demoness, Rama's red, hot blood.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing the words that came out of Khara's mouth, she was pleased. And in stupidity began praising her brother once again as the best of demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara, accused by her earlier and admired again, said to Dusana, chief of army:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There are fourteen thousand demons at my command ready to act according to my will. They are warriors of terrific speed and will not retreat from the fight.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: They are of the colour of the dark blue cloud, dreadful and merciless, strong and powerful fighters who roam about forturing people.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O handsome one, get them all, powerful like tigers, demons with large countenances, mighty and arragant, ready (for the fight).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O goodnatured one, get my chariot, bows and arrows, wonderful swords of different kinds and sharp missiles ready quickly.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O expert in warfare, I wish to lead those great warriors of Paulasthya family, to kill that immodest Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Khara was speaking thus, Dusana reported that a huge chariot of the colour of the Sun yoked with good horses of variegated hues stood ready.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the impatient Khara mounted the chariot that looked like the peak of mount Meru. It was decorated with pure gold, had golden wheels, poles studded with vaidurya. The carriage of the chariot was engraved with golden figures of fishes, flowers, trees, the Sun, stars, flocks of auspicious birds, flags and swords. Shining with small bells, it was yoked to fine horses.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the impatient Khara mounted the chariot that looked like the peak of mount Meru. It was decorated with pure gold, had golden wheels, poles studded with vaidurya. The carriage of the chariot was engraved with golden figures of fishes, flowers, trees, the Sun, stars, flocks of auspicious birds, flags and swords. Shining with small bells, it was yoked to fine horses.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the impatient Khara mounted the chariot that looked like the peak of mount Meru. It was decorated with pure gold, had golden wheels, poles studded with vaidurya. The carriage of the chariot was engraved with golden figures of fishes, flowers, trees, the Sun, stars, flocks of auspicious birds, flags and swords. Shining with small bells, it was yoked to fine horses.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demons of terrific prowess surounded Khara and Dusana and stood by, when they saw both of them mounting the chariot.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara mounted the chariot, saw the demons holding great weapons, wearing dreadful shields and holding flags, and ordered them to march.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the army of the demons wearing dreadful shields, holding weapons and flags, and making a loud noise started in great speed from Janasthanam.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The fourteen thousand demons loyal to the wishes of Khara, took in their hands, maces, piercing weapons, spears, sharp axes used in battle, swords, wheels, splinters, iron clubs, powerful missiles, dreadful iron bars of giant size, bows made of bamboo, clubs and frightening weapons like thunderbolt (of Indra) and  departed from Janasthana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The fourteen thousand demons loyal to the wishes of Khara, took in their hands, maces, piercing weapons, spears, sharp axes used in battle, swords, wheels, splinters, iron clubs, powerful missiles, dreadful iron bars of giant size, bows made of bamboo, clubs and frightening weapons like thunderbolt (of Indra) and  departed from Janasthana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The fourteen thousand demons loyal to the wishes of Khara, took in their hands, maces, piercing weapons, spears, sharp axes used in battle, swords, wheels, splinters, iron clubs, powerful missiles, dreadful iron bars of giant size, bows made of bamboo, clubs and frightening weapons like thunderbolt (of Indra) and  departed from Janasthana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara's chariot moved a bit behind the army of demons of frightening prowess who rushed forward to attack (Rama).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Knowing the mind of Khara, the charioteer hastened the horses of the colourful  chariot decorated with pure gold.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Spurred by the charioteer, the chariot of Khara, the slayer of enemies, produced a rattle that filled all four quarters and the intermediate directions.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara in extreme anger hastened, like Yama, to slay his enemy. He roared loudly like a cloud raining hail stones and impelled his charioteer to speed up. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वालल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्वाविंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the twentysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 22 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As the army marched from there (Janasthana) a huge dark cloud of the colour of an ass rained dreadful inauspicious water, red as blood.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The swift horses yoked to the chariot stumbled casually while galloping on the plane highway sprinkled with flowers.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A dark ring, bloodred in colour appeared on the border of the Sun's orb, dark in the middle. This phenomenon of the Sun appeared like a ring of moving charcoal covering the Sun.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A huge vulture, frightening to look at flew up and sat on top of the flag on the staff of gold.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Flesheating beasts and birds flocked at Janasthana producing a cacophony.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The dreadful jackals making ghastly howls turning towards the illuminated direction and produced frightening sounds indicating inauspicious time for the demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The clouds looked like shattered mountains pouring down bloodlike rain which filled the sky and made it appear frighteningly different.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A terrific darkness, spread all over, produced frightening horripilation. Even the four quarters and the intermediary zones were not discernible.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Even before Sunset the twilight looked like a fresh wound. Then wild animals, birds, kankas, jackals and vultures facing towards Khara screeched, indicating danger.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Bad omens that always bring inauspiciousness were a dreadful evidence of what is going to happen. Jackals howled, facing Khara's army with their mouths emitting fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The planet Ketu appeared  like an iron beam near the Sun. Although it was not the fullmoon or newmoon day, Rahu eclipsed the Sun. Wind blew hard and the Sun was lustreless.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The planet Ketu appeared  like an iron beam near the Sun. Although it was not the fullmoon or newmoon day, Rahu eclipsed the Sun. Wind blew hard and the Sun was lustreless.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The stars rose in the sky and glittered like fireflies even before night arrived. The fishes and the aquatic birds in the lotusponds hid themselves under water.  Lotuses dried up in tanks and the trees stood bereft of flowers and fruits.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Although there was no wind, dust rose like a brown cloud and the sarika birds sang (vichi kuchi) thoughtlessly.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.
