instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Dreadful to watch were the thunderstorms and the meteors that dropped down from the sky. The earth trembled all over with mountains, groves and forests.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While the intelligent and courageous Khara was seated on the chariot and shouting, his left shoulder shook violently and throat throttled.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While watching all this, his eyes brimmed with tears. His forehead ached. Yet he was too deluded to beat a retreat.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Looking at these dreadful, horripilating occurrences Khara laughed and said to the demons:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Valiant and strong, I do not take seriously these terrifying omens boding calamity  just as a strong man does not care for the weak.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With my sharp arrows I can even bring down the stars from the sky. If angered, I can cause mortality to the god of death.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I do not wish to return, without killing with my sharp arrows that Rama who is proud of his strength and his brother Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Let my sister be satisfied by drinking the blood of both Rama and Lakshmana on whose account this adversity has come.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I have never faced defeat in wars, and all of you have seen it with your eyes. I am not telling you a lie.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When angry, I can kill even (Indra) the wielder of the thunderbolt, rider of the intoxicated Airavata and lord of the gods. What to speak of these two petty humans?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Fallen into the deathtrap, the great army of the demon, felt very happy on hearing Khara roaring.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Great souls like sages, gods, gandharvas, and siddhas including celestial bards assembled to see the battle.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Holy men assembled and uttered benedictions, saying, 'let there be wellbeing for the cows and brahmins associated with men of pious deeds in all the (three) worlds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Let Rama conquer the descendants of Paulasthya in the war like Visnu, the wielder of the wheel had defeated great demons'.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The great ascetics were talking thus and more. The gods waiting eagerly on heavenly chariots saw the army of the demons whose life span was shortened (who were doomed to death).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The great ascetics were talking thus and more. The gods waiting eagerly on heavenly chariots saw the army of the demons whose life span was shortened (who were doomed to death).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing Khara, their chief on the chariot driving fast, the army of demons too marched forward.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Surrounded by twelve valiant warriors like Syenagami, Pruthugreeva, Yagnasatru, Vihangama, Durjaya, Karaviraksha, Parusha, Kalakarmuka, Meghmali, Mahamali, Sarpasya and Rudhirasana, Khara proceeded.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Surrounded by twelve valiant warriors like Syenagami, Pruthugreeva, Yagnasatru, Vihangama, Durjaya, Karaviraksha, Parusha, Kalakarmuka, Meghmali, Mahamali, Sarpasya and Rudhirasana, Khara proceeded.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Similarly Dusana proceeded with four  Mahakapali, Sthulaksha, Pramathi and Trisira  around him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The mighty, swiftfooted army of valiant demons surrounded the princes (Rama and Lakshmana) all on a sudden like the planets around the Sun and the Moon. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रयोविंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the twentythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 23 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Khara endowed with malicious might was marching towards the hermitage, Rama and his brother saw the same omens of impending calamity the demon had seen.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Rama saw the most dreadful, horripilating phenomena foreboding calamity, he said to Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O longarmed Lakshmana see these calamitous phenomena that forebode mass destruction of men and demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: These rumbling clouds, brownishred like the colour of a donkey,  are moving about in the sky showering streams of blood.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana all my arrows are smoking and this goldplated bow welcomes me to war.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The way the forestbirds are screeching makes me foresee danger and makes survival doubtful.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A mass destruction of life is going to take place. There is no doubt about it. O brave Lakshmana my right shoulder trembles again and again, indicating the defeat of the enemy. Your beaming visage presages victory.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A mass destruction of life is going to take place. There is no doubt about it. O brave Lakshmana my right shoulder trembles again and again, indicating the defeat of the enemy. Your beaming visage presages victory.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, while preparing for war, those whose faces look pale are, for sure, going to die.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A dreadful roar of demons and the loud sound of wardrums beaten by the wicked demons are heard.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A wise man who apprehends danger or one who desires his own good should plan his defence even before the onset of danger.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Therefore, take shelter along with Sita in the inaccessible mountain cave, overgrown with trees, ready with your bow and arrows.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O dear, I do not like you to oppose this word of honour. You must touch my feet and go without delay.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are valiant and strong. There is no doubt that you can kill all these demons. But I desire to kill them.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus ordered by Rama, Lakshmana took the arrows and the bow and accompanied by Sita took shelter in the inaccessible cave.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With Lakshmana and Sita inside the cave, Rama heaved his shield, saying, Oh the work is accomplished.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Adorned with the shield, Rama shone like smokeless fire rising in darkness.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Valiant Rama lifted the huge bow and arrows and stood there, filling the directions with the twangs of his bow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the gods along with gandharvas, siddhas, and celestial bards assembled there, wishing to witness the war.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Great ascetics of the world, distinguished brahmarsis, accomplishers of pious deeds assembled and said to one another:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Let there be wellbeing for the cows, brahmins, and all the worlds. Let Rama, the scion of the Raghu race, conquer the Paulastyas (demons) in war like lord Visnu, wielder of the disc, who defeated the most powerful demons'.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus looking at one another they discussed among themselves how there can be war between the righteous Rama fighting singlehanded on the one hand and the fourteen thousand demons, performers of terrific deeds, on the other.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus looking at one another they discussed among themselves how there can be war between the righteous Rama fighting singlehanded on the one hand and the fourteen thousand demons, performers of terrific deeds, on the other.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rajarsis, siddhas, great brahmins with their clan and gods on the celestial chariots waited to see the war whetted with curiosity.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing Rama standing on the war front, engrossed and radiating heroic lustre, all beings were alarmed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, who is unwearied in action and who is of an incomparable (lovely) form, looked ferocious like the wielder of Pinaka (Lord Siva).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then appeared on all sides the wellequipped army of demons raising deep sounds with dreadful shields, weapons and banners.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The forest was filled with tumultuous sounds of the warriors roaring like lions,  shouting at one another, stretching the bowstrings constantly, yawning, proclaiming loudly and beating the drums.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The forest was filled with tumultuous sounds of the warriors roaring like lions,  shouting at one another, stretching the bowstrings constantly, yawning, proclaiming loudly and beating the drums.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The ferocious animals of the forest got frightened and ran away to silent spots without looking back.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The fierce army, deep like the sea, equipped with various missiles approached Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, wellversed in warfare, cast his eyes on all sides to see the army of Khara that had come prepared for war.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama stretched the formidable bow and lifted the arrows from his quiver to kill the demons and assumed intense anger.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama stood burning in anger like the fire of the doom's day. It was difficult even to look at him. Seeing him full of glow even the sylvan deities ran away.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama in anger looked like Lord Siva ready to destroy the sacrifice of Daksha.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing Rama flashing (in anger) and standing on the warfront all creatures ran away frightened.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The army of demons equipped with blazing armour, bows and banners appeared like a mass of blue clouds at Sunrise. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुर्विंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the twentyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 24 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara accompanied by his pilot party arrived at the hermitage of Rama, the destroyer of enemies and saw him in fury, standing ready with his bow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing Rama, Khara held his terribly twanging bow and arrow, stood facing him, and ordered the charioteer to drive towards him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Commanded by Khara, the charioteer also urged the horses towards the mightyarmed Rama standing alone and wielding the bow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing Khara attacking (Rama) all the demon ministers surrounded him  roaring.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seated on a chariot in the midst of the demons, Khara looked like the rising Mars in the middle of the stars.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara struck Rama of immeasurable prowess with a thousand arrows and roared loudly.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter all the infuriated demons showered on invincible Rama, wielder of a fierce bow, many kinds of weapons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Overtaken by anger, the demons continuously hurled at Rama hammers, spears, spikes, barbed missiles, swords and battleaxes.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Very powerful demons like huge clouds roared, eager to kill Rama in war. They ran forward on chariots, horses and tall elephants, looking like  mountain tops.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The battalions of demons sent down streams of arrows on Rama just like clouds  downpour on mountains.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Surrounded by the terrible demons Rama appeared like Lord Siva at dusk with hosts of his retinues arounds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama resisted the weapons released by the demons like the sea, the inflow of river waters.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama remained unhurt like a great mountain struck by many glowing thunderbolts. He felt no pain even though his limbs were hit by the dreadful weapons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Wounded all over the body, bleeding through the wounds caused by weapons, Rama looked like the evening Sun covered with clouds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing Rama left alone surrounded by many thousands of demons, the gods, ghandarvas and siddhas became very sad.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter Rama, mighty angry, bent his bow and released hundreds and thousands of unfeathered arrows.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As if sporting, Rama discharged the arrows attached with herons' feathers. The arrows were inescapable, unbearable like that of Yama's staff, that went straight without missing the target.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The arrows like the noose of the god of death released by Rama on the enemy army easily destroyed the lives of the demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama's arrows pierced the bodies of the demons and drenched in blood, they, looking like burning fire, shone in the sky.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: From Rama's bow bent into a cirle, countless fierce arrows able to take the lives of demons were released.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In war Rama cut asunder the bows, flag tops, armour and heads of demons, their shoulders and thighs that were like the trunks of elephants, in their hundreds and thousands.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He killed horses with golden armours yoked to the chariots along with charioteers, elephants along with riders, the cavalry along with their horses and infantry and sent them all to the abode of death.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He killed horses with golden armours yoked to the chariots along with charioteers, elephants along with riders, the cavalry along with their horses and infantry and sent them all to the abode of death.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The bodies of the demons torn into pieces by the very sharp iron arrows and by the arrows called vikarni, they cried and shouted aloud in pitiable voices.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Just like the dried up forest burnt by the fire, the army was totally destroyed by Rama's arrows that pierced into the vital parts of the soldiers.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A few warriors of fierce strength approached Rama and hurled at him very powerful weapons, spears, swords and axes.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Strongarmed Rama attacked them with his arrows and cut off their heads and took their lives.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The heads, armour and bows fell down broken on the ground like trees in the wind gererated by Garuda's wings.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The rest of the demons hit by the arrows ran desperate towards Khara for refuge.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Pacifying them all, Dusana regathered them again and ran towards Rama like an angry Yama rushing towards Rudra.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Under Dusana's protection, all of them felt relieved from fear and, carrying sal and palm trees and stones as weapons, advanced towards Rama again.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Holding spears, hammers and bows in their hands, the mighty demons rained on Rama weapons like arrows, trees and stones.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The thrilling, fierce, horrifying and horripilating battle again ensued betwen Rama and the demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As the infuriated demons again hurtled towards Rama, filling the quarters and the intermediate directions and raining missiles, Rama aimed at them dazzling gandharvastras, producing a frightening warcry.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As the infuriated demons again hurtled towards Rama, filling the quarters and the intermediate directions and raining missiles, Rama aimed at them dazzling gandharvastras, producing a frightening warcry.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As the infuriated demons again hurtled towards Rama, filling the quarters and the intermediate directions and raining missiles, Rama aimed at them dazzling gandharvastras, producing a frightening warcry.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama then let out from his bow, stretched round, thousands of arrows that covered all the ten quarters.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demons, though wounded, could not see whereform the terrible arrows came. They only saw Rama shooting the arrows.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Through the darkness created by the arrows that covered the sky and the Sun, Rama looked as though he was vomitting them.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: It seemed as if it all happened at the same time, the entire earth filling with demons seriously injured, slain and fallen down on the ground.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There were bodies of demons pierced and torn, thinned and fallen down, destroyed, broken and cut into pieces scattered in their thousands.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Slain thus by Rama's arrows, the ground was littered with (bodies of) demons with limbs dismembered, headdresses and shoulders cut off, arms, thighs and knees decked with various ornaments amputated, chariots, horses, best of elephants, fans made of the tail of chamari deer (used as an insignia of royalty), umbrellas, several  flags, and weapons like spears, swords, darts, battleaxes and stones crushed into pieces and arrows splintered and scattered all over. The ground looked frightening. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चविंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the twentyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 25 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Mightyarmed Dusana saw  the army  getting killed in war. He led the forces of five thousand demons, dreadfuly quick at fighting, dangeous to face and who will not beat a retreat.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demons continuously hurled at him (Rama)  spears and swords and rained stones, trees and arrows from all sides
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Righteous Rama, retaliated with his sharp arrows such as the rain of trees and stones, the mighty destroyers of life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama retaliated in great anger to kill without caring for the shower of weapons like a bull with its eyes closed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Overpowered by anger, Rama, with a blazing glow, covered Dusana and his army with his arrows.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter Dusana, chief of the army, angrily released at Rama equally powerful arrows comparable to thunderbolt.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Heroic Rama, mighty angry, then, broke the big bow of  Dusana, with his swordlike arrow. And with a series of four arrows cut his four horses to pieces.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: After killing the horses with sharp arrows Rama severed the charioteer's head with an arrow of the shape of the crescent moon and pierced Dusana's chest with a set of three arrows.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With his bow and chariot broken, charioteer and horses killed,  Dusana took up a spear in his hand that appeared like a huge mountain top. Bound by golden bands, covered the iron nails, wetted with the enemy's marrow it created a horripilation. It appeared as though it  could crush the army of gods and render the enemy powerless. It carried the killing touch of the thunderbolt and could break open the enemy's fort.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With his bow and chariot broken, charioteer and horses killed,  Dusana took up a spear in his hand that appeared like a huge mountain top. Bound by golden bands, covered the iron nails, wetted with the enemy's marrow it created a horripilation. It appeared as though it  could crush the army of gods and render the enemy powerless. It carried the killing touch of the thunderbolt and could break open the enemy's fort.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With his bow and chariot broken, charioteer and horses killed,  Dusana took up a spear in his hand that appeared like a huge mountain top. Bound by golden bands, covered the iron nails, wetted with the enemy's marrow it created a horripilation. It appeared as though it  could crush the army of gods and render the enemy powerless. It carried the killing touch of the thunderbolt and could break open the enemy's fort.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With the spear that looked like a mighty serpent, Dusana, the cruel demon, advanced towards Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing Dusana going to pounce upon him, Rama cut off with two arrows both his arms adorned with armlets.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With the hands amputated, his huge spear, like the banner of Indra, slipped off his hands and fell down on the ground on the battle front.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Dusana fell down on the ground with broken hands like a proud elephant with both his tusks shattered.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing Dusaana collapse dead on the ground, all beings hailed Rama, saying, 'Well done, well done'.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Meanwhile all the three army chiefs, Mahakapala, Sthulaksha, and the mighty Pramathi ran towards Rama in anger, bound (as though) by the noose of death.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Mahakapala had a huge spear, Sthulaksha, a sharpedged spear and Pramathi, a battleaxe.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing them rushing to attack him with sharp weapons, Rama received them quickly with pointed arrows as though they were guests.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Mahakapala's head was cut to pieces with sharp arrows and Pramathi was killed with a countless series  of arrows. Pramathi's body, like a huge tree with many branches collapsed on the ground.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Mahakapala's head was cut to pieces with sharp arrows and Pramathi was killed with a countless series  of arrows. Pramathi's body, like a huge tree with many branches collapsed on the ground.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama filled the eyes of Sthulaksha with sharp arrows, and in anger shot five thousand arrows at the five thousand followers of Dusana in a moment and sent them to the abode of Yama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing Dusana and his followers killed, enraged Khara commanded his extremely strong army chiefs this way:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Dusana and his followers are killed in the battle. You, all the demons, along with your great army and different kinds of weapons should kill that wicked human being, Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Dusana and his followers are killed in the battle. You, all the demons, along with your great army and different kinds of weapons should kill that wicked human being, Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having spoken thus, angry Khara ran towards Rama. Syenagami, Pruthugriva, Yajnasatru, Vihanga, Durjaya, Karaveeraksha, Parusha, Kalakarmuka, Meghamali, Mahamali, Sarpasya, Rudhirasanaall these twelve valiant army chiefs along with their forces rushed towards Rama, releasing the sharpest arrows at him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having spoken thus, angry Khara ran towards Rama. Syenagami, Pruthugriva, Yajnasatru, Vihanga, Durjaya, Karaveeraksha, Parusha, Kalakarmuka, Meghamali, Mahamali, Sarpasya, Rudhirasanaall these twelve valiant army chiefs along with their forces rushed towards Rama, releasing the sharpest arrows at him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having spoken thus, angry Khara ran towards Rama. Syenagami, Pruthugriva, Yajnasatru, Vihanga, Durjaya, Karaveeraksha, Parusha, Kalakarmuka, Meghamali, Mahamali, Sarpasya, Rudhirasanaall these twelve valiant army chiefs along with their forces rushed towards Rama, releasing the sharpest arrows at him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Powerful Rama thereafter slayed the remaining army with his weapons studded with gold and diamonds and glowing like fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The goldtipped arrows which resembled fire covered with smoke shattered the army of demons like huge trees knocked down by thunder.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama killed a hundred demons  with one hundred arrows by a single stroke. The same way he killed a thousand of them with a thousand arrows on the battle front.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demons fell down on the ground with their shields  and ornaments broken, their  bows stained with blood splintered.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The entire ground was littered with bodies of demons fallen in the battle with loose hair and with drops of blood on them looking like a great sacrificial altar strewn all over with kusa grass.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With the slaughtered bodies of demons lying on the ground, the forest in a moment looked very dreadful like hell with the mud of soil soaked with flesh and blood.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Fourteen thousand formidable demons were killed by Rama, a pedestrian human,  singlehanded.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Of that entire army great warrior Khara,Trisira and Rama, destroyer of foes alone remained.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The rest of the mighty, dreadful, intolerable demons were killed on the war front by Rama, elder brother to Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter seeing the formidable army killed by mighty Rama, Khara lifted a thunderbolt like Indra, and advanced towards Rama in a great chariot. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वालमिकिय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षङ्विंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the twentysixth sarga in Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 26 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As Khara advanced towards Rama, Trisira the chief of the army approached him and said these words:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O valiant one assign this work to me. Refrain from this audacity. See how I am going to put down the mightyarmed Rama in the battle.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I promise you on my weapon that I will kill Rama.He who killed all demons deserves to be slain.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Restrain yourself for a moment from the enthusiasm to fight the war. Please act as an arbitrator and see who is killing whom.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If Rama is killed be happy and go to Janasthana or else if I am killed you can fight.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Khara was prevailed upon by Trisara in that manner with a wish to face death, Khara  permitted him  by saying 'You may go and fight'.Accordingly he advanced towards Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Trisira who looked a mountain with three peaks also got horses harnessed to a shining chariot and to attack Rama proceeded.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Trisira unleashed a stream of arrows like a huge cloud (releasing rain). They produced sound, a drum drenched with water, creates.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing demon Trisira advancing towards him, Rama shook sharp arrows off his bow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The tumultuous combat between Rama and Trisira looked like the strong fight between a lion and an elephant.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Rama hit  with three arrows on the forehead by Trisira flew into a fury and said in a state of great excitement:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Oh see the strength of this undaunted demon whose arrows fell like flowers on my forehead and only left a scratch.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Receive the arrows released from my bowstring. Saying so, the angry and agitated Rama discharged fourteen arrows, venomous like a snake, on the chest of Trisira .
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With four arrows having strong joints, the mighty hero (Rama) threw down his enemy's four swiftfooted horses.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama brought down the charioteer with eight arrows and with one tore down the lofty banner of the chariot to shreds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama then hit the demon with arrows on his chest while he was running away from the broken chariot. The demon became numb.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The mighty Rama in fury dismembered the heads of that demon with three sharp and swift arrows.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demon with his heads decapitated, hit by Rama's arrows a little while ago, fell down, vomitting blood.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Those surviving demons who were under the protection of Khara got scared and retreated fast and fled like deer frightened by a tiger.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Personally persuading the fleeing army to come back, the angry Khara leaped forward towards Rama just as Rahu approaches the moon. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तविंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the twentyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 27 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara was overtaken by fear at the prowess of Rama, when he saw Dusana and Trisira killed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara, the mighty demon, saw his large, irrepressible army killed. He saw Trisira and Dusana slain singlehanded by Rama. Nervous, he advanced towards Rama wage war just as Namuchi approached Indra.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara, the mighty demon, saw his large, irrepressible army killed. He saw Trisira and Dusana slain singlehanded by Rama. Nervous, he advanced towards Rama wage war just as Namuchi approached Indra.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara drew his strong bowstring in anger and released the bloodhungry arrows, which appeared like venomous snakes.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara, sat on the chariot, and with a twang of his bowstring released arrows in all directions, exhibiting his skill in the use of weapons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Rama, the great warrior, saw Khara approaching him, he fixed powerful arrows  on his bow and covered all directions and intermediate quarters with his arrows.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He rained sparkling arrows which were irresistible. He filled the sky with arrows just as the raingod fills it with rain without leaving any space.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The arrows released by Khara and Rama on one another filled the entire sky. Everywhere only arrows and no sky could be seen.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While they were engaged in the battle, eager to kill each other the sky was covered with arrow and the Sun could not be seen.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Khara shot Rama with Nalika darts and darts called Vikarni like goads hit a mighty elephant.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Demon Khara positioned on the chariot, bow in hand, appeared to all beings like Yama, god of death holding the noose.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara thought valiant Rama who had destroyed his whole army might be exhausted by now.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Rama saw Khara aggressively advancing like a lion to attack him, he was not perturbed, for he knew he was a fawn before a lion (which Rama was).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Khara mounting a great chariot which was glowing like the Sun, advanced towards Rama just as an insect hurtles towards fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Exhibiting his agility of the hand, Khara shattered the bow and the arrow in the grip of Rama ,the  great soul.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The influriated Khara this time took up seven arrows blazing like Indra's thunderbolt  and hit his armour.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The armour of Rama who looked radiant like the Sun fell on the ground, struck by the welljointed darts released by Khara.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara then attacked Rama of unequal strength in fight, with a thousand darts  and roared loudly.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, scion of the Raghu race, afflicted by the darts in all parts of the body, glowed in his anger like smokeless fire burning.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Rama, destroyer of foes, strung another great bow of fearful sound in order to put an end to the enemy.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter Rama advanced, aiming at Khara the superior Vaishnava bow given by sage Agastya.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama took up in a rage the welljointed, smooth darts with golden feathers and broke the flag post of the chariot of Khara to pieces.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The beautiful, golden flag post, broken into several pieces, fell down on earth.It appeared as if the Sun had come down to earth at the behest of the gods.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Quite enraged, Khara who knew how to hit the tender parts (of the body) in an encounter sent out four arrows on Rama. It was like poking an elephant's limbs with a javelin.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, hit by the arrows released from the bow of Khara, all his limbs drenched in blood, became very furious.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The best among archers and a supreme shooter, he lifted the bow, fixed his target and released six arrows in the great fight.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama hit one arrow on the head, two on the shoulders and three of the shape of the crescent moon on the chest (of the enemy).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Enraged and effulgent Rama took up thirteen darts, radiant like the Sun, with a wish to kill the demon.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, like Indra, strong and mighty, broke the yoke of Khara's chariot with one arrow, the four horses with four arrows, and with the sixth the charioteer's head, with three others the main pole of the chariot, with two the axle of the chariot, and with the twelfth Khara's bow and arrows were splintered. As if laughing at him, he pierced Khara's body with the thirteenth arrow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, like Indra, strong and mighty, broke the yoke of Khara's chariot with one arrow, the four horses with four arrows, and with the sixth the charioteer's head, with three others the main pole of the chariot, with two the axle of the chariot, and with the twelfth Khara's bow and arrows were splintered. As if laughing at him, he pierced Khara's body with the thirteenth arrow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, like Indra, strong and mighty, broke the yoke of Khara's chariot with one arrow, the four horses with four arrows, and with the sixth the charioteer's head, with three others the main pole of the chariot, with two the axle of the chariot, and with the twelfth Khara's bow and arrows were splintered. As if laughing at him, he pierced Khara's body with the thirteenth arrow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then, with bow broken, chariot destroyed, horses and charioteer dead, Khara jumped  down the chariot and stood on the ground holding a mace.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the gods, along with great sages came down in aerial chariots and assembled there. Delighted, they adored Rama, the great warrior, with folded hands for the work done. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकिय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टाविंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the twentyeigth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 28 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Effulgent Rama looked at Khara who stood with a mace in hand minus his chariot  and said to him first in a gentle voice and then harshly :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Although you command a huge army with many elephants, horses, chariots, etc.  you have done such cruel deeds that the entire world despises you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: One who  is wicked, does sinful deeds and causes distress to all beings, will not survive even if he is the lord of the three worlds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O nightranger, one who does a horrific deed which is against the world will be killed like an evil serpent come near.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Whoever commits sinful deeds out of greed or passion and without realisation will be ruined at the end like a lizard that eats hailstone (and dies).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O demon  what benefit will you  get by killing the venerable ascetics, followers of righteous path residing in Dandaka forest?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Cruel people, who are despised by the world for their sinful deeds, will not  be prosperous for long just like trees with decayed roots.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Just as the trees bear flowers at the proper season, so also people will certainly reap the fruits of their terrible, sinful deeds at appropriate time.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O nightranger  people will reap the result of their sinful actions in this world soon like one eating poisonous food.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O nightranger  I have come with the orders of the king to put an end to the lives of the perpetrators of dreadful, sinful and offensive deeds in this world.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Now when I unleash the golden  arrows, they will pierce through your body and come out like serpents emerging from the anthill.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Slain by me in the battle today, you and your army will follow the righteous men eaten by you in Dandaka forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The great seers whom you have earlier tortured and killed will, from their aerial vehicles, see you fallen into hell.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O vile fellow, now you may strike at me as you please. I will make your head fall  down like a palm fruit.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Challenged by Rama  in that manner, Khara, his senses switched off, eyes turned red due to anger, replied laughing :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O son of Dasaratha, it is not praiseworthy to kill ordinary demons in war. Why do you praise yourself for it?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The valiant, strong and the best of men do not at all speak proudly of themselves  and their valour.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama common people, having no control over themselves and the lowest of kshatriyas boast of themselves in the world in a meaningless way as you are doing (now).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When death comes in a battle no hero will name his race and boast of himself unnessarily.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: All your meanness is exhibited by your boasting just as the kusa grass caught by fire appears like gold.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Indeed, (it is strange that) you do not see me holding a mace and standing here like an unshakeable mountain which contains minerals and supports the earth.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Just like lord Yama, holding a noose of death is alone enough to destroy the three worlds, I am alone sufficient to take away your life in war, a mace in hand.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Indeed, I shall not speak any more even though a lot can be said on you. But the Sun is about to set and it will be improper to wage war thereafter.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You have killed these fourteen thousand demons. Therefore, I will wipe their tears by destroying you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having said this, highly enraged Khara adorned with large shoulder bands, hurled  at Rama, his mace glowing like a thunderbolt.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The huge, blazing mace hurled by Khara's arms reduced the trees and shrubs into ashes and came close to Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The mace, which moved in the sky burning like the noose of death was shattered to pieces by Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The mace shattered by the arrows of Rama , fell down scattered to pieces on the ground like a female serpent subdued by the force of mantras and medicine. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनत्रिंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the twentyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 29 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, fond of dharma, broke into pieces Khara's mace with his arrows, and smiling at bewildered Khara, said:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lowly demon, you have already exhibited all your strength. Inferior to me in energy, you are needlessly roaring.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The mace about which you boasted so much has betrayed your confidence. Shattered by my arrows it now lies on the ground.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You said you will wipe the tears of the dead demons. (Now) those words have proved false.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are mean. You have false pride. You are of low behaviour. I shall take away your life, O demon,, Just as Garuda carried off the nectar.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Now with your throat split open by my arrows , the earth will drink your foamy blood full of bubbles.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With all your limbs covered with dust, both the arms dropped down and stretched  out  on the ground, you will sleep as though hugging the earth, like embracing a rare woman.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When you, O vile demon, will go into eternal sleep the Dandaka grounds will provide shelter to those who deserve it here.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O demon, when my arrows destroy your hold over Janasthana the sages will move freely without fear all over this forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having lost all their relations, the demonesses, who were causing fear to others,will move away with faces full of tears.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Your wives, who have got a husband like you, must have been born to a befitting race. They will taste the pangs of sorrow today, for no reasons whatsoever.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O cruel, mean, vile fellow, you had been always opposing the brahmins who pour oblations in fire under fear.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Rama was thus speaking in a state of excitement in the middle of war, the choleric Khara  started abusing him in a harsher tone.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are very haughty. When there is every cause of fear you pretend fearlessness. Being in the grip of death you do not know what to speak and what not to speak.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Those bound by the noose of death, do not know what to and what not to do, as their six senses cease to function.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having said thus to Rama with a frown on his face, Khara, looking around for something to strike him with, saw a huge sal tree not very far.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara, biting his lower lip, uprooted the tree , lifted it with his mighty arms, and shouting at Rama loudly hurled it at him, saying, 'You are dead'.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara, biting his lower lip, uprooted the tree , lifted it with his mighty arms, and shouting at Rama loudly hurled it at him, saying, 'You are dead'.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Brave Rama shattered with a flood of arrows the tree falling over him and summoned sharp anger to end Khara in war.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Full of sweat and with the corners of his eyes turned red, Rama hit Khara with a thousand arrows in the encounter.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With his body pierced with arrows his blood started flowing like the waterfalls flow from mount Prasravana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Completely struck by Rama's arrows, Khara, intoxicated with the smell of  blood, ran speedily charging towards Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama who was an adept in the science of arms picked up his valour quickly and moved a step back (not  to give him an opportunity to strike), looking at the highly agitated Khara falling upon him, with his body fully drenched in blood.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama took a dart glowing like fire which resembled another Brahmadanda to kill Khara in the war.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Righteous Rama placed on his bow the dart given him by wise Indra, king of the gods, and shot it at Khara.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Bending the bow fully, Rama released the arrow roaring like a violent gust of wind, which fell on Khara's chest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Just as Yama was burnt by Rudra's fire(from his eyes) in Swetaranya, Khara collapsed on the ground consumed by the fire of Rama's arrow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Khara fell down just like Vrutra or Bala killed by Indra's thunderbolt or like Numuchi by the froth of the sea.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the rajarsis, great seers gathered together, offered their worship to Rama  and said these words joyfully :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: For this purpose, killer of Paka, the gIorious Indra (who can break a fortress), came to the hermitage of Sarabhanga.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are brought to this place by the great sages who had cleverly devised a plan to kill the cruel sinners, these demons৷৷
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O son of Dasaratha, you have accomplished such a task that hereafter the sages in Dandaka will discharge their rightful duties happily.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Meanwhile the wonderstruck gods along with the charanas (celestial bards) got together and began beating the drums and raining showers of flowers on Rama from all sides.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'In a little more than half a moment of this great war Rama had accomplished the terrific task of killing with sharp darts fourteen thousand demons, led by Khara and Dusana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'In a little more than half a moment of this great war Rama had accomplished the terrific task of killing with sharp darts fourteen thousand demons, led by Khara and Dusana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Rama who knows the self has performed a great work. Oh what prowess what efficiency  only lord Visnu could do this'. So saying all the gods went back to their respective destinations.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In the mean time, heroic Lakshmana accompanied by Sita came out of the mountain cave happily and entered the hermitage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then victorious Rama having been worshipped by the seers and also by Lakshmana entered the hermitage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing Rama killing the enemies of the great sages for their happiness Sita felt glad and embraced her husband.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita, daughter of Janaka, was happy to see the demons killed by Rama who himself was unhurt.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the daughter of Janaka, cheerful Sita, who had a face bright like the moon, embraced Rama, destroyer of demons who was worshipped by the delighted sages. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीये आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the thirtieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 30 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Quickly did Akampana leave Janasthana, and quickly he entered Lanka. He said to Ravana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 31 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O king many demons dwelling at Janasthana including Khara have been killed. I manged to escape with much difficulty.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 31 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
