Waiting eagerly for her husband, she only saw the vast stretch of green forest  but not Rama and Lakshmana. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षट्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fortysixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Ravana in the guise of a mendicant with crooked intention to abduct her, asked Vaidehi to tell him about herself.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'He is a brahmin and also a guest. If unanswered he may curse me'. Thinking this Sita thought for a moment and said:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best of brahmins be pleased to know I am Sita by name, daughter of the great Janaka, king of Mithila and wife of Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I lived in the house of the Ikshvakus for twelve years and enjoyed all kinds of pleasures meant for mortals.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In the thirteenth year, the king and lord Dasaratha consulted other kings and ministers to consecrate Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Arrangements for consecration were on when queen Kaikeyi sought a boon from the king.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: For the fulfilment of the promise made to Kaikeyi earlier by my truthful fatherin law, who, to my good luck, was the best of kings, she asked for two boons. One was banishment of my husband and second, consecration of Bharata.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I shall not eat, or sleep or even drink if Rama is consecrated and I shall put an end to my life itself' (said Kaikeyi).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The king, my fatherinlaw, who respected her offered riches. Which she did not accept.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My husband who was very bold was twentyfive years and I had completed eighteen years since my birth.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My husband known in the world as Rama is largeeyed, longarmed, virtuous, truthful, pure and is always engaged in the welfare of all beings.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The brilliant king, Dasaratha, father of Rama, overcome by passion,  did not consecrate Rama in order to please Kaikeyi.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When my husband Rama approached his father for the consecration she said these unhesitating words:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama, listen, your father has ordered that this kingdom be bestowed on Bharata without any obstacles.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama of the Kakutstha dynasty, you should live in the forest for fourteen years and save your father from falsehood'.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My husband Rama, a man of fearlessness and firm resolution, said to Kaikeyi 'Be it so' and carried out her words.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O brahmin this is his firm resolve and his great vow: 'One should give and never take one should speak the truth and nothing but he truth.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Son to the second mother of Rama, his mighty halfbrother, by name, Lakshmana, a tiger among men and a  slayer of enemies in battle is a companion to him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana, his brother, is righteous and steadfast. Bow in hand, he followed Rama along with me, into exile.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama who is ever righteous and selfcontrolled entered the Dandaka forest with matted locks, his brother and me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best of brahmins three of us have been wandering with courage in the deep forest, dislodged from  the kingdom on account of  Kaikeyi.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rest here awhile. My husband will return with plenty of meat of many kinds from the forest, killing deer, alligators and wild boars.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rest here awhile. My husband will return with plenty of meat of many kinds from the forest, killing deer, alligators and wild boars.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O brahmin, tell me your name, your gotra and your pedigree. And the purpose for which you are going about all alone in this Dandaka forest
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To these words of Sita, Rama's wife, Ravana, the powerful king of demons, replied  sharp:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Sita I am called Ravana, the lord of demons by whom all the worlds of demons, snakes and gods are frightened.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O flawless beauty of golden complexion seeing you clad in silk, I am not inclined to show any interest in my own wives.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You will be the chief queen among the best of women I have won in wars. Be blessed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My great city  called Lanka is on the peak of a mountain surrounded by, and in the middle of, the sea.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Sita, you can stroll with me in my pleasuregardens. O  beautiful lady, you will not like living in the forest (thereafter).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Sita  if you become my wife, five thousand female attendants adorned with all ornaments will attend on you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus addressed by Ravana, Janaki, a lady of blemishless limbs, got enraged and replied without caring for the demon:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am devoted to Rama, my husband, who is unshakeable like a huge mountain, is comparable to lord Indra and is imperturbable like the mighty ocean.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am the loyal wife of venerable Rama who is endowed with all excellences, a refuge to all like  a spreading banyan tree, and a votary of truth.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am the faithful wife of the longarmed, broadchested  Rama,  a lion among men. His gait is the gait of an advancing, invincible lion.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am the devoted wife of great Rama, whose face is like a fullmoon, who is the son of a king, who has conquered his senses and whose fame is widespread (on earth).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are a jackal, and you want a lioness like me who is difficult to win. I am like the Sun's radiance whom you cannot even touch.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O luckless Ravana  you want the beloved wife of Rama.You will, for sure, see golden trees. (which those close to death do).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are seeking to pull the teeth from  the mouth of a hungry and powerful lion who is considered the enemy of the deer(which you are). You intend to pull the fang of a poisonous snake.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are trying to carry the greatest of mountains, the Mandara, with one hand. You are wishing to go safe after drinking deadly poison (produced from the churning of the ocean).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You wish to violate the loving wife of Rama. You are rubbing your eyes with a needle and licking the razor with your tongue.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You want to assault Rama's dear wife. It is like girding a stone round the neck and trying to cross the sea.It is like intending to take the Sun and the Moon with both your hands.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You intend to assaut the wife of Rama, who is a lady of virtuous conduct. You wish to hold blazing fire in your cloth.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You want to acquire Rama's worthy wife. You wish to walk on sharp ironheaded spear.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The difference between you and Rama is the difference between a jackal and a lion in the forest, between a ditch and the sea, and between sour gruel and the best of wines.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The difference between you and Rama is the difference  between gold and lead, sandal and slime, an elephant and a cat of the forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The difference between you and Dasaratha's son is the difference between a crow and Garuda, a watercrane and a peacock, a vulture and a swan in the forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: So long Rama, equal in prowess to the thousandeyed Indra stands with bow and arrows in hand, I will not, although abducted, wither away like a diamond gulped by an insect (fly).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having said thus to the wicked nightwalker Ravana, Sita, pure in thought remained  distressed.Her slender body started trembling like a banana plant becomes shaken by a violent wind.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Beholding Sita who was trembling, Ravana, powerful like death, started telling about himself, his clan, his strength and his deeds to instil more fear in her. इत्तयार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fortyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Addressed thus by Sita, Ravana, his anger roused, knitted his eyebrows with a frown on his forehead and replied to her harshly:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O paragon of beauty  I am the halfbrother of Kubera, born of his stepmother. I am known as the tenheaded, powerful Ravana. Be blessed
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Just as people get scared of death, all (creatures) including gandharvas, gods, evil spirits, birds and snakes run away from me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: For some reason or other a duel took place between me and king Kubera. With my prowess, I defeated him in the duel.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Out of fear for me, Kubera is residing on the mighty mount Kailasa, leaving his own earlier prosperous place of residence.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O noble lady  with my valour I gained over from Kubera the aerial chariot 'Pushpaka', which can go wherever one desires and in which I move about in the sky.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Princess from Mithila, seeing my angry face  even gods led by Indra take to their heels in fear.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Wherever I am, the Windgod blows with hesitation. So are the Sun and the Moon afraid of me. Afraid of me the Sun duly discharges his duties.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Wherever I stay or move about, the leaves of trees do not shake, and the waters in rivers remain still.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My city known as Lanka, teeming with terrific demons, is on the other side of the sea. It is  beautiful like the city of Indra's Amaravati.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The beautiful city of Lanka  shines with its pale white ramparts and golden interiors. The entrance gates are encrusted with vaidurya (cat'seye).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: It is crowded with elephants, horses and chariots. It resounds with the music of trumpets. The trees in the delightful pleasuregardens yield fruits in all seasons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O highminded princess, O Sita while living with me, you will not even think of other women.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O blessed lady of fine complexion, while enjoying both human and heavenly  pleasures with me there, you will not remember Rama who is a mortal of short lifespan.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Considering the eldest son a weakling, king Dasaratha has sent him away to the forest so that he could consecrate his dear son(Bharata).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O largeeyed Sita dislodged from the kingdom, Rama has lost his capacity to think. He is doing penance, assuming an ascetic role. What can he do (for you)?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am lord of all the demons. You should not reject me I am here (only because I am) overcome by the arrows of the god of love.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O timid lady if you reject me, you will regret like Urvasi who kicked Pururava and regretted later.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lady of fine complexion, Rama is a (mere) mortal. In war he is no match (even) for my finger. It is your good fortune that you have got me here. Take refuge in me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus addressed, Sita was enraged and her eyes turned red. She replied in harsh words to the chief of the demons in that solitary place:.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Why do you wish to do something inauspicious by calling Lord Kubera who is worshipped by all beings your brother ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Ravana ,you are cruel and evilminded. You have no control over your senses. (And yet) you are the ruler of your breed. Surely they are going to be destroyed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: It may be possible (for some one) to live after abducting Indra's wife, Sachi, but it is not possible for any one to live after kidnapping the wife of Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O demon, you may live long after forcibly snatching the most beautiful Sachi, from the hands of Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, but after abusing a woman like me, you will not be released from death even if you drink nectar. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fortyeighty sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing the Sita's words, the powerful Ravana struck his palms one over the other and assumed a huge form (original figure).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana again said to that princess from Mithila, I suppose you are too insane to disregard my strength and valour.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Standing in the sky, I can  lift the earth with my arms.  I can drink the oceans. I can kill even the god of death in a combat.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I can obstruct the Sun and shatter the earth with my sharp arrows. O mad woman I am a husband who can fulfil your desires, and can assume any form at my own free will. Look at me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As Ravana exploded in anger, his ambercoloured eyes turned red like the radiance of the flaming fire, and almost as bright as the Sun.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana, brother of Kubera, shed the gentle figure of a mendicant and assumed the form of the god of death.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Overcome by intense anger, Ravana's eyes reddened. The nightranger, stood armed with bow and arrows and shining with glittering gold ornaments, appeared like a black cloud.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana, chief of the demons, shed the mendicant's form and assumed his real self. Clad in red garments, his eyes turned red in anger. Looking like layers of clouds, he stood in front of Sita, a gem among women.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana, chief of the demons, shed the mendicant's form and assumed his real self. Clad in red garments, his eyes turned red in anger. Looking like layers of clouds, he stood in front of Sita, a gem among women.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana said to the princess from Mithila, whose black hair was shining, who was luminous like the Sun and was clad in the best of clothes and ornaments.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O beautiful lady  if you desire a husband who is famous in the three worlds, take refuge in me. I am fit to be your husband.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am your praiseworthy husband. I will not cause any unpleasantness to you at any time. Abandon on your inclination towards, a (mere) mortal. Divert your love to me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am your praiseworthy husband. I will not cause any unpleasantness to you at any time. Abandon on your inclination towards, a (mere) mortal. Divert your love to me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O stupid woman you think you are very wise. What is there in Rama so that you are attached to him ? He has left the kingdom and his kith and kin due to the words of a woman. He has not accomplished anything (in life). He has a limited life span and now lives in this forest haunted by wild animals.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O stupid woman you think you are very wise. What is there in Rama so that you are attached to him ? He has left the kingdom and his kith and kin due to the words of a woman. He has not accomplished anything (in life). He has a limited life span and now lives in this forest haunted by wild animals.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Just as Budha (planet Mercury) catches Rohini (a cluster of five stars) in the sky, the evilminded, infatuated Ravana advanced towards the pitiable, pleasing Sita and caught hold of her.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana seized with his left hand the lotuseyed Sita by the hair and lifted her by the thighs with his right hand.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The sylvan deities fled out of fear on seeing the dreadful appearance of Ravana who had sharp teeth and mighty arms. He looked like a mountain, a veritable god of death.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There arrived the great  golden chariot of Ravana, illusive and wonderful, harnessed with donkeys and braying like donkeys.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Reproaching the princess from Videha loudly and harshly, Ravana took her on his lap and put her on the chariot.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seized by Ravana, illustrious Sita screamed aloud Alas, Rama. for one who was far away in the forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Passionate Ravana took hold of Sita who was not willing and was writhing in pain. He seized her  like (an eagle carrying away) a serpent queen and flew up.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Sita was being carried off in the sky by the king of demons,   she screamed a lot in agony and anxiety like a mad woman in a bewildered state:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Alas, O longarmed Lakshmana, you who used to entertain your brother do not know that I am being carried away by this ruthless demon.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, you have given up your life, pleasure and treasure for the sake of righteousness. Do you not see me carried off by an unrighteous fellow ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O scorcher of enemies you are the chastiser of the haughty. Why do you not punish such a sinner like Ravana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The effect of arrogant action cannot be seen right away. Just as the crop yields results only after ripening, in the same way it takes time. Time acts as a supporting factor.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Time has taken a toll of your senses. This has made you do what you have done. A great calamity is awaiting you in the hands of Rama. It will end your life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Alas, the lawful wife of the glorious and righteous Rama is being abducted now. Let Kaikeyi along with her relations be happy with her desire fulfilled.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O karnikar trees in full bloom in Janasthana, tell Rama quickly that Ravana is kidnapping Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I salute to Malyavan and  Prasravana mountains. Tell Rama at once that Ravana is carrying away Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O river Godavari abounding in swans and cranes, my salutations to you  Tell Rama immediately that Ravana is taking away Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I offer my salutations to different deities residing in this forest abounding in trees of many kinds. Tell my husband about me that I am being whisked away.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I seek refuge in all those living beings as well as herds of animals and birds in the forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Tell Rama that his dear wife Sita whom he loves more than his life is abducted helplessly.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If he knows that I am abducted by Yama, the god of death, that mighty, longarmed hero will save me even from there by virtue of his valour.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When the griefstricken, largeeyed Sita was lamenting piteously, she saw the vulture (Jatayu) seated on a tree.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The heavyhipped Sita felt frightened in the grip of Ravana. When she saw Jatayu she screamed, shaken by sorrow:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Jatayu, see me now being carried away by the sinful king of demons in this pitiable condition as though I am an orphan.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This nightranger is equipped with weapons. Cruel, strong and evilminded, he has won wars. You cannot stop him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Jatayu narrate to Rama and Lakshmana the exact facts of my abduction and all the details without any omission. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fortyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While reposing, Jatayu heard the cry and at once looked up and saw Ravana and Vaidehi.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Glorious Jatayu, the best among the birds, looked like the peak of a mountain. His beak was sharp. His words were auspious. He spoke from the top of the tree:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O tenheaded Ravana, I am Jatayu, king of vultures. I am mighty. An eternal follower, of dharma, I am an adherent to truth.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, Dasaratha's son, is the king of the entire world. He is equal to Indra and Varuna. He is ever engaged in the welfare of the entire world.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The lady you want to abduct from here is the famous Sita, the lawful wife of Rama, the lord of the world.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: How can a king who adheres to righteousness outrage another's wife ? O powerful one, a king's wife in particular should be protected.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Refrain yourself from the vile thought of violating other's wives. Wise men do not adopt what is censured by others. Just like one's own, the wise should protect other's wives.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O son of Paulastya learned men determine the path of dharma artha and kama,  following a king's conduct even if  they are not declared in sastras.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A king is the best repository of rigteousness, material wealth and pleasures. The king is the root of dharma, virtue and sin.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best of demons  by nature you are sinful, and fickleminded. You do all forbidden acts. Otherwise,how could you get this wealth, like the celestial chariot?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Indeed, it is not possible to erase the nature of any one, whatever it be. Prosperity does not rest for long in the house of the evilminded.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Powerful and righteous Rama has not offended you, your kingdom or your city. Why do you offend him?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On account of Surpanakha, Khara trespassed into Janasthana and got killed by Rama, without much effort. Tell me truly, what transgression (of dharma) did he commit for which you are stealing away the wife of Rama who is the lord of this world?.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On account of Surpanakha, Khara trespassed into Janasthana and got killed by Rama, without much effort. Tell me truly, what transgression (of dharma) did he commit for which you are stealing away the wife of Rama who is the lord of this world?.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Leave Vaidehi at once lest with her fierce looks you should be burnt down like demon Vrtra by the thunderbolt of Indra.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are not aware that you are tying a venomous snake with the skirt of your cloth. worn by you. You are not able to see the noose of death tightened around your neck.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O gentle Ravana one should carry that much of weight which does not tire him. One should eat only that wholesome food which can be easily digested.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Who will do such a deed which cannot beget dharma, fame or glory in the world? Who will do such deeds that bring only exhaustion to the body?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sixty thousand years ago I was born, O Ravana  Since then I have ruled justly my hereditary kingdom.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am old, you are young, wielding a bow and arrows, with shield to protect and chariot to ride. Even then I will not let you go safe with Vaidehi kidnapped.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You cannot carry Vaidehi by force within my very sight just as the everlasting revelations of the Vedas cannot be robbed by mere logic of reason.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Ravana, if you are brave, fight with me. In a moment, you will be killed like Khara and lie down on the ground.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Clad in bark garments, Rama, who has often slain demons in the past will soon kill you in war.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: What can I do? O mean fellow the two princes have gone far away.You will soon be destroyed out of fear for them. There is no doubt.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I will not let you take away the auspicious, lotuseyed Sita, the dear consort of Rama as long as I am alive.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I should do this important work of those great souls, Rama and Dasaratha, even if it claims my life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O ten headed Ravana stay, stay for a while. O demon  as long as I am alive I will treat you with the hospitality of war. You will be pulled down from this best of the chariots like a ripe fruit drops from the stalk. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fiftieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana's twenty eyes glowed like fire in anger after Jatayu thus rightly said.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As the bright gold earrings of the intolerant king of demons glittered, his eyes turned red in rage and he pounced upon Jatayu, the lord of birds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The clash between them was tumultuous and it appeared like the clash of two pieces of clouds in the sky raised by stormy winds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The duel between Ravana and Jatayu looked as though it was a fight between two huge winged mountains of Malyavan range.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the mighty Ravana rained sharp, dreadful shafts, spears and Vikarnis at Jatayu,  king of vultures.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Jatayu, lord of the birds, faced the arrows and other weapons showered  by Ravana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The mighty, virtuous vulture with his sharp claws wounded many parts of the body of Ravana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana in a rage took ten dreadful darts (looking) like the staff of death with a desire to crush the enemy.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The mighty Ravana fully released his dreadful, sharp arrows that went straight and pierced the vulture.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing Sita, daughter of Janaka, on the demon's chariot with eyes full of tears, Jatayu without minding the arrows renewed his attack.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The glorious lord of birds crushed with his feet the bow and arrow of Ravana with pearls and gems encrusted.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Overcome with anger, Ravana took another bow and rained (on him) hundreds and thousands of arrows.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Jatayu, shot with arrows on all sides in the combat, shone like the bird that returned to its nest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Powerful Jatayu scattered the shower of arrows with his wings and broke down the great bow with his claws.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Mighty Jatayu, lord of the birds, shattered with his wings the armour of Ravana that was glowing like fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Powerful Jatayu killed in the combat, the splendid, swiftmoving, devilfaced asses with  golden shields yoked to the chariot.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then he(Jatayu) broke down the great chariot(of Ravana) glowing like fire, glittering with gold and gems, made of three bamboo reeds, and capable of flying wherever the rider willed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Jatayu violently pulled down the parasol shining like the full moon and the fans of the chariot along with the demons holding them.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Again the glorious, powerful king of birds swiftly shattered the huge head of the charioteer with his beak.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With the bow broken, the chariot destroyed, asses (drawing the chariot) and the charioteer dead,  Ravana fell down on the ground holding Vaidehi on his lap.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing Ravana fallen on the ground with his broken chariot, all beings honoured the king of the birds, saying, Well done Well done
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing the lord of the flocks of birds exhausted due to age still fighting, Ravana felt glad. He flew back into the sky taking Sita, princess of Mithila, with him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing Sita, Janaka's daughter, happily carried away into the sky by Ravana on his lap. Jatayu, the mighty king of vultures chased him, and obstructing his path said :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Foolish Ravana, you are kidnapping this lady, wife of Rama, whose arrows can hit like a thunderbolt. This will lead to the destruction of all demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are drinking poison along with all your friends, relatives, ministers, the army and  your allies. like a thirsty man drinks water.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Fools who do not know the consequences of their action perish soon. Similarly you are going to die soon.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are bound by the noose of death like a fish holding on to the bait of the fishing hook. Where can you go now?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Ravana  know that Rama and Lakshmana, the Kakutsthas, are invincible. They will not forgive the asssault you have made on their hermitage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Your cowardly action will be condemned by the whole world. The path you have chosen is the path of a thief and not of a hero.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Ravana if you are courageous, tarry awhile and fight with me. Like your brother Khara, you will lie on the ground dead.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You have resorted to unrighteous action like a dying man. This will spell your destruction.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If the consequences of an action be sin, who will do it ? Even the selfborn lord of the world may not.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Brave Jatayu having thus said these cautious words to the demon dashed against his back again and again.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter, seizing Ravana, Jatayu ascended on his back and pierced his body all over with his sharp claws just as a rider goads an unruly elephant.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Jatayu who had  his claws, wings and beak as the only weapons  pierced and pricked  Ravana all over with his nails by pressing his beak on his back and pulled out his hair.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus tormented again and again by the king of vultures, Ravana shook with anger, his lips quivering.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Losing his senses, with rage, Ravana held Vaidehi (Sita) with his left arm and hit Jatayu with his palm.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Jatayu, lord of the birds, subduer of enemies, overpowered Ravana and dismembered his ten left arms with his beak.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As the left arms were cut off, there came out from them all the ten arms instantaneously like serpents emitting poisonous flames from anthills
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the tenheaded Ravana left Sita and attacked Jatayu with his fists and feet out of anger.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Between the warriors of unequal valour, Ravana and Jatayu, the chief of the demons and the foremost of the birds, the fight took place for a moment.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana lifted his sword and cut off both the wings and feet of Jatayu who was fighting relentlessly (for Rama's sake).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: (Seriously) wounded and almost dead,the vulture fell down on the ground all at once, when his wings were chipped by the demon of terrible deeds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita, princess of Videha, saw the wounded Jatayu fallen on the ground drenched in blood. Grieving, she ran towards him as if he was her relative.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lord of Lanka saw that very bold Jatayu of dark blue colour of the cloud, fair chest, fallen on the ground, looking like the forest fire that had been put out.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita, daughter of Janaka, whose face was radiant like the Moon once again embraced  Jatayu, the winged warrior, fallen on the ground, crushed by Ravana's onslaught and wept. इतयार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fiftyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 51 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita,whose face was like the lord of the stars (Moon), saw Jatayu, king of birds, struck down by Ravana, and lamented in extreme grif :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: People, for sure, foresee weal and woe in life from auspicious symptoms and ominous sounds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama you are, indeed, unaware of the great disaster that has befallen you. All the animals and birds are running for my sake to tell you about me, O scion  of the Kakutsthas.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This bird that came forward to save me is hit by the sinner(Ravana) and lies down on the ground, as ill luck would have it.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Terribly frightened, the beautiful lady (Sita) cried bitterly, 'O Rama, O Lakshmana, save me', as if they were close by and were listening to her.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana, king of the demons, ran towards Sita who was weeping like an orphan with her garlands and ornaments crushed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Separated from Rama in the forest, Sita hugged huge trees, running round and round like a creeper coiled, crying loudly, 'Rama, O Rama' . The king of the demons, like Yama, caught hold of her hair only to invite his death, all the time saying, Leave it, Leave it  (Leave the tree).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Separated from Rama in the forest, Sita hugged huge trees, running round and round like a creeper coiled, crying loudly, 'Rama, O Rama' . The king of the demons, like Yama, caught hold of her hair only to invite his death, all the time saying, Leave it, Leave it  (Leave the tree).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Sita was being assaulted, the earth with the animate and the inanimate crossed all limits of moral law and became enveloped in blinding darkness. The wind  ceased to blow and the Sun, to shine.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Brahma, the glorious Grandfather, saw with his divine eyes, Sita in a desperate state caught by the enemy and said, 'The task is accomplished.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: All the great seers residing in Dandaka forest felt both happy and sad, happy because the destruction of Ravana is at hand and sad because Sita was in distress.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: All the great seers residing in Dandaka forest felt both happy and sad, happy because the destruction of Ravana is at hand and sad because Sita was in distress.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Sita was crying, 'O Rama, O Lakshmana', Ravana, lord of the demons, carried her back into the sky.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: SIta who had put on pure gold ornaments on her body and who was clad in yellow silk  shone like lightning.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana was shining all the more with(her) yellow clothes blowing in the air, and looked like a mountain shining with fire burning around.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The red lotus petals worn by the most auspicious Sita, princess of Videha, were showered on Ravana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As the goldencoloured garment worn by Sita blew in the wind, it looked like a coppercoloured cloud illumined by the evening Sun in the sky.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita's face with her beautiful nose on Ravana's lap and not on Rama's, shone no more like a lotus without its stalk.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita's face looked beautiful with her smooth forehead, shining hair and spotless complexion like the inside of a lotus, with clean, white, shining teeth, a nice nose and lovely red lips. She was continuously weeping and wiping her tears. Her face which was pleasing like the Moon on the lap of Ravana appeared as though the Moon was rising through dark clouds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita's face looked beautiful with her smooth forehead, shining hair and spotless complexion like the inside of a lotus, with clean, white, shining teeth, a nice nose and lovely red lips. She was continuously weeping and wiping her tears. Her face which was pleasing like the Moon on the lap of Ravana appeared as though the Moon was rising through dark clouds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita's face looked beautiful with her smooth forehead, shining hair and spotless complexion like the inside of a lotus, with clean, white, shining teeth, a nice nose and lovely red lips. She was continuously weeping and wiping her tears. Her face which was pleasing like the Moon on the lap of Ravana appeared as though the Moon was rising through dark clouds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Shaken up by the demon and deprived of Rama's company, Sita's beautiful face looked like the Moon during daytime without any glow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Goldencomplexioned Sita, princess of Mithila, held by the darkcoloured king of the demons, shone like a girdle resting on a dark blue sapphire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Bright like a golden lotus, adorned with gold ornaments, Sita, the daughter of Janaka, held by Ravana, looked like a streak of lightning shining bright in a dark cloud.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The lord of the demons by the side of Sita, princess of Videha with her jingling ornaments looked like the darkblue raincloud with its lightning and thunder.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As Sita was being carried away, the shower of flowers dropped from her head and scattered on the earth.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The shower of flowers that fell flew towards the tenheaded Ravana again in the swirling motion (of the chariot).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The shower of flowers that dropped went round towards Ravana, brother of Vaisravana, like the bright garland of stars move towards mount Meru.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The gemstudded anklet of Sita, looking like an orb of lightning, dropped with a gentle sound.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With her golden girdle, Sita whose complexion resembled tender leaves looked like a golden chain to bind an elephant with. (Here Ravana is the elephant).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The younger brother of Vaisravana (Ravana), like a massive comet, carried Sita, who was glowing in the radiance of her own beauty, and entered the sky.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Like the dim stars falling from the sky, her ornaments, bright as flame, scattered on the groundtinkling.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita's necklace shining like the bright Moon slipped from between her breasts like the river Ganga falling down from the sky.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The trees filled with birds of all kinds, shaken at the top by stormy winds seemed to be saying to Sita, 'Be not afraid'.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lotusponds with withering lotuses and with disturbed aquatic life like fishes in fright were as if grieving for Sita as one would grieve for a companion who is unable to breathe.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the lions, tigers, deer and birds gathered together in anger (also anguish) and ran after Sita's shadow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The  mountains were  shedding tears in the form of waterfalls, and  crying with hands lifted up in the form of peaks, while Sita was being carried away.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing Sita abducted, the glorious Sun looked lustreless and distraught. He developed a pale white disk around him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Rama's consort, the princess of Videha, is being carried away by Ravana, how can there be rightousness or truth or uprightness or compassion for men? Thus bewailed all beings in groups.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The young deer full of fear and distress looked again and again with eyes blurred with tears at the direction in which Sita went. And wept.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The  sylvan deities shivered, seeing Sita's grief and cried aloud.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The ten headed Ravana abducted Sita who was calling out, O Rama, O Lakshmana with her sweet voice, weeping , looking down on the earth her hair dishevelled and auspicious, (vermilion) mark on the forehead erased. Ravana abducted this highminded Sita for his own destruction.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The ten headed Ravana abducted Sita who was calling out, O Rama, O Lakshmana with her sweet voice, weeping , looking down on the earth her hair dishevelled and auspicious, (vermilion) mark on the forehead erased. Ravana abducted this highminded Sita for his own destruction.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Sita  whose teeth were  beautiful and smile, sweet was distanced from her kins, and, unable to see both Rama and Lakshmana, grew pale in intense fear. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fiftysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 52 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita, daughter of Janaka, princess of Mithila felt miserable, looking at Ravana taking off and got very  much agitated out of fear.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While being carried away, Sita wept piteously and her eyes went red with tears of anger and grief. Looking at the frightening eyes of the king of the demons, she said these words :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O mean Ravana, are you not ashamed of kidnapping me when I was separated (from my husband)?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O wicked fellow, with an intention to abduct me you enticed my husband to a distance deceitfully in the form of a deer.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This Jatayu, an old friend of my fatherinlaw tried to protect me but he too has fallen a prey.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lowly demon, you have, indeed, shown your heroism  (in killing this old vulture). You have not won me in a battle declared by you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lowly fellow how is it that you are not ashamed of commiting such a despicable act  abducting another's wife when she is alone ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You consider yourself to be brave after committing such a cruel, despicable and unrighteous act for which people of the world will condemn you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Fie upon your heroism and strength about which you boasted. Fie upon your character that would bring calumny to the race and the world. I condemn such behaviour of yours.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Tarry a little, you will not go back with life. What can be done now since you are running away so swiftly?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If you come within sight of these two princes, it will not be possible for you to live for a moment even if you are with your entire army.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Just as a bird cannot bear the touch of forest fire, you will not be able to endure the mere touch of arrows of the two heroes indeed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Ravana be good and do whatever is beneficial to you. It is proper for you to release me. If you do not, enraged over my assault, my husband along with his brother, will bring about your destruction.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O vile creature, the effort you are making to abduct me forcibly will be fruitless.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I will not be eager to hold on to my life for long to live at the mercy of the enemy without being able to see my godlike husband.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: At the time of death, mortals behave very differently. They act contrary to their own welfare. Likewise you are not able to foresee what is beneficial and good for you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Those who wish to die, do not like anything salutary. I see the noose of death wound round your neck now.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O tenheaded Ravana, since you do not fear the source of fear, evidently you see golden trees. (a symptom of death).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Ravana, you see the dreadful river Vaitarani with torrents of blood flowing and frightening forest of trees with swords as leaves.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You will see a log of salmali tree with bright golden flowers and excellent vaidurya stone with pointed iron thorns.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are pitiless. You will not be able to survive for long after deceiving such noble Rama just as man cannot survive after drinking poison.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Ravana you are bound by the inevitable noose of death. Where shall you get away from great Rama, my husband to obtain peace.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama has killed fourteen thousand demons alone without his brother within a moment. He is a strong warrior and wellversed in the use of all kinds of weapons. You have stolen his loving wife. How can he live without killing you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama has killed fourteen thousand demons alone without his brother within a moment. He is a strong warrior and wellversed in the use of all kinds of weapons. You have stolen his loving wife. How can he live without killing you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita, daughter of Videha, full of sorrow and fear under Ravana's grip uttered these partly harsh and partly piteous wordsweeping.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sinful Ravana carried away the beautiful princess trembling with great fear, struggling helplessly, crying pathetically and pleading in many mournful ways. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fiftythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 53 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Sita was being kidnapped, she saw no one to protect her. Only five great monkeys stood on the top of a mountain.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Largeeyed, bright and beautiful Sita dropped her upper silk garment shining like gold and auspicious ornaments in their midst with a hope they may report this  to Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In his excitement Ravana failed to notice when Sita dropped down that garment along with ornaments in their midst.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The best among the tawneyeyed monkeys gazed, without blinking, at the  largeeyed Sita lamenting.
