output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana crossed the lake Pampa and flew towards the city of Lanka carrying with him lamenting daughter of Videha.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Delighted Ravana, carried off Sita, the very embodiment of his death, like one carrying a highly poisonous sharpfanged female snake on his lap.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Like an arrow released from the bow, Ravana went through the sky, at once crossing forests, rivers mountains and tanks.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana soon crossed the refuge of rivers, the abode of Varuna, god of the sea, inexhaustible ocean, and the home for whales and crocodiles.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Sita, princess of Videha was being carried away, the ocean, abode of Varuna got bewildered, waves rolled back, the movement of big serpents and fishes stopped.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The charanas and siddhas moving in the sky said, O tenheaded Ravana this is your  end .
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana entered the city of Lanka holding Sita who was tossing from side to side and who was the very embodiment of his death.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana went through the well laidout roads of the city of Lanka and through the well many guarded halls of the palace and entered the inner apartment.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita, with her dark eye lashes and lost in utter sorrow was kept in the harem by Ravana, like demon Maya kept Mayamayi.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana ordered the female goblins of fearful appearance,'Let no outsider whether man or woman, see her, without my permission'.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Pearls, gems or gold, clothes or ornaments, whatever she desires, be made available to her without any hesitation.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Whoever utters any unpleasant words knowingly or unknowingly to Sita, princess of Videha is not worthy to survive (must be killed).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The courageous lord of the demons, having said so to the demonesses, came out of the inner apartment. While contemplating the future course of action, he saw eight powerful, carnivorous demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The courageous lord of the demons, having said so to the demonesses, came out of the inner apartment. While contemplating the future course of action, he saw eight powerful, carnivorous demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The mighty Ravana, deluded by the boons, praised the strength and valour of the demons and said :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Armed with different weapons, proceed at once to Janasthana where Khara lived and died.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Go and there in the desolate Janasthana where all demons had been killed, leaving all your apprehensions and relying on your strength and vigour.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I had stationed a great army at Janasthana, who were all killed along with Khara and Dusana by Rama's arrows.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My anger engineered by my intolerance has crossed the limits of my patience. It has created in me a terrific enmity against Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I want to take revenge on my foe. I shall not sleep until I kill him in a combat.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I will be happy only after killing the destroyer of Khara and Dusana, just as a poor man feels happy only on acquiring wealth.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While dwelling at Janasthana, all of you should collect exact information about the activities of Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: All of you, O nightrangers, should be on the alert there and it should be always your duty to try to kill Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I have seen your strength on many war fronts. That is why you have been assigned this  duty at Janasthana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The eight demons were glad to hear the pleasing and meaningful words of Ravana. They offered him salutations and left Lanka in the direction of Janasthana without being seen by any one.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the demon Ravana felt greatly happy for getting Sita, princess of Mithila, without knowing in his delusion that he had created the bitterest enmity with Rama. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वामलीकीये आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुःपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fiftyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 54 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: After ordering the eight most fierce  and powerful demons, Ravana had a sense of accomplishment within himself because of his perverse intellect.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thinking about Vaidehi and hit by the arrows of Cupid (the god of love). Ravana hastened to see Sita and entered the beautiful home.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana, lord of the demons, entered his residence and saw Sita full of grief in the midst of the demonesses.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demon Ravana forcibly took Sita, her face full of tears, to show her his heavenlike home. Inflicted with grief she looked wretched. She resembled a female deer hounded out of the herd. With her head bent in grief, she looked pathetic like one not under her control, like a boat sinking under the sea driven by the wind.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demon Ravana forcibly took Sita, her face full of tears, to show her his heavenlike home. Inflicted with grief she looked wretched. She resembled a female deer hounded out of the herd. With her head bent in grief, she looked pathetic like one not under her control, like a boat sinking under the sea driven by the wind.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demon Ravana forcibly took Sita, her face full of tears, to show her his heavenlike home. Inflicted with grief she looked wretched. She resembled a female deer hounded out of the herd. With her head bent in grief, she looked pathetic like one not under her control, like a boat sinking under the sea driven by the wind.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: His home was a complex of palaces and mansions served by thousands of women. It was an abode of different flocks of birds. It had captivating pillars studded with gold, crystals, silver, diamonds and vaiduryas. It resounded with wonderful sounds of drums. Its golden entrances were glittering.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: His home was a complex of palaces and mansions served by thousands of women. It was an abode of different flocks of birds. It had captivating pillars studded with gold, crystals, silver, diamonds and vaiduryas. It resounded with wonderful sounds of drums. Its golden entrances were glittering.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He ascended the wonderful golden staircase taking Sita along with him.Beautiful looked the rows of mansions with silver and ivory windows and golden trellis.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He ascended the wonderful golden staircase taking Sita along with him.Beautiful looked the rows of mansions with silver and ivory windows and golden trellis.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The tenheaded Ravana showed Sita, the princess from Mithila the floors with wonderful crystals.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana showed Sita who was overwhelmed with sorrow, stepwells surrrounded by various trees and tanks.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The sinful Ravana showed Sita, princess of Videha, the best of all his mansions in order to allure her, saying:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Sita, leaving aside children and the aged, I am the lord of crores of nightrangers in addition to ten crore demons and twentytwo crore terrorists.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: For me alone there are a thousand attendants.The  administration of the kingdom and all my subjects will be under your control. O largeeyed Sita you are dearer to me than my life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: For me alone there are a thousand attendants.The  administration of the kingdom and all my subjects will be under your control. O largeeyed Sita you are dearer to me than my life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Sita dear  be my chief queen among the many thousands of women I have married.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Do not think otherwise. Be good and accept my request. I am consumed by thoughts of you. You should be gracious to me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This Lanka extending to a hundred yojanas and surrounded by the sea is vulnerable to neither demons nor gods including Indra.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I do not see any one equal to me in valour among gods, or yakshas or gandharvas or birds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Of what use is Rama who has lost his kingdom, who is depressed and leads an ascetic life and who is a shortlived, lacklustre human being.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Sita take refuge only in me. I am a befitting husband to you. O timid one youth is impermanent. Enjoy (your life) with me while it lasts.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lovely Sita, give up the thought of seeing Rama. Where does he possess the power to reach this place even on the mental plane ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: It is not possible to bind  the wind blowing at high speed in the sky. Similarly it is not possible to catch the brilliant glow of flaming fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lovely lady, I do not see any one in these three worlds who can, by his valour, take you away from me guarded by my arms.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rule this vast kingdom of Lanka. People like me, even gods and all beings, mobile and immobile, will be at your beck and call.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Drenched with the waters of consecration, entertain me. The effect of the bad deeds done in the past are over with your dwelling in the forest. Now enjoy the fruits  of your good and righteous deeds here with me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O princess from Mithila, put on all garlands of wonderful fragrance and finest of jewels here with me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O finehipped lady, I won by my strength from my brother Vaisravana (Kubera) an aerial chariot called Pushpaka shining with the radiance of the Sun.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Sita that excellent chariot is big and beautiful. Where on you can roam happily along with me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O heavyhipped lady your face which is a clean lotus pleasing to the eye has lost its shine, stricken with grief.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As Ravana went on speaking thus, Sita covered her beautiful, moonlike face with the edge of her garment and stood shedding tears.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Sita was lost in thought, feeling ill at lase, looking wretched with her beauty dulled by her anxiety, the sinful lord of the demons continued :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Sita you need not feel shamed that it is a violation of righteous conduct. Take it as godsend which has the approval of sages.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am bowing down, pressing my heads at your shining feet. I am at your mercy. Grant me your favourI will remain your slave and remain ever under your control.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My throat has dried up. I have spoken these words in a forlorn state. Ravana has never bowed down to a woman in obeisance.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having said this to the daughter of Janaka, the tenheaded Ravana who had fallen under the control of Yama, lord of death, misconceived that she had become his own. इतयार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fiftyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 55 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus addressed by Ravana, Sita, immersed in deep sorrow and unafraid of him, placed  a blade of grass between her and him (intending not to speak to him  straight) and replied:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama is a son of  the renowned king Dasaratha, who was a firm ambankment (protector) of righteousness and was true to his promise.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The longarmed, largeeyed Rama is famous in all the three worlds. He is my husband, a righteous soul and a god to all.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The brilliant Rama of the Ikshvaku dynasty with the lion's shoulders will come with his brother Lakshmana and take away your life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Had you abducted me forcibly in his presence, you would have been lying down dead just as Khara in Janasthana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Those dreadful, mighty demons you have described are ineffective in his presence just like the serpents who with their venom are ineffective  in the presence of  Suparna (Garuda).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The goldtipped arrows released from his bowstring will shatter your body like the waves erode the banks of river Ganga.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Ravana, even if you stand invulnerable to gods and demons, you will not come out alive in the combat with Rama with whom you have earned great enmity.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Powerful Rama will put an end to whatever little life you are left with. Just as a beast tied to a sacrificial post, you will not  survive.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O demon, you will be completely consumed if Rama looks at you with eyes burning in anger.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He who can bring down the Moon to the earth from the sky or even dash it down, he who can drain the sea dry will definitely release me from here.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Your life is coming to an end. Your fortunes will wane, your strength will be sapped. Your senses will be dissipated. By your deeds Lanka will attain widowhood.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This evil deed(of abduction) will not yield happy results.You have brought me from my husband from the forest without any forethought.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My effulgent, valiant husband armed with divine power resides fearlessly in the desolate Dandaka.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He will remove your pride, your power, your valour and haughtiness from your limbs with a shower of arrows in the fight.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When destruction draws near, people being prompted by time start commiting blunders in their deeds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You vilest of demons, since you have assaulted me, the time of your death and destruction of all demons and of all women in the harem has drawn near.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The sacrificial altar adorned with ladles and vessels and sanctified by the sacred mantras recited by brahmins cannot be defiled by a chandala (man of lowest caste).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lowly demon  similarly I am a chaste woman and wife of the ever righteous Rama who cannot be defiled by a sinner like you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: How can a female swan ever sporting in lotusponds in the company of a royal swan look at the watercrow resting on a grassy land?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O demon  this body has (now) no consciousness. You may bind it or bury it. I do not think that this body or even this life need to be protected. But at no cost can I make this an object of censure on earth (must not be branded an unchaste woman).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having uttered these very harsh words out of anger, the daughter of Videha, the princess from Mithila spoke no more.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having heard such harsh, horripilating words from Sita, Ravana replied in a way designed to create fear in her:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O comely princess from Mithila, O lady with a sweet smile listen to my words. If you do not accept my hand in the course of twelve months, the cooks will cut you off into small bits for the (my) breakfast.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O comely princess from Mithila, O lady with a sweet smile listen to my words. If you do not accept my hand in the course of twelve months, the cooks will cut you off into small bits for the (my) breakfast.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Enraged Ravana, who used to make enemies wail, turned to the demonesses and said these words.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Addressing the flesheating, blooddrinking, loathsome and fearful demonesses Ravana said, Humble her pride at once.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: No sooner had Ravana said it than the dreadful demonesses offered obeisance to him with folded hands and surrounded Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Stamping his feet and shaking the ground as if tearing the earth, Ravana said to those fiercelooking demonesses:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Let this Sita be led into the Asoka grove. There sit round her and protect her in secret (her presence there should not be made public).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There you all bring her under control through forcing and cajoling as one would do to tame a wild sheelephant.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus instructed by Ravana, the demonesses took Sita into the Asoka grove, which was full of perenmal fruits and flowers of different kinds, where trees yielded fruits of all seasons and birds were always cheerful.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus instructed by Ravana, the demonesses took Sita into the Asoka grove, which was full of perenmal fruits and flowers of different kinds, where trees yielded fruits of all seasons and birds were always cheerful.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita, daughter of Janaka, engulfed in grief found herself like a doe under the control of tigresses.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita, daughter of Janaka, immersed in deep grief knew no peace just like a doe caught in a snare.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita had no peace as she was threatened excessively by those women of deformed  looks. Remembering her beloved husband who was also her god, and overtaken by fear and grief , she fell unconscious. इतयार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षटपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fiftysixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 56 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama killed Maricha, the demon assuming the form of the deer as per his will and swiftly took the return path.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Rama was hasting to see Sita, he heard from behind the ghastly howl of a jackal.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama knew it was the horrible, horripilating cry of a jackal which made him apprehensive . It made him think.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The way the jackal is howling appears ominous. May Sita be safe without being eaten up by demons
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If  Lakshmana listens to Maricha imitating my voice in the form of a deer, he, sent by Sita will come for me at once, leaving her behind.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If  Lakshmana listens to Maricha imitating my voice in the form of a deer, he, sent by Sita will come for me at once, leaving her behind.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Hence the murder of Sita must have been jointly planned by the demons. Maricha who had assumed the form of a golden deer, took me away from the hermitage to a faroff place where, killed by my arrows, he turned a demon uttering the words, Alas, Lakshmana, I am killed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Hence the murder of Sita must have been jointly planned by the demons. Maricha who had assumed the form of a golden deer, took me away from the hermitage to a faroff place where, killed by my arrows, he turned a demon uttering the words, Alas, Lakshmana, I am killed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On account of living in this dense forest in Janasthana I have earned enmity with the demons. Will Lakshmana and Sita be safe without my protection? I see many terrible portents.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing the jackal's howl, Rama began thinking how the demon in the form of a deer drew him away. Thus in the midst of apprehensions he reached Janasthana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing the jackal's howl, Rama began thinking how the demon in the form of a deer drew him away. Thus in the midst of apprehensions he reached Janasthana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Dejected at heart, the birds and animals piteously kept the great soul (Rama) to the left and produced a dreadful cacophony.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing such dreadfu omens at that time, Rama hurried back to his hermitage.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama arrived at Janasthana thinking (of the safety) of charming Sita and mighty Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He then saw Lakshmana coming towards him with a cheerless face. When the sad, depressed Lakshmana came near, he saw Rama (equally) despondent and griefstricken.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In this situation Rama the elder brother rebuked Lakshmana for having left Sita behind in a desolate forest infested with demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, the delight of the Raghus, took hold of Lakshmana's left hand, and in sadness said these sweet harsh words :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O gentle Lakshmana you are to blame for coming here, leaving Sita behind. Alas will she be safe now?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O heroic Lakshmana I see many inauspicious omens. I think Sita might have been lost or eaten away by the demons of the forest. There is no doubt about it.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O heroic Lakshmana I see many inauspicious omens. I think Sita might have been lost or eaten away by the demons of the forest. There is no doubt about it.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, a tiger among men, will we be able to see the daughter of Janaka, living in a state of total wellbeing? Will we be able to get her back ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O  mighty Lakshmana  from the way the beasts, jackals and birds too have turned in the bright direction of the Sun, crying in a frightful manner, can we hope princess Sita is safe ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Appearing in the guise of a deer, this demon allured me to a great distance. With much effort he was somehow killed. but he assumed his demoniac form while dying.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With my heart dejected and depressed, my left eye throbbing, O Lakshmana, I have no doubt that Sita is either abducted or dead or abandoned on the way. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fiftyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 57 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, son of Dasaratha, the righteous self, saw Lakshmana downcast and dejected. Seeing him  without Sita, Rama enquired:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Where is that princess from Videha who accompanied me when I entered Dandaka forest ? Why have you come here leaving her behind ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Where is that princess from Videha, a sharer of my sorrows, Sita of slender waist who followed this hapless prince disloged from the kingdom into the Dandaka forest?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O warrior Lakshmana where is that Sita without whom I have no interest to live for a moment, who was like the daughter of a god and a sustainer of my life?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana I desire no lordship of the gods  or of the entire earth without that daughter of Janaka, that lady of golden complexion.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O gentle Lakshmana I wonder if Vaidehi, who is dearer to me than my life is still alive I hope my banishment from the kingdom is not going to prove false.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Saumitri when I am dead on account of Sita, and you are back, Kaikeyi with her desire fulfilled will be happy, indeed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O handsome one  I wonder if that lady of renunciation, Kausalya with her son dead, will have to serve Kaikeyi whose desire would be fulfilled, and who will enjoy the power of the throne in the company of her son
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, only if Vaidehi is alive will I enter the cottage again or else I will give up my life if that virtuous lady is no more.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I will die if Sita, princess from Videha, is not there to speak to me with her sweet smile when I return to the cottage, O Lakshmana
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Tell me, O Lakshmana   if Sita is alive or not, whether she was eaten up by demons when you were off your guard.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Vaidehi is delicate, young and she has never faced any sorrow.She will be certainly disheartened due to separation from me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The evilminded, wicked demon calling out loudly 'O Lakshmana' must have by all means instilled fear in your mind.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am afraid, Vaidehi, frightened by hearing the voice which was like mine sent you to see me, and you came all at once.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You have definitely done a great mistake by leaving Sita alone in the forest. This has given a chance to the cruel demons to wreak revenge.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The dreadful, carnivorous demons aggrieved over my murder of Khara must have undoubtedly killed Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O destroyer of enemies  I am completely drowned in sorrow. What can I do at this moment. Alas, I am destined to suffer.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While thus brooding over the beautiful Sita, the scion of the Raghus along with Lakshmana hurried towards Janasthana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus blaming his dejected brother, the valiant Rama entered the hermitage, sighing deeply, his face pale and his throat dried up with hunger, exhaustion and thirst. Reaching his dwellingplace, he found it empty. He thoroughly searched the hermitage and the places where she used to move about on the premises. And 'so it has happened', he sadly said to himself, his hair raised on end. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fiftyeighth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 58 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, the delight of the Raghus, once again questioned Lakshmana who had come out of the hermitage, deeply hurt:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Why did you come, leaving the princess from Mithila alone in the forest when I had left her under your trust ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When I saw you, O Lakshmana, coming without Sita, my mind was oppressed with evil thought which have come true.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, as I saw you from a distance without Sita, my left eye, my shoulder and my heart throbbed.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus addressed, virtuous Lakshmana, overwhelmed with sorrow replied to the grief stricken Rama:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I did not leave her on my own nor have I  come here of my own accord. I came to you, provoked by her angry  words.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Uttered loudly, 'Alas Sita, Alas, Lakshmana, save me', as if these were the words of your noble self, reached Sita's ears.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The princess from Mithila heard this cry of pain and, wild with fear, urged me out of her love for you to go.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When I was repeated asked to go, I said this in order to instil confidence in the princess from Mithila :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'No one  can cause fear in Rama. I do not see any demon who can hold a threat to him. Give up fear. Some one might have said it.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'How can Rama who is capable of saving even gods speak such unworthy, demeaning words, 'Save me, O Sita'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O fair lady, for some reason some demon  has uttered these words 'Save me, save me' adapting my brother's voice.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Lakshmana, save me' are the words uttered in an altered tone. Like an ordinary, lowborn woman you are not to feel concerned for this.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You should not feel agitated or dispirited. Be composed. There is no one either born or going to be born in the three worlds who can defeat Rama in war. He cannot be conquered in a battle even by gods led by indra.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You should not feel agitated or dispirited. Be composed. There is no one either born or going to be born in the three worlds who can defeat Rama in war. He cannot be conquered in a battle even by gods led by indra.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Deluded by her senses, Vaidehi said these words, shedding tears when I  tried to console  her:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You have an extremely sinful intention of getting me  when your brother is dead. But you will not be able to gain me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Since you are not reaching out to Rama who is helplessly crying for his rescue, you must have followed Rama, instructed by Bharata (to do him harm)'৷৷
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are an enemy moving in disguise with an interest in me. You are waiting for an opportunity to set aside Rama. That is why you are not rushing to him.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: At these words from the princess of Videha, I came out of the hermitage in an agitated mood with my eyes turned red and lips quivering in anger.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To Lakshmana thus reporting, Rama, overcome with grief, said,(Even then) O noble brother your coming here, leaving her behind, is a wrong step taken.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You have come out of the hermitage provoked by Maithili's angry words, even though you are aware that I am capable of warding off the demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am not happy with you as you have come here deserting Sita on the plea that she was angry and spoke harsh words.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Provoked by the words of Sita spoken in anger you came without respecting my orders. It is definitely an act of disobedience.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This demon who misled me in the guise of a deer and took me away from the hermitage, lies dead, killed by my arrow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Bending the bow I fixed the arrow and released it at ease. Hit by that arrow he gave up his guise of the deer and assuming the form of a demon with a bracelet on his arm fell down groaning.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hit by the arrow, the demon imitating my voice cried out in desperation which could be clearly audible even from a distance. On hearing the dreadful words you deserted Sita and came here. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनषष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fiftyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As  Rama was returning( to the hermitage), his left eye throbbed repeatedly  and he stumbled and his body trembled.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As inauspicious omens appeared again and again, doubting if all is well with Sita, he said to himself, Can Sita be safe?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Anxious to see Sita, he hastened to the hermitage and finding it empty, became restless.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, the delight of the Raghu dynasty, hurtled in, turning round, throwing his hands to and fro, casting his looks all around the cottage where she used to move. The cottage, devoid of Sita looked like a lotuspond, the beauty of its lotuses destroyed by winter.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, the delight of the Raghu dynasty, hurtled in, turning round, throwing his hands to and fro, casting his looks all around the cottage where she used to move. The cottage, devoid of Sita looked like a lotuspond, the beauty of its lotuses destroyed by winter.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The trees with flowers withered, the animals and birds turned pale looked as if they were weeping. Bereft of their beauty they wore a ruinous look. The sylvan deities had left.  The deerskin and kusa grass were strewn here and there, the grass cushions and straw mats lay scattered. Seeing his cottage so desolate Rama wept again and again.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The trees with flowers withered, the animals and birds turned pale looked as if they were weeping. Bereft of their beauty they wore a ruinous look. The sylvan deities had left.  The deerskin and kusa grass were strewn here and there, the grass cushions and straw mats lay scattered. Seeing his cottage so desolate Rama wept again and again.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Timid Sita might have been abducted or dead or crushed or eaten up by demons. Or, she may be hiding for protection in the forest'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Maybe she has gone to pluck flowers or fruits. Or to the lotuspond or river to  fetch water.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He ransacked the forest, yet did not find his beloved. He  appeared like a mad man, his eyes turned red with tears of sorrow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Running from tree to tree, hill to hill, and river to river and weeping, Rama was immersed in a sea of sorrow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Kadamba tree, tell me if you have seen my beloved with a fair face and with love for kadamba flowers.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Bilva tree, tell me if you have seen a lady delicate like your tender leaf, dressed in yellow silk, a lady whose breasts are round like Bilva fruits.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Arjuna tree, tell me if you know a timid lady, daughter of Janaka and my beloved, fond of Arjuna tree. Is the living or not ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This Kakubha tree rich with tender leaves and flowers (perhaps)knows Maithili whose thighs are beautiful like the trunk of the Kakubha tree.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This great Tilaka tree round which bees bumble surely knows the lady who loves to put tilaka marks on the forehead.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Ashoka tree, dispeller of sorrow, by quickly showing me my darling make me ashoka (free from sorrow) as I am griefstricken at heart.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Palmyra tree be kind to me and tell me if you have seen my beautiful beloved who has breasts like ripe palmyra fruit?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Jambu tree, do not hesitate to tell me if you know Sita whose body shines lovely like gold.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Karnikara tree with flowers in full bloom, tell me if you have seen my faithful beloved who is fond of karnikara flowers.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Renowned Rama, like a madman confused, approached the Mango, Kadamba , Sal and Jackfruit, Dhava, Champak, Ketaki trees and Pomegranate, Jasmine and Madhavi creepers, in order to make similar queries.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Renowned Rama, like a madman confused, approached the Mango, Kadamba , Sal and Jackfruit, Dhava, Champak, Ketaki trees and Pomegranate, Jasmine and Madhavi creepers, in order to make similar queries.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Or,  O deer do you know about Maithili who has the eyes of a fawn? My beloved who has the restless eyes of a doe may be found in their company.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O elephant tell me if you have seen her whose thighs are like the trunk of an elephant. O best of elephants, tell me if you know her.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O tiger tell me freely and fearlessly if you have seen my beloved princess from Mithila with a face like the moon.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lotus eyed darling, why are you running away? I have already seen you.  Why are you hiding behind trees and not replying to me?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O my beautiful beloved, stay, stay  Have you no compassion for me ? You are so fond of fun. Why do you avoid me?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lady of lovely complexion, I can see your yellow silk (flying), while you are running away. If you have love for me, stay on.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lady with a sweet smile I have never hurt you. When I am in difficulty it does not behove you to ignore me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: It is clear that separated from me, the body of my young beloved is torn off and eaten away by carnivorous demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Her beautiful face with her sparkling teeth and lips, wellshaped nose, shining earrings has been like the full moon, eclipsed and rendered pale.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: That delicate, beautiful neck of my beloved having the complexion of a champak flower and adorned with necklaces was perhaps eaten up.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Her arms, delicate like tender leaves, their tips (fingers) quivering, adorned with armlets and bracelets have surely been eaten away.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The young lady having many relations, forsaken by me, has been (perhaps) picked up by a demon for food and later abandoned halfeaten.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O longarmed Lakshmana, are you able to see my beloved anywhere? O noble lady, O darling, where have you gone? O Sita  SIta
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama ran from forest to forest, now jumping, now taking strong strides, but all the time weeping, a madman busy in search of his beloved.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He rushed through forests, rivers, hills and mountain streams and through dense jungles with an unstable mind.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama went about the vast forest searching for the princess from Mithila all over not giving up hope of finding her. He continued to make great efforts for searching his beloved. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, son of Dasaratha, saw the empty cottage devoid of Sita. The mats were displaced. He searched everywhere but unable to see Vaidehi lifted his lovely arms and said:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, son of Dasaratha, saw the empty cottage devoid of Sita. The mats were displaced. He searched everywhere but unable to see Vaidehi lifted his lovely arms and said:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O son of Sumitra, where is my beloved ? Where did she go? By whom was she abducted? Or, devoured? O Lakshmana
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Sita if you intend to make fun by hiding behind a tree, I tell you it is enough. Stop it and come to this extremely sorrowful man.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O gentle  Sita those fawns who trusted you and played with you, are now separated from you. Brooding over you, their eyes are brimming with tears.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, I cannot live without Sita. I am filled with deep grief on account of Sita's abduction. My late father, the king will certainly see me in the other world (I will definitely commit suicide).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My father say will surely in the other world: Without completing the appointed period of the vow taken, how could you come here ? Fie upon you  You are irresponsible. You are ignoble. You are a liar.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My father say will surely in the other world: Without completing the appointed period of the vow taken, how could you come here ? Fie upon you  You are irresponsible. You are ignoble. You are a liar.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lovely lady where have you gone, leaving me here like fame deserting a crook? I am helpless griefstricken, pitiable, pathetic and disappointed. O lady of slender waist, leave me not. Separated from you, I will give up my life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lovely lady where have you gone, leaving me here like fame deserting a crook? I am helpless griefstricken, pitiable, pathetic and disappointed. O lady of slender waist, leave me not. Separated from you, I will give up my life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Deeply distressed, Rama who was anxious to see Sita, daughter of Janaka, wailed and wailed but could not see her.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana, dedicated to his wellbeing, spoke to Rama, son of Dasaratha, who was sinking like an elephant into the quagmire, when he failed to trace Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana, dedicated to his wellbeing, spoke to Rama, son of Dasaratha, who was sinking like an elephant into the quagmire, when he failed to trace Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O longarmed, heroic Rama, do not grieve. This forest is full of caves. Let us try together.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sita is madly in love with the forest. She might have entered deep into the jungle or into a fully blossomed lotuspond.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Maybe she has gone to take a dip in the river full of reeds and fishes  Or has hidden somewhere for the sake of fun.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best of men, maybe Vaidehi has hidden in the forest intending to scare you and me. She wishes to test our love. O blessed Rama let us ransack the forest immediately.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O scion of the Kakutsthas, let us search all over the forest if you please. Do not indulge in sorrow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Lakshmana consoled him so affectionately Rama became composed. He continued the search with Lakshmana, son of Sumitra.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The two sons of Dasaratha went on searching for Sita in forests, mountains, rivers, ponds everywhere.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: They were not able to find Sita even though they searched all over the mountain slopes, caves and peaks.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: After searching her all over, Rama said  Saumitri, I am unable to find the noble Vaidehi on the mountain
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Going about the Dandaka forest Lakshmana, consumed by sorrow, said  to his brother, glowing with brilliance:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O longarmed brother O wise sire  just as Visnu obtained the earth by binding Bali you will obtain Sita certainly.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having been addressed thus by Lakshmana, Raghava with a griefstriken heart said these piteous words :' Lakshmana,having  spoken like that very affectionately to Rama,who was disturbed by excessive grief said these words piteously:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O wise Lakshmana I have searched the entire forest, the ponds with fully blossomed lotuses, the mountains with many caves and streams. But could not see Vaidehi who is dearer to me than my life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O wise Lakshmana I have searched the entire forest, the ponds with fully blossomed lotuses, the mountains with many caves and streams. But could not see Vaidehi who is dearer to me than my life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus tormented by the abduction of Sita, Rama felt dejected and cried.Overpowered by grief he lost his consciousness for a moment.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: By grief tormented, limbs enervated, intellect atrophied, senses switched off, he felt anxious and depressed and sighed long and hot.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, his throat choked, shed propuse tears, sighing, O my darling.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Lakshmana, the knower of dharma and a dear friend offered obeisance most humbly with folded palms and consoled Rama in many ways.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Without caring  for the words from the lips of Lakshmana, Rama sobbed loudly, unable to see his beloved Sita. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकषष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The righteous, the longarmed,lotuseyed Rama, unable to see Sita wept with his senses overwhilmed by grief.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Under the spell of Cupid, Rama uttered such words in grief which are otherwise unutterable. As if he was seeing Sita (before him) which was not a fact.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O my beloved  as you love flowers you are hiding your body behind the branches of the Ashoke tree that enhances my sorrow (paradoxically).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Devi I can see both your thighs which resemble banana trunk hidden behind a banana plant. It is not possible for you to hide them from me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O gentle one  you are wandering in the karnikara garden, laughing and making fun. Enough of this , that causes my pain.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O my dear Sita, why are you joking when I am exhausted? Such fun cannot be relished  now.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O darling  joking specially in a hermitage  is not appreciated. I know your nature.You love fun. O largeeyed Sita, come here. This cottage of yours is empty.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana surely Sita is either devoured by demons or abducted. When I am weeping like this she is not coming to me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, these herds of deer with their eyes filled with tears are as if telling me that she is eaten away by the demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Alas, my noble lady, where have you gone? O chaste lady of excellent complexion, that queen Kaikeyi's desire will be fulfilled now.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I left home with Sita. How can I reenter the inner apartment without her ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: By Sita's abduction it will be  clear to the world that I lack manliness and compassion. My cowardly nature will clearly manifest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: After completing the period of my exile when Janaka , king of Mithila, enquires of her welfare how can I face him?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If the king of Videha sees me without her, he will surely be distressed and will fall into a swoon for the love of his daughter.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Or else, I will not go to the city ruled by Bharata. Without Sita even heaven will be empty for me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Go to the auspicious city of Ayodhya, leaving me here in the woods. I can never live without Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While embracing Bharata tightly, repeat my words, 'You are permitted by Rama to rule the earth.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My mother Kaikeyi, Sumitra and Kausalya  should also be offered due obeisance. You should protect them with great effort, carrying out my instructions.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My mother Kaikeyi, Sumitra and Kausalya  should also be offered due obeisance. You should protect them with great effort, carrying out my instructions.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, subduer of the enemy this loss of Sita and me should be explained in detail to my mother.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
