input: When Rama, devoid of  Sita, the lady with beautiful hair, wailed piteously after reaching the forest, Lakshmana too, his face pale out of fear and mind dejected, felt extremely agitated. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विषष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Prince Rama, separated from his beloved, lost his senses out of sorrow. Seeing his brother in a distressed state, he sank again into intense grief.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Plunged in deep grief, Rama heaved hot sighs and said these words to griefstricken Lakshmanaweeping:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I think there is none on earth like me who has performed such forbidden acts.  One grief after the other is successively piercing my heart and my mind.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In the past I had certainly done some sinful deeds I often liked the consequences of which have descended on me now as I am experiencing one sorrow after another.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, loss of kingdom, separation from kith and kin, death of father, separation from mother--all these thoughts augment my sorrow faster and in greater measure.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, all this sorrow calmed down when I came to this solitary forest. But with Sita's separation, it was rekindled just as fire blazes forth again with logs of wood.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The timid princess of mine forcibly carried away into the sky by a demon must have again and again cried aloud out of fear in a broken voice.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Her captivating copper coloured skin, smeared with the best of red sandal paste would not be surely pleasing now, drenched in blood and mud.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Her face with her clear, sweet and gentle words and her curly hair falling will no more look bright coming under the grip of demons like the moon eclipsed by Rahu.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The bloodthirsty demons must have drunk the blood of my faithful beloved in a lonely place breaking her neck that used to wear beautiful necklaces.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The lovely, largeeyed lady separated from me in the desolate forest, abducted and dragged by demons must have cried at that time desperately like a female osprey.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On this rock, O Lakshmana, my goodnatured lady with her lovely smile sat with me in the past and chatted with you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Would she have gone to Godavari, the foremost of the rivers so dear at all times to my beloved ? But I think she has not gone there alone at any time.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The lady whose face was like the lotus, whose large eyes were like lotus petals could  have gone to fetch lotuses (but) that also is not possible as she has never gone there without me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Could she have gone to the forest where there are many kinds of trees in full bloom inhabited by a variety of birds? That is also not possible as she is timid and too scared to go there alone.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Sungod, you know all the happenings of the world. You are witness to all the deeds of the people, true and false. Tell me where my beloved Sita has gone or has been carried off. My grief never ceases.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Windgod, there is nothing that you know not in all the worlds. Do tell me if  that lady of a noble race has been abducted or dead or is on the way.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Rama was thus in tears, in a state of sorrow and swoon, Lakshmana who was rational and courageous spoke to him words appropriate to the time :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O noble prince, give up grief. Take courage. Show enthusiasm to search and find Sita. Enthusiastic people will not get despondent in carrying out the  most difficult tasks.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama who carries on the (glorious) progeny of the Raghu dynasty, did not (however) consider seriously the words of Lakshmana, a man of great prowess. Forsaking his courage he was once again overtaken by deep sorrow. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिषष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama in dejection said these pitiable words to Lakshmana,O Lakashmana, go swiftly to the river Godavari and find out if Sita has gone there to get lotuses.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana, destroyer of enemywarriors, went to the beautiful river Godavari with quick steps following the instruction of Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Searching for Sita at the landings of river Godavari, Lakshmana said to Rama, I am unable to find her at these landings.No one responds to my call.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Where could Vaidehi, destroyer of sorrow, go? I wonder. I am unable to trace the spot where the daughter of Janaka could be found.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Overwhelmed with grief on hearing Lakshmana's words, Rama himself went to river Godavari, and shouted, where are you, Sita?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Overwhelmed with grief on hearing Lakshmana's words, Rama himself went to river Godavari, and shouted, where are you, Sita?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Like the elements of Nature, river Godavari did not disclose Rama that Sita had been abducted by the king of demons who deserved death.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: River Godavari (although) prompted by creatures (of Nature) to tell him about his beloved did not respond to brooding Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Remembering the evilminded Ravana's appearance and action, the river revealed nothing about Vaidehi out of fear.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Disappointed by the river and emaciated by not being able to see Sita, Rama said to Lakshmana :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O handsome Lakshmana this Godavari does not at all respond. How can I go to Janaka and my mother without Sita and break this unhappy news?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Where could have gone that Vaidehi, who  removed all my sorrows and sufferings when I lost my kingdom and survived on food available in the forest?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Away from relatives and away from the princess, I keep awake during nights which seem too long.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I will roam about the river Godavari, Janasthana and this mount Prasravana till I find Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O mighty Lakshmana these deer are looking at me again and again indicating that they wish to tell me something.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With his vision blurred by tears, Rama, the best among men, looked at them and asked them 'Where is Sita'?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus asked by the prince, all the deer got up suddenly, and pointed towards the southern sky, the direction in which the princess from Mithila was carried off. Looking at the Lord of men (Rama), they started running in that direction.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus asked by the prince, all the deer got up suddenly, and pointed towards the southern sky, the direction in which the princess from Mithila was carried off. Looking at the Lord of men (Rama), they started running in that direction.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Even Lakshmana marked that the deer were showing and looking at the path lying in that direction.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Observing intelligently their indications and understanding the meaning of their message, Lakshmana said to his distressed elder brother:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lord these deer are indicating the land on the southern side.Therefore it will be proper for both of us to proceed in the southwestern direction. Maybe we will get some clue or find that noble Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lord these deer are indicating the land on the southern side.Therefore it will be proper for both of us to proceed in the southwestern direction. Maybe we will get some clue or find that noble Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Handsome Rama said, 'yes'and started in southern direction, carefully looking at the ground, followed by Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Talking with each other, the two brothers took the path on earth strewn with flowers.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing showers of flowers fallen on the ground, valiant Rama sadly said these words to sorrowful Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, here are the same flowers I had given Vaidehi to wear in the forest. I can recognize them.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I think the Sun, the wind  and the famed earth have done me a favour by preserving these flowers.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rigteous Rama, the best among men, having said these words to the longarmed Lakshmana, asked mount Prasravana, full of streams:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O king of the mountains have you seen a lady with beautiful limbs separated from me in this forest tract ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Like a lion aiming at a petty animal, angry Rama  said, O Mountain before I destroy  all your slopes show me that goldenhued Sita with lustre like gold.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Like a lion aiming at a petty animal, angry Rama  said, O Mountain before I destroy  all your slopes show me that goldenhued Sita with lustre like gold.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus addressed by Rama, the mountain echoed as if it was telling about Sita but did not show her to Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, Dasaratha's son said to the mountain, The fire of my arrows will reduce you to ashes.You will have no grass, no tree, no twig. You will be unfit to be served any more.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana if this river does not tell me about that noble Sita with countenance like the moon, I will drain it dry right now.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Rama was angry with his eyes burning, he saw on the ground as he advanced large footprints of a demon and then the footprints of Maithili which signified as if chased by the demon, she was frightened and was running hither and thither, longing to see Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Rama was angry with his eyes burning, he saw on the ground as he advanced large footprints of a demon and then the footprints of Maithili which signified as if chased by the demon, she was frightened and was running hither and thither, longing to see Rama.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Bewildered to see the broken bow and quiver and many splinters of the chariot scattered all over, Rama said to his loving brother Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Bewildered to see the broken bow and quiver and many splinters of the chariot scattered all over, Rama said to his loving brother Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Saumitri  see the many broken bits of gold ornaments and garlands.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: See, O Lakshmana, the patches of blood looking like drops of shining gold spread all over the ground.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, Vaidehi might have been cut into pieces, and eaten up by the demons who can assume any form at their free will.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, two demons might have fought a dreadful duel at this place contesting with each other for the sake of Vaidehi.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O handsome Lakshmana whose is this huge bow embedded with pearls and gems and adorned with gold fallen on the ground?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Whose is this shield of gold studded with Vaidurya, broken and strewn all over the ground, shining like the morning Sun?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Whose parasol is this with a hundred spokes, festooned with wonderful flowers thrown down on the ground with broken staff ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Whose are these donkeys, with golden chestcoverings, with the devil's face, fierceful and huge and slain in the encounter ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Whose war chariot with a battle flag is this, shining like burning fire, turned upside down and broken?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Whose are these pointless arrows of the size of a chariot axle adorned with bright gold destroyed and scattered ? Who is he that has performed such terrible deeds?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana  look at these two quivers filled with arrows and lying shattered.  The charioteer is holding a whip and reins in his hands and is lying dead. To whom do they belong?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best among men, O handsome Lakshmana see these carriers of fans with head dress and earrings studded with gems lying slain in the combat. Whose are they ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This indeed is the path the man or the demon has traversed. My enmity with him now has become hundredfold. This will end only with the extermination of his life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O handsome one, those demons can change their form at will and are of dreadful nature. Have they abducted or devoured or killed her in this great forest. Even her righteousness could not protect the helpless Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If Sita has been devoured or kidnapped, none in this world or even gods could do anything to make me happy, O handsome Lakshmana
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana even the compassionate and heroic Creator of the worlds will be disrespected by all beings, however ignorantly (if such things are allowed to happen).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The gods will certainly consider me a man engaged in the welfare of the world, a man of selfrestraint and compassion, but at the same time a weak man.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana even demerits turn into merits when they come in contact with me. Just as the Sun shines, effacing the moonlight, my brilliance will outshine my demerits of exterminating all (wicked) beings including the demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana even demerits turn into merits when they come in contact with me. Just as the Sun shines, effacing the moonlight, my brilliance will outshine my demerits of exterminating all (wicked) beings including the demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, neither yakshas, nor goblins nor demons nor kinneras nor humans  will be in peace now.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, just see, I will fill the sky with all my weapons and arrows and make all movements impossible in the three worlds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I will obstruct the movement of planets and the Moon, destroy the radiance of the Sun, the fire and block the wind crush the mountain tops, dry up the tanks, destroy the trees shrubs and creepers and annihilate the oceans. I shall bring about this fatal change at once in the three worlds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I will obstruct the movement of planets and the Moon, destroy the radiance of the Sun, the fire and block the wind crush the mountain tops, dry up the tanks, destroy the trees shrubs and creepers and annihilate the oceans. I shall bring about this fatal change at once in the three worlds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I will obstruct the movement of planets and the Moon, destroy the radiance of the Sun, the fire and block the wind crush the mountain tops, dry up the tanks, destroy the trees shrubs and creepers and annihilate the oceans. I shall bring about this fatal change at once in the three worlds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If the gods do not return my Sita safely to me, O Lakshmana  they will witness my power right now.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana no beings will be able to move in the sky, blocked by arrows released from my bowstring there will be no space left there.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmna now beasts and birds will be confused and destroyed by my darts.You will see them crossing all limits of propriety.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: For the sake of Maithili I will render this world devoid of goblins and demons with my irresistible arrows pulled up to my ears.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Now the gods will witness the power of my arrows released in great rage which can hit distant targets.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My anger will destroy all the gods, demons and evil spirits. They will be extinghished from the three worlds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The worlds of gods, yakshas or even demons torn into shreds by my arrows will not  survive.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If the gods do not hand over Sita to me either carried away or dead I will transgress these worlds, O Lakshmana
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If my beloved Vaidehi is not given back to me in her true form I will destroy the three worlds with all animate and inanimate beings.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: After speaking these words, handsome Rama, his eyes red with anger, pressed his bow, took out the glowing arrow that was dreadful like a poisonous serpent, fixed it to his bow and said these words in a rage like the fire at the time of dissolution of the world.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: After speaking these words, handsome Rama, his eyes red with anger, pressed his bow, took out the glowing arrow that was dreadful like a poisonous serpent, fixed it to his bow and said these words in a rage like the fire at the time of dissolution of the world.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Just as all beings in this world cannot avoid age and death, or defy time and fate so also none can prevent me at all when I am  angry, O Lakshmana
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I will topsyturvy this entire world including the gods, the gandharvas, human beings, serpents and mountains if they do not show me the princess from Mithila, who is blemishless and whose teeth are beautiful इत्यार्शे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकेय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुष्षष्टिमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Tormented and emaciated due to Sita's abduction, resembling the fire at the time of dissolution of the creation, ready to destroy the world, Rama looked at his bow strung again and again, breathing hot sighs like Lord Siva at the end of the creation, wishing to burn down the world in a rage. Lakshmana who had never seen Rama in such anger before said to him with folded hands and parched throat.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Tormented and emaciated due to Sita's abduction, resembling the fire at the time of dissolution of the creation, ready to destroy the world, Rama looked at his bow strung again and again, breathing hot sighs like Lord Siva at the end of the creation, wishing to burn down the world in a rage. Lakshmana who had never seen Rama in such anger before said to him with folded hands and parched throat.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Tormented and emaciated due to Sita's abduction, resembling the fire at the time of dissolution of the creation, ready to destroy the world, Rama looked at his bow strung again and again, breathing hot sighs like Lord Siva at the end of the creation, wishing to burn down the world in a rage. Lakshmana who had never seen Rama in such anger before said to him with folded hands and parched throat.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Earlier you were gentle, self restrained and engaged in the welfare of all beings. (Now) it is not proper for you to give up your natural composure in anger.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In you are always present the grace of the Moon, the radiance of the Sun, the motion of the wind, the forbearance of the earth and reputation.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To destroy the world for the mistake of a single person is not proper. Why and by whom is this warchariot broken with weapons and all its accesories I do not know.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O prince, this place is damaged by the hooves of the horses and the rims of the chariot. It is soaked with drops of blood.Very dreadful must have been the fight here.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O, best of the eloquent  this fight involves only one and not two. I do not see the footprints of a big army.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To destroy the entire world for one individual is not right. The lords of the earth should remain gentle, peaceful and punish only the deserving.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are the ultimate resort and refuge of all beings. Who would like that your wife should be abducted ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Just as pious men do not do anything disagreeable towards persons who observe religious vows, so also rivers, seas and mountains, gods, gandharvas and demons are not capable of causing unhappiness to you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O king bow in hands, followed by me and with the help of great sages you should search for the one who has abducted Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: We will search oceans, mountains, forests and several dreadful caves, rivers and lotusponds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: We will search relentlessly for the abductor of your wife everywhere including the world of gods and gandharvas till we find her.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lord of Kosala when gods do not restore Sita on request, then you can think of taking action at the appropriate time.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O king if you fail to get Sita through appeasement, through humility or diplomacy then you destroy (the three worlds) by your goldtipped stream of arrows comparable to Indra's thunderbolt. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चषष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana, son of Sumitra, consoling the mighty miserable Rama, who was afflicted with sorrow, and was weeping helplessly like an orphan, drowned in great delusion, devoid of consciousness, pressed his feet and addressed him:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana, son of Sumitra, consoling the mighty miserable Rama, who was afflicted with sorrow, and was weeping helplessly like an orphan, drowned in great delusion, devoid of consciousness, pressed his feet and addressed him:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama king Dasaratha begot you by doing a great penance and performing great deeds, just as gods begot the nectar.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: King Dasaratha, impelled by your virtues, and separation from you attained godhood as heard from Bharata.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best of men  if you grieve and burn the world with your brilliance, wherefrom will the (ordinary) afflicted people get relief?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: It is the go of the world. Yayati, son of Nahusa, shared heaven with Indra but because of his curse (for his bad conduct) suffered misfortune.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To sage Vasistha, our father's priest, were born a hundred sons in a day.But all of them were killed in one day the same way.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You (rigidly) adhere to truth.(Like you) the mother earth who is adored by all the worlds, is unshakeable. Yet she is seen to be shaking at times.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The powerful Sun and Moon, righteous entities, who are the two eyes of these worlds and on whom everything rests firmly, also suffer eclipses sometimes.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best among men  Fate spares none. Great beings, every creature, even the gods cannot escape fate.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: It is I heard that Indra and other deities are also governed by the principle of justice. Therefore, you should not bewail, O tiger among men.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Even if Vaidehi is killed or abducted, you should not grieve like ordinary men, O sinless hero
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, you always see the truth. So  in the face of great difficulties men like you, whose vision is not blurred, should not lose heart.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best among men  judge the facts rightly with your intellect. The wise apply their minds and know what is right and what is wrong.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Good results are not expected from the actions of persons who cannot distinguish between their virtues and vices, from those who are unstable in their deeds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama you yourself in the past have instructed me many times that way. Who can be your adviser in this matter ? You are indeed like Brihaspati.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Even gods cannot fathom your intellect. I am only trying to rouse your wisdom your sorrow has sent to sleep.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O bull among the Ikshvakus, weigh your divine and human prowess before you try to kill your enemies.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best among men  where is the good in the destruction of all? Know your sinful enemy before you uproot him. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकेय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षट्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtysixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Even though Rama was elder, he could grasp the quintessence of the wise counsel only after Lakshmana had said it.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Restraining his anger, the longarmed Rama leaned over  his wonderful bow and spoke to Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O dear Lakshmana, what shall we do? Where do we go ? Think of some means by which we can reach Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana said to Rama, afflicted with grief, It is proper for you to (first) search in this Janasthana, covered with different kinds of trees and creepers, and teeming with demons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Here are difficult mountains, caves, valleys, dreadful caves full of different animals, dwellingplaces of kinneras and mansions of gandharvas.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Here are difficult mountains, caves, valleys, dreadful caves full of different animals, dwellingplaces of kinneras and mansions of gandharvas.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Accompanied by me you should search for her in those spots. Great people endowed with wisdom do not destabilise in difficulties just as mountains are not shaken by the speed of the wind.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus advised, the angry Rama fixed a sharp arrow to his bow and roamed in the forest accompanied by Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then he saw the great Jatayu, a wonderful bird, looking like a mountain top, drenched in blood and fallen on the ground.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing Jatayu looking like the peak of a mountain, Rama said to Lakshmana, There is no doubt that this bird has devoured Vaidehi.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This demon in the guise of a vulture has evidently eaten away the largeeyed Sita and is happily relaxing in the forest. With my terrific arrows with burning tips that can go straight I will kill him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This demon in the guise of a vulture has evidently eaten away the largeeyed Sita and is happily relaxing in the forest. With my terrific arrows with burning tips that can go straight I will kill him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having siad so, Rama took his bow, fixed the sharp arrow, and aimed at the vulture. The seabound earth trembled.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: But the vulture who was in a piteous state, vomitting foamy blood, spoke these words pathetically to Rama, son of Dasaratha:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Longlived one  she who you are searching in the forest like herbal medicine has been carried away by Ravana along with my life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I have seen her snatched from you and from Lakshmana and carried off by powerful Ravana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I descended down to protect Sita, and in the battle with Ravana his chariot destroyed fell down here on the ground.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama this is his broken bow, this is his quiver and this is his warchariot all devastated by me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He is Ravana's charioteer slain by my wings in the battle.  As I was exhausted in the encounter Ravana clipped my wings,  took Sita, and flew into the sky. You need not kill me. I am already slain by the demon.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He is Ravana's charioteer slain by my wings in the battle.  As I was exhausted in the encounter Ravana clipped my wings,  took Sita, and flew into the sky. You need not kill me. I am already slain by the demon.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having known from Jatayu the story of his beloved Sita, Rama was full of tears, his grief redoubled.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama dropped the bow and embraced the king of birds. He fell down despondent on the ground and began crying along with Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama saw Jatayu breathing with difficulty in that solitary, inaccessible place.Overcome by greater grief  he said to Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I have been expelled from the kingdom. I am made to stay in the forest. I have lost Sita (my beloved wife). This bird (who was my wellwisher) has been slain. Such misfortune will burn even fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Now if I enter even the great sea, the lord of the rivers filled with water, it will also dry up due to my misfortune.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In this world of the animate and the inanimate there is no one more unfortunate than me fallen into the trap of adversities.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This aged king of birds is my father's friend. To my illluck, he is struck down and is lying on the ground.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Saying such words and showing filial affection, he caressed Jatayu repeatedly with Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama hugged the king of vultures with servered wings, drenched in blood and asking him where Sita who was as dear to him as his life was, he dropped him and fell down on the ground. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तषष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing the vulture lying on the ground thrown down by the fierce demon, Rama said to friendly Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Struck down by the demon in the combat on my account this bird is going to give up his life which is indeed difficult.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, it appears he is frightened and is experiencing excruciating pain in the body. His voice sounds faint, too.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Jatayu If you are still able to speak, tell me about Sita and about how you have been struck down.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Why did Ravana abduct Sita? What fault did he find with me so that he kidnapped my beloved ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best of birds how did her delightful, Moonlike face look when she was hijacked. What did she say at that time?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O father  how powerful is that demon ? How does he look?What work does he do? Where does he dwell? Do answer my questions?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter Jatayu, a piteous soul, looked up at Rama who was  crying incessantly and said this in a feeble voice:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana, the lord of the demons created violent winds through terrific magic and whisked her away in the sky.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O my child  when I was exhausted, that demon cut off my wings and carried Sita off in the southern direction.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O scion of the Raghu race, I am gasping for breath. My eyes are reeling. I see root hair growing on the tops of golden trees.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The time Ravana kidnapped Sita is known as 'Vinda'. The effect (of that time), is that her husband will regain his lost wealth. O scion of the Kakutstha race  he (Ravana )did not know it.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana, king of the demons, will perish soon for running away with your beloved Janaki just like a fish carrying away a fishhook (which causes its destruction).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You need not worry about Janaka's daughter. You will soon enjoy the company of your beloved, Vaidehi after killing that demon.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As he(Jatayu) was speaking to Rama with an alert mind even while dying, blood mixed with flesh started oozing from Jatayu's mouth.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ravana was Visrava's son and Vaisravana's (Kubera's) brother, said Jatayu and gave up his rare life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As Rama was saying to the vulture with folded palms 'Tell me, tell me'( about Ravana) the life breath of the vulture soared into the sky leaving the body.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Jatayu dropped his head down, his feet thrown about, his body outstretched on earth.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Stricken with deep grief, his eyes red (with tears) Rama saw the vulture looking like a mountain. Seeing him dead, he said to Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Dwelling for many years happily in Dandaka forest, the abode of demons, the bird lost his life (on our account).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This Jatayu, who lived for long years, is lying dead now. (The dictate of) destiny is inescapable.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, see this Jatayu, my benefactor, killed by the powerful Ravana while he was reaching out to help Sita.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This lord of the birds left his ancestral kingdom of viltures and gave up life for my sake.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana valiant souls and protectors, being righteous and honest are found even among animals and birds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O scorcher of enemies, O handsome Lakshmana the grief I experience due to Jatayu's death on my account is more intense than Sita's abduction.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This lord of the birds for me is as worthy of reverence and honour as the famous and prosperous king Dasaratha.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Saumitri  fetch firewood. I shall generate fire by rubbing them and cremate the king of the birds who has laid down his life for my sake.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O scion of the Raghus  I will place the body of the lord of the world of birds, killed by the fierce demon, on the funeral pyre and crimate him with honour.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O mighty lord of the birds  by my grace attain the state of those who perform sacrifices, who kindle and maintain sacrificial fires, who beat no retreat from the battlefield and who offer land in charity. Purified by my offering of fire, you may depart for the best of the worlds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O mighty lord of the birds  by my grace attain the state of those who perform sacrifices, who kindle and maintain sacrificial fires, who beat no retreat from the battlefield and who offer land in charity. Purified by my offering of fire, you may depart for the best of the worlds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus said, righteous Rama laid him on the pyre and sadly cremated the lord of the birds as one would do to his own relative.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the mighty Rama, accompanied by Saumitri, got into the forest and killed a huge deer, brought it and spread it as an offering (to the dead Jatayu).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Tearing the flesh of the deer to pieces and making them  into balls, the celebrated Rama laid it on a lovely, green grassy land as offering to the bird.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama muttered the mantras recommended by brahmins for dead mortals as one would do for his father, to help him ascend to heaven.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then both the princes went down to river Godavari and offered libations for the king of vultures.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter both the scions of the Raghu dynasty bathed in water, offered libations for the king of vultures as ordained in the scriptures.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The king of vultures had performed a very difficult and glorious feat by laying down his life fighting. Sanctified by Rama's offering as laid down in scriptures by the seers, he attained a holy, auspicious and divine state of the self.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama and Lakshmana, like two lords of gods, Indra and Visnu, offered libations for the great bird with their settled minds and concentrated and then entered deeper into the forest turning their attention to the search for Sita. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टषष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtyeighth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 68 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama and Lakshmana offered libations (for Jatayu) and went westward, looking for Sita in the forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Wielding bow, arrows and sword, both the princes of the Ikshvaku race went southward and entered an untrodden (densely wooded) tract.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: It was a dense, impenetrable and dreadful forest covered with shrubs, trees and creepers spread all over.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The two mighty heroes swiftly forged through the great forest, which was an abode of serpents and lions.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Both the mighty princes of the Raghu dynasty covered a distance of three krosas from Janasthana and entered the impassable kraunchaforest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Tormented due to abduction of Sita, the two princes anxious to see her searched all over the dense forest stopping here and there on the way. The thick forest looked like a conglomeration of big clouds. It was filled with different kinds of birds, snakes and animals.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Tormented due to abduction of Sita, the two princes anxious to see her searched all over the dense forest stopping here and there on the way. The thick forest looked like a conglomeration of big clouds. It was filled with different kinds of birds, snakes and animals.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then both the sons of Dasaratha, went further east, crossed the kraunchaforest after three krosas. They saw a dreadful forest which was full of fierce animals and birds near the hermitage of sage Matanga. It was densely covered with trees. They saw there a cave perpetually enveloped in darkness which was as deep as the netherworld.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then both the sons of Dasaratha, went further east, crossed the kraunchaforest after three krosas. They saw a dreadful forest which was full of fierce animals and birds near the hermitage of sage Matanga. It was densely covered with trees. They saw there a cave perpetually enveloped in darkness which was as deep as the netherworld.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then both the sons of Dasaratha, went further east, crossed the kraunchaforest after three krosas. They saw a dreadful forest which was full of fierce animals and birds near the hermitage of sage Matanga. It was densely covered with trees. They saw there a cave perpetually enveloped in darkness which was as deep as the netherworld.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Both the princes,the best among men, reached the cave and saw a huge demoness with a disfigured face not far from the cave.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the two brothers saw a fearful demoness who could strike terror in the mind of the timid, an uncouth figure with huge curved skins, with a big stomach, dishevelled hair, sharp and long teeth, devouring wild animals.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the two brothers saw a fearful demoness who could strike terror in the mind of the timid, an uncouth figure with huge curved skins, with a big stomach, dishevelled hair, sharp and long teeth, devouring wild animals.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: She came close to them, held Lakshmana who was walking ahead of his brother and said Come, let us enjoy.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Taking hold of Saumitri the demoness said 'I am Ayomukhi and I have been obtained by you. You got me, O hero, O lord  For the rest of your life you will sport with me on the lofty hills and river banks.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Taking hold of Saumitri the demoness said 'I am Ayomukhi and I have been obtained by you. You got me, O hero, O lord  For the rest of your life you will sport with me on the lofty hills and river banks.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus addressed, Lakshmana, subduer of enemies, became angry, took out the sword and cut off her ears, nose and breasts.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When the ears and nose of the frightening demoness were cut off she shouted in a fierce tone and ran away in the direction she had come from.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The destroyers of enemies, Rama and Lakshmana of great valour went through the dense forest after she ran away.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana of great brilliance and power, of good conduct and pure character spoke to his highly effulgent brother with folded hands:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My arm is throbbing heavily. My mind is agitated. The omens I see foretell some undesirable events.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O noble brother be alert. Heed my words of good advice. The bad omens I see presage perils.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This vanchulaka bird's loud and dreadful screams suggest our triumph in war.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As both the brothers with great prowess were searching for Sita all over, a huge sound exploded as if shattering the forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: It appeared as though a fierce wind rose from the forest and filled the sky.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While looking for the sound, Rama with his brother saw a demon with a huge body and a big belly.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then both the brothers saw a very tall figure with a trunk that stood facing them. He had neither neck nor head. His face was in the stomach.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With sharp bristled hair all over the body, he was a mammoth figure who looked like a mountain  resembling a dark cloud with his voice like the thunder.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He had a single eye that was reddishbrown in colour resembling flaming fire. It was fixed in the chest. His eyelashes glowed. He had instant vision with massive fangs in his huge mouth. He was licking his lips.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He had a single eye that was reddishbrown in colour resembling flaming fire. It was fixed in the chest. His eyelashes glowed. He had instant vision with massive fangs in his huge mouth. He was licking his lips.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The terrific demon kept eating bears, lions, deer and elephants, catching with both his arms stretching up to one yojana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He stood rooted there, catching bears, flocks of birds and deer with both his hands stretching up to one yojana, pulling and pushing them. (Now) he obstructed the path of the two brothers.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the brothers after covering one krosa (2 miles) saw a cruel, fierce, mighty monster named Kabandha looking like a trunk. He had a dreadful appearance and his arms encircled the area.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the brothers after covering one krosa (2 miles) saw a cruel, fierce, mighty monster named Kabandha looking like a trunk. He had a dreadful appearance and his arms encircled the area.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The longarmed demon spread his hands and caught hold of Rama and Lakshmana together by pressing them with all his force.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The two mighty brothers who wielded swords and strong bows and whose bodies were of fiery splendour became helpless, seized by the hands of Kabandha.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Of the two heroes, Rama being courageous was not worried but Lakshmana being younger and not having as much courage, was very much concerned and depressed. He said to Rama:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O heroic Rama see how helpless I am under the control of the demon. Set yourself free, leaving me alone and using me as an offering.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Giving me to this monstor as an offering, you may run away happily. I think you will soon obtain Vaidehi.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, on getting the hereditary kingdom and ruling over it you should always remember me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O  valiant Lakshmana, a hero like you should not get desparate. said Rama to Saumitri when he was thus entreated by Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In the meanwhile the foremost of the demons, Kabandha, rumbling like thunder questioned the brothers, Rama and Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Who are you with bulllike shoulders, wielding big swords, bows and arrows? By coming to this place you have become my food.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: For what purpose have you come? What work have you here ? You have come at the right time as my food, since I am hungry.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Holding bows, arrows and swords, looking like bulls with pointed horns you have entered my mouth. It is impossible for you to live any more.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing the words of the evilminded Kabandha, Rama said to Lakshmana with dried up mouth:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, your valour is truth.We have gone through from one calamity to a greater one without finding the beloved Sita. Now we have landed into a terrible crisis which will put an end to our own life.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O tiger among men see how powerful the might of time is for all beings Just see  yourself and myself afflicted wth this great calamity.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana look at the power of time over all creatures There is nothing too heavy for time. Even those who know the use of arms in war, or are brave or strong enough, cannot  withstand the force of time like the barriers built with sand.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana look at the power of time over all creatures There is nothing too heavy for time. Even those who know the use of arms in war, or are brave or strong enough, cannot  withstand the force of time like the barriers built with sand.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Firm in the strength of truth, famous and powerful Rama, son of Dasaratha,  determined to act with a steadfast mind, spoke to Lakshmana of mighty manliness on seeing him. इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 69 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Kabandha saw the brothers, Rama and Lakshmana, stand there bound by the shackles of his arms and said:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O bulls among the kshatriyas You are sent by destiny as food to appease my hunger. Seeing me hungry, why do you stand there with your senses switched off ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having heard this, Lakshmana, who was greatly suffering gathered courage at appropriate time and said these salutary words:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Before this vile demon gulps you and me let us cut off his long arms with our swords.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This huge, horrible demon with the strength of his arms has conquered the world, and now intends to kill us here.
