output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O prince of the Raghu race  just as the animal brought in the midst of a sacrifice should not be killed, so also for a king to kill any harmless creature is despicable.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The cruel, ferocious demon heard them talk. He opened his mouth and attempted to eat both of them.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the agitated brothers, aware of time and space, quickly pulled out their swords and cut off both his arms from the shoulders.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While standing on the right, Rama cut off his right arm and the brave Lakshmana cut off the left.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The strongarmed demon, his arms severed, rumbling like a raincloud filling the sky, the earth and the quarters, fell down.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The demon with his arms amputated, drenched in a pool of blood  looked pathetic and asked them, Who are you?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Imbued with auspicious signs, Lakshmana revealed the identity of Rama to great Kabandha.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Here is Rama, an heir of the Ikshvaku family, known to the people and I am his younger brother Lakshmana for your information.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He is equal to a god in prowess. While living in this desolate forest his wife has been carried off by a demon. We both came here searching for her.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Who are you with only the trunk of the body, and a glittering mouth in the chest with your calf muscles broken rolling down in the forest?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While hearing Lakshmana, Kabandha, reminded of Indra's words, replied to him in great joy :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O tigers among men you are welcome. It is my good luck that I am able to see you. It is my good luck also that the arms that bound you have been amputated.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best among men hear how I have been deformed due to my haughtiness. इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्ततितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the seventieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 70 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O longarmed, mighty and powerful Rama in the past I was handsome like the Moon or Indra or the Sun inconceivable to all the three worlds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With my appearance, I was a great nuisance to the world and used to terrorise the sages living in the forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With my appearance I invited the wrath of Sthulasira who I assaulted among the many seers, while he was collecting food in the forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing me he pronounced a dreadful curse on me saying, 'You will get a cruel, despicable form.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When I sought to know how the curse angrily pronounced on me would come to an end, he said:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'When Rama gets your arms in a desolate forest amputated and your body cremated, you would get back your gloriously auspicious form.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana know that I was the prosperous son of demon Danu. By the wrath of Indra in the battlefeild I obtained this form.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I pleased the creator Brahma with great penance. He blessed me with long life. Then this pride and confusion overtook me.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having been blessed with long life and thinking, what can Indra do to me?, I attacked him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The thunderbolt having a hundred nodes deployed by Indra pierced my thighs and my head.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Entreated, he did not send me to the abode of Yama ( lord of death) and said, 'Let the words of the creator be true' .
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hit by the thunderbolt, my thighbones, head and face were broken. Somehow I could manage to live for a long time without food.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having been entreated, Indra created in me two long arms extending upto a yojana and set my mouth with sharp teeth in the stomach.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Stretching the long arms in the forest, I dragged creatures like lions, tigers, elephants and deer moving in the forest and ate them.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Indra too had said, 'When Rama along with Lakshmana cuts off your arms in a fight,  you would reach heaven.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, the best of kings I thought it was only proper in this forest and with this body to catch whatever creature I saw.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, I was struggling to preserve my body all the time thinking that some day you would certainly come into my arms.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are that Rama. Be blessed. As stated by the seer I cannot be really killed by any one except you.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best among men I will help you with my wisdom and give you friendly advice when I am purified by you both through cremation on the funeral pyre.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rigteous Rama spoke the following words in response to the story of Danu within Lakshmana's earshot:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My illlustrious wife Sita was carried away by Ravana comfortably when I was away from Janasthana along with my brother.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I only know his name. We do not know how he looks, where he lives and what influence he has.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Creatures like you may help those who, like orphans, run here and there, stricken with sorrow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O hero we will cremate you in a huge pit to be prepared for this occasion, collecting dry logs of wood broken by elephants.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If you really know where SIta has been kidnapped and by whom, tell me. You will be doing a great service.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Danu who was proficient in speech spoke with chosen words to Rama who was a great speaker himself:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I do not have divine wisdom (now). Nor do I know Sita. When you cremate me, I shall assume my original form and will tell you the name of the person who knows it.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O lord before I am cremated, I do not have the ability to know  about that powerful demon by whom Sita has been abducted.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama due to the curse I have lost my wisdom. By my own deed, I have attained this form despicable to the world.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Before the Sun  disappears with his tired horses drop me into a pit and cremate me in accordance with tradition, O Rama
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O heroic Rama, delight of the Raghus, if you drop me in a pit and cremate me as per custom, I will tell you about him who knows the demon.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama you should establish friendship with him in a just manner. That hero of swift action will help you when he is pleased.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, there is nothing that he does not know in the three worlds. In the past for a different reason he roamed all the (three) worlds. इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the seventyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 71 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus said by Kabandha, the two lords of men, the heroes reached a cave in the mountain and lighted the fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana lit the pyre with big meteorlike logs on all sides and it burned.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As the flesh of Kabandha's body decomposed, if burnt slowly in the fire although it was like a huge mass of fat.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Mighty Kabandha shook himself off the funeral pyre and rose like smokeless fire, wearing a pair of clean clothes and a divine garland.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter shining brightly in pure clothes and wearing ornaments all over the body, Kabandha hurtled out happily and instantaneously from the pyre.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The effulgent Kabandha rose into the sky on a famous aerial chariot harnessed to swans. Seated on it, he illuminated all ten directions and spoke from the sky,'O Raghava I will truly tell you how you will get Sita, listen to me'.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The effulgent Kabandha rose into the sky on a famous aerial chariot harnessed to swans. Seated on it, he illuminated all ten directions and spoke from the sky,'O Raghava I will truly tell you how you will get Sita, listen to me'.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama there are six expedients (peace,war,marching,neutrality, alliance, making peace with one and waging war with another, for attaining your goal in the world. Only the unlucky can help the unfortunate.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Along with Lakshmna you are passing through a bad period on account of which your wife has been kidnapped and you, lying low, are experiencing great grief, O Rama
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, the best of friends  you should certainly make friendship with him. As I think over the matter, I do not see any success if you do not adopt this method.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, listen. I shall tell you. A monkey named Sugriva has been banished from the kingdom in a fit of anger by his brother Vali, the son of Indra.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A hero of great selfrespect, he lives with four monkeys on a beautiful mountain Rishyamuka extending up to lake Pampa.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This king of monkeys is energetic with great strength and limitless lustre. He is humble and truthful, valiant, patient and intelligent. He is great.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He is efficient, eloquent, brilliant. He is mighty and strong. (But) he is banished by his brother from the kingdom, O Rama
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama he will help you as a benevolent friend in searching out Sita. Do not indulge in sorrow.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best of the Ikshvaku race whatever is due to happen cannot be otherwise.  It is not possible to transgress time (fate).
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, immediately proceed today from here to mighty Sugriva. Having reached him, make him your friend without malice in the presence of burning fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thinking that Sugriva is only a vanara king, he should not be disrespected. He has a sense of gratitude. He can take any form at will. He is in need of your help although he is very strong.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You are both young and able to do the work he wants. Whether his work is done or not, he will fulfil your task.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Born of Riksharaja, he is the offspring of the Sungod. He has developed enmity with Vali, and is roaming about the banks of Pampa, suspecting danger from Vali.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, with your weapons kept ready, go to Sugriva, king of the monkeys, a resident of Rishyamuka. He is wandering in the forest. Establish friendship with him.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He is the foremost of the monkeys. He knows well by his wisdom all the dwellingplaces of the carnivorous demons in the world.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There is nothing unknown to Sugriva in this world as far as the Sun shines, O subduer of enemies
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Along with his monkeys, he will search all rivers, mountains and caves and will find out your consort.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva will find out the lady of purity and chastity brooding over you in separation in the abode of Ravana. He can send gigantic monkeys in different directions in order to search for her.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva will find out the lady of purity and chastity brooding over you in separation in the abode of Ravana. He can send gigantic monkeys in different directions in order to search for her.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva, king of the monkeys, will reach the demons  and restore you that blameless, beloved consort of yours, even if she is there on top of mount Meru or in the deep underworld. इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the seventysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 72 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having shown Rama the means to find Sita, Kabandha spoke again these significant words:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama the delightful path going westward is auspicious for you. It is shining with trees in bloom. There are jambu (rose apple) trees, priyala trees, jackfruit trees, banyan trees, plaksha trees (a tree from which milky latex oozes out), tinduka trees, holy fig trees, karnikaras (of red and white flowers), mango trees and other trees like dryland, thorny trees, tilaka trees, trees that bloom at night, agnimukhya and asoka trees of blue flowers, kadamba trees, karavira trees, red ashoka trees, and paribhadraka trees.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama the delightful path going westward is auspicious for you. It is shining with trees in bloom. There are jambu (rose apple) trees, priyala trees, jackfruit trees, banyan trees, plaksha trees (a tree from which milky latex oozes out), tinduka trees, holy fig trees, karnikaras (of red and white flowers), mango trees and other trees like dryland, thorny trees, tilaka trees, trees that bloom at night, agnimukhya and asoka trees of blue flowers, kadamba trees, karavira trees, red ashoka trees, and paribhadraka trees.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama the delightful path going westward is auspicious for you. It is shining with trees in bloom. There are jambu (rose apple) trees, priyala trees, jackfruit trees, banyan trees, plaksha trees (a tree from which milky latex oozes out), tinduka trees, holy fig trees, karnikaras (of red and white flowers), mango trees and other trees like dryland, thorny trees, tilaka trees, trees that bloom at night, agnimukhya and asoka trees of blue flowers, kadamba trees, karavira trees, red ashoka trees, and paribhadraka trees.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Climbing those trees or else pulling them down with your strength, both of you eat the nectarlike sweet fruits and proceed ahead.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O scion of the Kakutstha race  proceeding further you will find another forest of the North Kuru state with trees in bloom resembling the pleasuregardens of Nandana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The trees in that garden with fruits of all seasons drip honey. Like the Chaitraratha garden (of Kubera), it bears fruits of all seasons.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The trees with huge branches bent down with fruits look like mountains or clouds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana will get you the nectarlike fruits either by climbing the trees or by pulling them down.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O brave men, pass from hill to hill, forest to forest in great countries until you reach a lake named Pampa.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The slopes of Pampa are without stones or pebbles, O Rama   They are not slippery slopes. They are without moss. The water is neither deep nor shallow. It has smooth beds of sand on the banks and it is full of lotuses and lilies.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Moving in the waters of Pampa you will see swans, ducks, krauncha birds and curlews cackling and cooing, O Son of the Raghus.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Not knowing that they may be killed, the innocent creatures will not be scared of human beings. Both of you can kill and eat the fat birds comparable to balls of ghee.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, scion of the Raghu dynasty  there at Pampa, by shooting an arrow at the choicest  fishes with a single bone, prawns and big fishes, crookedfaced fishes, fishes without scales and fins, baked on iron skewers and cooked will be offered to you by faithful Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, scion of the Raghu dynasty  there at Pampa, by shooting an arrow at the choicest  fishes with a single bone, prawns and big fishes, crookedfaced fishes, fishes without scales and fins, baked on iron skewers and cooked will be offered to you by faithful Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While you delightedly eat the fishes, Lakshmana will fetch you water in a lotus leaf from the Pampa to drink. The waters of Pampa full of lotuses carry their scent, It  is enjoyable, cool, healthy and clear, resembling silver and crystal.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While you delightedly eat the fishes, Lakshmana will fetch you water in a lotus leaf from the Pampa to drink. The waters of Pampa full of lotuses carry their scent, It  is enjoyable, cool, healthy and clear, resembling silver and crystal.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best of men you will see huge boars of delightful appearance that roar like bulls resting in mountain caves, roaming in the forest and coming to Pampa for its water.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best of men you will see huge boars of delightful appearance that roar like bulls resting in mountain caves, roaming in the forest and coming to Pampa for its water.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When you stroll in the evening, you will see the trees laden with blossoms and lake Pampa full of cool water. You will forget your grief.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O son of the Raghus  there you will see tilaka trees, night jasmines full of flowers. You will also see blossoming water lilies and lotuses in Pampa.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There is no one to wear those flowers. Those garlands do not wilt or wither O Rama
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While drops of sweat from the bodies of sage Matanga's disciples fell on earth under the heavy load of forest products they carried for their preceptor, they remained in a calm state. Those drops of sweat turned into flowers and those flowers do not wither due to the power of penance of the sages.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While drops of sweat from the bodies of sage Matanga's disciples fell on earth under the heavy load of forest products they carried for their preceptor, they remained in a calm state. Those drops of sweat turned into flowers and those flowers do not wither due to the power of penance of the sages.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Kakutstha  even now their attendant, named Sabari, an old ascetic is there even though they have left long ago.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, she is established in righteousness, and you are godlike, and revered by all beings. When she sees you, she will attain heaven.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama of the Kakutstha family, you will see on reaching the western bank of Pampa an incomparable site of hermitage concealed in a remote place.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The elephants of the forest and on the mountains do not attack the hermitage forbidden by sage Matanga.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The elephants of the forest and on the mountains do not attack the hermitage forbidden by sage Matanga.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, you will enjoy your stay in that forest which is like Nandana garden, the garden of the gods, full of various birds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Mount Rishyamuka situated on the bank of Pampa has trees filled with blossoms. It is difficult to climb and is protected by young elephants.This lofty mountain was created by Brahma in olden days.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Whatever wealth one dreams of in sleep on top of that mountain he will get on waking up, O Rama
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If an evildoer or a sinner ascends the (Rishyamuka) mountain, he, in his sleep, will be thrown down with asleep by the demons from there itself. A sinner does not climb this mountain of uneven terrain.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: If an evildoer or a sinner ascends the (Rishyamuka) mountain, he, in his sleep, will be thrown down with asleep by the demons from there itself. A sinner does not climb this mountain of uneven terrain.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama, the trumpeting of the young playful elephants inhabiting sage Matanga's forest can be heard at Pampa.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The great, nimble elphants, dark like clouds, drenched with the flow of ichor come together and then separate and scatter.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The wandering elephants of the forest drink plentiful water, pure and cool, from Pampa and contented, plunge into the forest.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When you see, shining like sapphires, the bears, tigers, antelopes who know no defeat, you will get over your grief.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O son of the Kakutstha family, there is a beautiful cave in that mountain covered with a slab of stone. It is difficult to enter.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: At the eastern entrance of the cave there is a cool watertank. On its bank teeming with various animals are delightful fruits and roots.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva dwells in that cave with four other monkeys. At times he sits on the top of the mountain.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having instructed both Rama and Lakshmana, courageous Kabandha, wearing a flowergarland, shone brightly like the Sun in the sky.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Both Rama and Lakshmana, ready to depart, went near the glorious Kabandha waiting in the sky and said, You may go now.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Kabandha said to the brothers satisfied, You may go now to accomplish your task. Then he took leave.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Kabandha assumed his true form, his body shining like the radiance of the Sun. He stood in the sky showing his form and looking at Rama, said, Make friendship with Sugriva. इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the seventythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 73 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The two princes set forth in the western direction towards Pampa shown by Kabandha.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Observing the trees loaded with honeysweet fruits on the mountain, Rama and Lakshmana   went to see Sugriva.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama and Lakshmana halted on the slope of the mountain and then departed for the western bank of Pampa.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Both reached the west bank of lake Pampa and saw the delightful hermitage of Sabari.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Both reached the beautiful hermitage full of many kinds of trees. There they saw Sabari, and went towards her.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing them both, Sabari, an accomplished ascetic, got up with folded hands and touched the feet of the sagacious Rama and Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: She offered them water to wash their feet and water to sip as per tradition. Then Rama spoke to Sabari who used to perform austere penance:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O ascetic   hope you have overcome your obstacles to penance, you have controlled your anger and your desire for food. Is your austerity in progress.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Sweettongued Sabari, have you achieved selfcontrol? Has your mind attained peace ? Have your services to the preceptor yielded results?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Rama asked Sabari who was an old, accomplished ascetic adored by siddhas, she stood in front and replied :
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing you now my penance has attained fulfilment, my services to my preceptors have borne fruit.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best of men, O highest of the gods my birth has become fruitful today with your worship, (you have made) even attainment of heaven quite certain.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O delight of the Raghus, your handsome look has sanctified me, O subduer of enemies, by your grace I will reach the inmperishable worlds.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The men I served have ascended heaven on aerial chariots of incomparable radiance the moment you touched Chitrakuta.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Those great honourable sages who knew the ways of dharma said: 'Rama would visit this sacred hermitage along with Lakshmana. He would be your guest. Receive him with due honour. And you would attain the great, inexhaustible worlds when you see him.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Those great honourable sages who knew the ways of dharma said: 'Rama would visit this sacred hermitage along with Lakshmana. He would be your guest. Receive him with due honour. And you would attain the great, inexhaustible worlds when you see him.'
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O best among men I have collected and kept for your sake different kinds of forestfood grown on the bank of Pampa.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Entreated by her in that manner, the righteous Rama spoke to Sabari who was established in true knowledge:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I have heard from great Danu about your power. If you agree, I would like to see this power in person.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: At these words from the mouth of Rama, Sabari took them both round the great garden.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O delight of the Raghus see this garden looking like the dense cloud. Full of animals and birds, it is popularly known as Matanga garden.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My precepters, who had perceived the Supreme Spirit made sacrificial offerings in this great garden, invoked gods through the power of mantras. They brought water and offered oblations to the sacrificial fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This is the altar named Pratyaksthali where the saints aged and exhausted( by performing chandrayana) whom I worshipped made offerings of flowers with trembling hands.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Rama see, even now they illuminate the sacrificial altars with the power of their penance. They shed light in all directions with a matchless brilliance.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Look at the seven seas, which have reached here at their mere thought as they could not reach them due to fatigue from fasting.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O delight of the Raghus  look at the bark robes spread on the trees to dry after their bathing which are still wet.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The flowers including lotuses offered by the sages while worshipping gods have not yet wilted.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: You have seen the entire garden and have listened what is to be heard. With your permission I would like to give up this body.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I wish to reach those realisers of the Supreme Spirit whom I served and to whom this hermitage belonged.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama and Lakshmana on hearing the pious words of Savari joyfully exclaimed, This is really wonderful.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Looking at Sabari who was steadfast in her vow, Rama said, O ascetic, you have worshipped me with devotion. You may go wherever you like (to the world you desire)
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With matted locks, tattered bark clothes and deer skin, Sabari consigned her old and emaciated body to the fire at that moment, with the permission of Rama and ascended to heaven, her body glowing like fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With matted locks, tattered bark clothes and deer skin, Sabari consigned her old and emaciated body to the fire at that moment, with the permission of Rama and ascended to heaven, her body glowing like fire.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Adorned with wonderful ornaments and beautiful garlands, anointed with fragrant unguents, robed in most beautiful clothes, she appeared like a streak of lightning, her body shining bright and her face contented.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: By virtue of her selfmeditation, Sabari went to that sacred world where the holy sages lived because of their good deeds. इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुस्सप्ततितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the seventyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 74 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When Sabari departed for heaven with her brilliance, Rama  contemplated (about the power of sages)with Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thinking about the power of the great sages, righteous Rama said to Lakshmana,  his wellwisher with singleminded devotion:
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O handsome one, we have seen this highly wonderful hermitage, where deer and tigers dwell together with mutual confidence, where birds of all kinds inhabit.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, having bathed in the waters of the seven seas (by taking ritualistic bath in these waters) the manes are offered oblations in accordance with tradition.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: We have got rid of inauspicious time and good days have come. Therefore, I feel truly happy. Good fortune will appear (now), O Lakshmana, O tiger among men
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Come, let us go to Pampa, which is pleasing to look at. Sugriva, the rigteous self, the son of the Sun has been staying for fear of Vali at the shining Rishyamuka, not far from here.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Come, let us go to Pampa, which is pleasing to look at. Sugriva, the rigteous self, the son of the Sun has been staying for fear of Vali at the shining Rishyamuka, not far from here.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: I am hastening to see that noble Sugriva the mighty monkey, as the search for Sita depends on him, O handsome one
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To the words of Rama who was of stable mind, Lakshmana replied : My mind too is hastening me. Let us get there quickly.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Rama the lord of men along with Lakshmana departed from the hermitage and went to Pampa.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He saw the sacred lake Pampa whose sweet flow of water was used by great seers. It abounded in trees and creepers. Its surface was red with lotuses at one place, white with clusters of lilies at another and with blue lotuses at other places. As such, it looked like a carpet with variegated colours.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He saw the sacred lake Pampa whose sweet flow of water was used by great seers. It abounded in trees and creepers. Its surface was red with lotuses at one place, white with clusters of lilies at another and with blue lotuses at other places. As such, it looked like a carpet with variegated colours.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama reached the Matanga lake which he could see from  a distance and bathed in it.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lake Pampa was filled with red lotuses and their fragrance.The bank was lined with blossoming mango trees and trees of several kinds like tilaka trees with fruits full of seeds like citron, dhava trees, white trees in bloom, karavira trees loaded with flowers, punnaga trees, clusters of jasmine and kunda shrubs, fig trees, so also reeds, ashoka trees, atimuktaka creepors and several other trees looking like women adorned all over. Rama and Lakshmana passed by, glancing at them. There were other trees full of flowers, huge trees, koyashtika trees with reed. Different kinds of birds such as peacocks, parrots, dwelling in the forest were screaming aloud. Looking at all these in that forest Rama and Lakshmana passed by undisturbed with a composed mind.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama saw lake Pampa with cool waters and the groves on the bank filled with tilaka, ashoka, punnaga, bakula and uddala trees.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing different kinds of trees and tanks, the lovestriken Rama visited that great lake.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There were lovely pleasuregardens in full bloom  filled with sal and champk trees. Honeybees on flowers looked lovely and bright. The waters were crystalclear and fragrant with lotuses.The soft sands on the banks of Pampa gleamed. Rama saw them again and again and described them to Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The famous mount, sacred Rishyamuka is situated on the bank of Pampa full of blossoming trees.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The mighty son of Riksharaja, the great soul, the Sun whose son was the wellknown Sugriva, resides on this mountain.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama said to Lakshmana, the best of men, who had truth as his strength, Go to Sugriva, lord of the monkeys.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Lakshmana, deprived of the kingdom I have become a destitute. With my heart attached to Sita how can I live without her ?
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having said these words to Lakshmana who was listening to him with undivided attention, Rama, the best of the Raghus, oppressed by love and afflicted by tears of grief entered Pampa, the delightful lotuslake.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter, going slowly to a distance, Rama and Lakshmana saw Pampa surrounded by beautiful forests full of many varieties of birds. इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चसप्ततिमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the seventyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Aranya Kanda, Sarga 75 of Valmiki Ramayana.
